Reviews.Title: “Shuttle service was great as was the room”
Reviews.Author: elizabeth e
Reviews.Content: The best part of this hotel is Mr. Ed and the shuttle service, as well as the staff at breakfast time. We, at first, had a room assigned that we did not like, but the room was changed, and everything was fine. There really is no "bar crowd" and the ambience in the bar area is "deadening." We stayed several days, and we would return next year. The courtyard suites are nice.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey & poor service”
Reviews.Author: Niki013
Reviews.Content: - Complimentary Wifi : very poor in the whole hotel, even in the lobby, the computers didn't work properly, we had almost no wifi in our room - We paid for a suite, we were a family with 2 kids (15 & 13). the sofa bed was extremely uncomfortable, it was a hammock, our kids didn't sleep well at all. It was an old very small sofa bed, too small for 2 people, we had to call to have the bed made. - It was not possible to book online 4 breakfast but only 2. First day breakfast at 10:00 am no fruits left, no plates, we had to ask all the time for everything. The buffet was very poor. We had to pay 40 US$ for our kids breakfast per day (80 US$), too expensive for such poor buffet.There is nothing to eat. - First day of breakfast we asked for 2 Cafe Expresso, but the second day we were told that it is not possible to have one, that they don't have expresso cafe. - First night some kids played and shout at the swimming pool at 23:30 pm, nobody told them to be quiet, they woke us up. - Second night the next door room began to shout and laugh loudly at 4:00 am they woke us up again. We decided then after 2 nights to leave this awful hotel. We wanted to book a nice 4 stars hotel, we paid the price for a 5 stars hotel but we had a 2 stars hotel stay. We paid US$ 983 for 2 nights !

Reviews.Title: “Great property”
Reviews.Author: Vacation265
Reviews.Content: Just got back from girls weekend - spring break was in full swing but wasnt a problem -property was clean staff exceptional Allison at concierge fantastic- Noor and Audrey at front desk, Chris at pool and all the shuttle drivers (I think Steve was his name) all were great. Hotel is right across street from nice beach with white sand - pack a collapsible cooler! Plan to rent bikes it is much easier to get to town that way. We felt very scheduled having to reserve shuttles to go back and forth but they were a great way to get in town. $20 cab ride one way for 4 people shuttles stop at 11:15. If shuttle is full for a time slot request they add another especially at sunset. It would have been easier to stay closer to town for flexibility of coming and going but having a suite with 4 people and beach was a good trade off. I think I would stay near southern most point next time there are beachfront properties that are closer to Duvall st. Families with teens might like having convenience of everything closer to hotel. Everything was at least 2 miles from Sheraton Places to eat: Camilles a must for breakfast best eggs Benedict, garbos grill (little cart on side of road down street from conch bar) fantastic fish tacos, Flaming Bouys for dinner- exceptional fresh food, the best key lime martini and fresh coconut drinks plus good lunch were at WhiteTarpon. Petes Bar had the best piano players singalong music! Duval st fun bar hopping - Garden of Eden is fun to check out. Sebago tours did a great catamaran trip with good food and great captains - you can negotiate price and they always throw in separate free sunset cruise

Reviews.Title: “I just love this place.”
Reviews.Author: cgslater12
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived on 1/23 and stayed there for eight days. Have you ever started out your vacation and felt like you would just rather stay home... that lasted only about 15 minutes after arriving at this hotel. We had a miscomunication with the hotel and the shuttle did not show up to pick us up at the airport. So we waited about forty five minutes and decided to get a taxi. The ride from the airport to the hotel was not very pleasant because the taxi piled four people in one hot smelly litte car and charged us all full fare! So when we arrived at the hotel I was hot, and sweaty, and very angery. I told Fotis Tsaganis, the hotel manager, that I didn't appreciate being stood-up at the airport. He sincerely told me that he was sorry about the misunderstanding. We went up to the room to decide how long we were going to stay at this hotel when I got a knock on the door. Fotis again apologized for our inconvenience, reimbursed me for the taxi, and then brought us a six pack beer. I have had some apologies from hotel managers in the past but none that included money and beer. The rest of our stay was wonderful. The staff was great and very helpful and knowledgable about the island and activities. The pool and bar area is a great place for getting some sun and relaxation. The beach is just across the street and you can reserve a shuttle to go down town. Once you get down town don't worry about getting back. The drop off zone for the shuttle is at a great bar. You can wait for the shuttle, every half hour, hail a taxi, $8, or just walk . Taxis are plentiful and everywhere. We did alot of walking for exercise, about an hour from downtown to the hotel. Great hotels don't just happen. The reason this hotel is great is because it is managed great. Fotis Tsaganis is a great manager and his employees are fantastic. If you have a problem let them know what it is so they can correct it. They really do want you to have a great stay. The food in the hotel restuarant is a little pricey, but it is sooo good. I had fish tacos every day. I you have never been to Key West you may not know that this little island has some of the best restuarants. Yes fresh fish is on the menu and they know how to make it.

Reviews.Title: “Not so happy”
Reviews.Author: Rydersyn
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 10ish to put room on the "rush" list to check in early....decided to hang out across the street at the beautiful beach and wait for the room....I was misled to believe I would be in very soon....I called several times up to 3:15 & was told it's not ready yet(reg chk in 4pm)....so around 3:45 I went in & they were finally able to accomadate me with someone elses room. I could see that everyone behind me and around me looked irritated as all of them were waiting to get their rooms and heard a lot of complaints about not getting the right room fr what they paid for(single/double)(view/balcony). The decor is nice in the room everything was comfy but it was def not clean...I found bikini liners and food on the floor, the fridge was gross, and the rest were minor details....also both of my remotes didn't work for the tv which was annoying but we were barely in the room so I didn't care to call and complain....it was hectic and workers need to relax and get organized from housekeeping to front desk to security....this would be my back up spot to stay if couldn't get into the other hotels I felt were better.

Reviews.Title: “cozy all suites hotel”
Reviews.Author: beachandtraveladdict
Reviews.Content: sheraton suites key west is a wonderful little hotel that offers all suites accomodations. the rooms are spacious, fantastic for families. i have stayed there twice. they do not offer much by way of a view, or at least that was my case. they have a decent size pool and bar, but the ocean area across the hotel was full of coral rocks and not to my liking. there is not alot of entertainment/restaurants(other than resto in hotel) in the vicinity but duval st is only short drive. would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Close to a ripoff Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: pevast
Reviews.Content: Alright, it's not Sheraton, it's Sheraton Suites. But one should expect more, much more. This hotelexperience was very close to a rip off. Hefty priced and still we had an early booking with good discounts. Rooms were large with both a sitting area and a separate sleepng area, well it was Sheraton Suites so thats standard. But, standard in the room must be considered low, simple furninture, simple material in general. Good bed though. Housekeeping, far from acceptable. Poor job for most parts. Brekfast, no way, far from what you should expect considering price paid. Staff showed signs of stress, not polite, raised voices to customers, bad attention once you were seated. Poor selection of food. Stale bread, old youghort, always wet plates, not fun to put your food on. Coffe machine in the bar area broken for a whole 6 days during our stay! Can this really be a Sheraton?? Nothing good? Yes, funny enough the bustransfer to central Key West was just perfect. Not only because you left Sheraton Suites, but great drivers, service minded, attentative, Free of charge but with a friendly reminder to tip the driver .-). Close to the beach. Far from central Key West. Good parking but keep an eye on your car. There are other Hotels in Key West. Spend your money elsewere. Sheraton Suites has some homework to do first.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go during spring break!”
Reviews.Author: Bioteacher67
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel, a little weather beaten, although that is to be expected on the Keys. The staff was very friendly, the room a nice size with very comfortable beds, crisp linen, a microwave and fridge. The access to the room was a little awkward, involved a long walk to the parking as there are no access stairs on the east side of the building. It has a nice pool, a good temperature, towels, a hot tub. Across the (busy) road from Smathers Beach where loungers cost $10 to rent - think the hotel could have an arrangement with the louder rental guy. The only downside was the Spring Break crowd. Most of the hotel was occupied by university students getting as drunk as possible on the beach and returning noisily in the early hours. I think the hotel tried to put the families on the other side of the hotel to the students - a good idea.

Reviews.Title: “Fine but not great”
Reviews.Author: offshore64
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on Spring Break with the kids. The room was fine with plenty of space; no real exciting view. Housekeeping was OK, but each day there was always that one thing that got overlooked. Most of the staff was helpful, but the dining spot on campus was very shorthanded. The Host was doing his best to keep up, but the servers wanted to be elsewhere. We sat down for breakfast one morning and waited about 10 minutes for someone to show up and acknowledge our presence - no dice so we moved on. The pool is small, and the bin for the used towels was consistently overflowing. The person responsible for cleaning the trash was obviosuly out for the entire week. The bartenders were all very helpful as were the lobby staff. Good location with a beach across the street. All in all it was average.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break 2012”
Reviews.Author: BeachTraveler1025
Reviews.Content: I would probably give this hotel a 3 1/2 based on our stay if I could but definitely not a 4. When we checked into our room with a balcony the first thing my daughter said was great view of the air conditioner units. I probably should have called the desk and asked to be moved but didn't. Could not sit out there in peace and quiet nor could we leave the door open at night. The rooms are a good size...we had a king with pull-out sofa. The king was great...the sofa not so much. The rooms are in need of upgrading. Molding around door to toilet has seen much better days. College kids in room next door were obnoxious...called desk at 5 am one morning to complain and they quieted down. Staff at front desk and concierge were helpful. Bike rental was a good way to avoid outrageous parking costs in Old Town. Shuttle was nice but you have to schedule ahead of time in person and also schedule your return trip. You can get on an earlier shuttle if there is room so it worked out. I would probably stay here again...hotels in Key West are pricey no matter where you go. Would really have liked additional items in kitchen area such as dishes, glasses, silverware and that would make a difference in returning too.

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: WantToSeeTheWorld
Reviews.Content: Very relaxing & comfortable This was the 3rd of 5 Starwood hotels we stayed at on our month long roadtrip and it was, by far, our favourite. Initially, we thought we might regret not being within walking distance of Duval, but that turned out to be a positive. The complimentary shuttle service was very convenient and made Duval Street accessible without being in the middle of the chaos 24/7. Munisa at check-in was efficient and made sure we had all the info we needed to navigate the hotel and the surrounding area. The best surprise for us, was that the beach and boardwalk were right across the road. What a great way to start the day. Our room was wonderful...spacious, spotless and well stocked and Iliana kept it that way during our stay. It was a real treat having all that extra space in the room, separate sleeping, living and kitchen areas and the bathroom....plenty of storage space, large shower area and separate toilet room. Onsite laundry facilites were helpful as we had been away from home for so long. Unfortunately we were only there for 2 nights. Next time we will stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Little Suite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChrisV8
Reviews.Content: We took the Key West Express ferry from Ft Meyers to Key West during the height of Season and wanted to spend a couple of nights. It was very difficult to make reservations,but since we are Starwood Vacation Network owners we always try to choose a Starwood hotel. We chose the Sheraton Suites on the south side of the island. We were apprehensive at first because it seemed so far from the center of the action. But we rented a nifty little electric car for six and it was a fun drive across the island to Smathers Beach. We were pleasantly surprised. The hotel had a wooden facade painted yellow and had a very warm feel to it. Our SPG reservation agent had assured us that we could have early check-in and that didn't happen (their occupancy level was very high). So we had lunch and drinks on the patio while we waited. We absolutely loved our rooms! They wer very spacious with plenty of storage, a mini fridge and microwave and enough bedding to house a family. The pool area was very small, but after all the hotel is right across the street from a beach on Key West where land is at a premium. I would recommend this hotel to families who want to be away from the hustle bustle of Duval Street.

Reviews.Title: “Low Key Done Right!”
Reviews.Author: McNeil J
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Suites in Key west is across a sleepy road from Smathers Beach, which is endowed with the nicest sand in Key West. There's tons of seaweed washed up on shore, but it's great for loungin' and playing volleyball. The hotel is unpretentious and welcoming, with little quaint touches in its decor that make it both quirky and inviting. The standard amenities are all there - fridge, microwave and coffe maker in the room, free wifi throughout the hotel, and a beautiful open media area in the lobby, with plenty of desktops for everyone. The pool is small but very well laid out, and while the pool deck area could be a little sunnier (the buildings surround it), the aforementioned beach is ridiculously close at hand! All of this would be meaningless without good service, and here, the htel REALLY shines. EVERY staff member was friendly and at the very least competent, while most were exceptionally welcoming and accommodating! One got the impression that the staff as a whole took great pride in making sure the quests were welcome, well cared for and relaxed. All done without the slightest hint of snootiness or attitude, this is the kind of service we love - understated excellence in all phases. GREAT!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location and Price Nice!”
Reviews.Author: klh1978
Reviews.Content: Great location if you want to be able to get away from all the noise of Duval St. My husband and I stayed there with our friends and we loved it. We are 30 somethings getting away from our kids for the first time! It was relaxing, quiet, clean and nice. The pool area was beautiful and it was really nice being across the beach. The free shuttle was very easy to use and always had room when we needed it. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “loved it here!”
Reviews.Author: Boston54
Reviews.Content: Came here in the summer and loved it. Yes its not near Duval street, so for some that might be negative thing but i really enjoyed it here. The bar was the nice and the rooms where big and clean. I loved the bathroom and how big the bed was. Plus i loved the sliding door that I could shut if i wanted to lay in bed and my boyfriend wanted to sit in the living room at watch tv at night. The planning lady and the desk was so helpful (wish I knew her name, sorry). She set us up for our jet ski tour (which also was amazing and they have a shuttle to take you since its a little bit of a drive, even more awesome). The pool isn't huge but at night when we got back there wasn't alot of people so that wasn't an issue for us. I would really recommend this place and can't wait to come back

Reviews.Title: “Hope to return-awesome place to visit, great experience at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: zulou
Reviews.Content: We were here with a group and this hotel had been chosen by a member of our party. We were extremely pleased with the accommodations. The rooms were spacious, clean, comfortable and quiet. We found the front office manager, Fotis, to be very helpful. Thoroughly enjoyed our rides into town with Mr. Ed, a shuttle driver with class, and a fount of information (he also has a supply of good coupons as does the concierge). Our first morning there we woke early and walked to Publix (about 4 miles away-there are closer stores and shorter routes if you're not hikers or you can rent a scooter or bike with a basket-we brought backpacks). Bought about $40 worth of fruits, bread, peanut butter, cheese and a lemon pepper chicken which we brought back to the hotel for lunch. We enjoyed the walk along Roosevelt Dr. sidewalk (cross the street in front of the hotel near Smathers Beach). The room came equipped with a small refrigerator, microwave (good for popcorn), coffeemaker and sink. The food was great to have throughout the week for light lunches/picnics and snacks. The hotel does give you a complimentary water every day as well as Starbucks coffee and tea. We had a lunch and a dinner at the hotel which we enjoyed. We were so busy with activities in Key West that we only got a chance to use the pool and hot tub once. Was even able to do some short laps diagonally across the pool. There are a lot of great places to visit in Key West. We enjoyed our visit to Dry Tortugas National Park (took the boat-it leaves early in the morning and this was the one time we could not get a shuttle-they told us the only shuttles running that early were going to the airport. Do be sure to book your shuttles at the front desk, a day in advance if possible.) This is a full day if you take the boat. The trip includes a brief visit to the fort, breakfast, lunch and time for snorkeling. We snorkeled around the fort and saw a school of fish and 6 barracuda on the side of the fort in shadow. We also took a Sunset Watersports catamaran to a reef near Sand Key Lighthouse for snorkeling. Saw a lot of marine life including a nurse shark. Bonus on the way back was a porpoise show which the boat's captain spotted and stopped for. Went kayaking, checked out the view from La Concha Hotel observatory downtown (free for non-guests after 3PM and you can take an elevator to the top-for those of you who get vertigo climbing the stairs at the lighthouse!), enjoyed swimming and snorkeling at Fort Zachary Taylor State Park and a visit to the Museum of Art and History at the Custom House among other things. We really hope to return as there is sooo much more to do and see.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: joestarrs55
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel, . Staff were helpful. The bed was enormous and I think you would have to try and get a balcony to enjoy the vista. The beach across the road is very clean. You can hire boats here and jets skis. There are also a number of burger/ice cream vans on the beach side of the road. I would recommend to hire a bike from the hotel to get downtown its only 10/15 minutes smooth bike ride. Key West has plenty going on and for a sunset sail,which is almost guaranteed to be breathtaking show! I would recommend the smaller schooner, and book from your hotel or online before you go. We did and it just as well, it was mobbed at the key where people were trying to get tickets.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, off the beaten path, but still a good location.”
Reviews.Author: Salvatore D
Reviews.Content: With so many places to choose from in Key West, we chose this hotel because it was a suite hotel and we were traveling with out 2 boys, 17 & 14, and having the extra room with a sofa bed made the stay so much easier and cheaper then sharing a room with 2 beds and/or getting 2 rooms. Also, since it was a Sheraton, and being that it was our first time down to the Keys in 20 years, I knew it would be clean and accommodating. Location: While you will need a car, take a cab or the shuttle bus to get to Front and Duval, the location is still very good. Right across from Smathers Beach, makes this a great place if you have kids with you. Smathers is the best beach on Key West, though that does not say much. As far as the beach part, it is really good, but the water is a bit dirty and swimming is not that great, but that is true for all of Key West. Cabs are $4.50 per person door to door anywhere in old town to the hotel. Room: The room was clean and just what I expected from a recently renovated Sheraton. Lobby/Pool: the lobby and pool were really nice, with a restaurant and outside pool. Overall: I found this to be a great place with some character and just what a key west hotel should be. It is not a beach hotel, or a Caribbean style resort. It is a courtyard style place that offers a great rooms and atmosphere for a great price. Key West is not a Beach Resort town and the hotels represent that. I would recommend this Hotel for Families mostly. Couple may want to go to old town and stay in a bed and breakfast. TIP: Get the room rate with the included breakfast for 2...it is a big savings. If you have kids, alternate eating at the hotel and getting a bite at a local place. You can use the Breakfast vouchers all week and if you skip a day, you can use 4 on another day to pay for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “5 Stars All the Way”
Reviews.Author: angelgloria02
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was friendly and inviting. The hotel property and rooms was impecably clean and there were so many nice extras. They thought of everything. This was the cleanest hotel I have ever stayed in. Housekeeping did an outstanding job of making the room look brand new every day and was very accomodating when we asked for extra coffee supplies. Starbucks Coffee in the room was awesome. Nothing compares to the Ocean/Beach views from every window and the balcony. What a beautiful and peaceful hotel. We can't wait to come back and bring the whole family. The pool area and outside restaurant were relaxing and the service was great. Thank you for making my first trip to Key West so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel for the price.”
Reviews.Author: pattyatips
Reviews.Content: The staff here really makes this place. Wonderful!!! christopher from Jamaica was such a pleasure to chat with at the pool area. Room was nice with all amenities needed. However, if anyone is planning on sleeping on the pull out, BEWARE!!!!!! The most uncomftorable bed EVER! But the beds in the bedroom were wonderful. Pool area is small but very nice and we never had a problem getting chairs. One tip about the beach.........we were told by some locals that Smathers Beach is filthy, that the water is really bad and should be avoided at all costs. We saw jellyfish washed up all over the beach as well so We never took a dip. Shuttle to town was convenient and reliabel....a huge plus. This is not a "luxury"property with all the extra amenities but was very nice and was perfect for our five days.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: thewhistle22
Reviews.Content: VERY pleased with this hotel. We got it on Hotwire. We stayed in two others in the Keys and should have stayed here the entire trip. Some reviews said this location was not so great, but we loved it. Not in the middle of the Duval St action so quiet when you wanted quiet. Hotel shuttle takes you downtown every half hour- just remember to sign up for your spot at the front desk. Shuttle drivers were great- shared their experience of life on the island- handed out cocktail coupons too. it was super clean- our room was super spacious- like an apartment with a separate living area. Service was outstanding and the concierge got us on a rum and reggae snorkel cruise at the last minute. My adult daughter and I had been given a room with just one bed via hotwire, but the desk immediately upgraded us to a nicer room with two beds at same cost. Wish we were here the whole time!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Kelley G
Reviews.Content: First visit to the Keys. We stayed in Key Largo at the Marriott for one night. That spoiled us for the visit to Key West. Our room faced the highway across from the beach, but the view wasn't worth the noise from the cars, beach cleaners and motorcycles. The airport is extremely close and the planes were loud also. Our room had mold issues although the bed was comfortable. It's possible that a room without the beach view would be quieter. The pool and hot tub were quite nice though. The room updates were nice and the bathroom was extremely large and well-equipped. Highly recommend opting for a walk on the beach for the view and get a room near the courtyard or pool. We also did not receive additional soap and shower goods the second day.

Reviews.Title: “1st stay and loved it”
Reviews.Author: jfleming32
Reviews.Content: First time we have stayed on this beach-side of Key West, and have really enjoyed this facility and being away from the busy areas. We brought our bikes, but there are plenty of rentals around...fun riding the island and parking a bike is no problem. Pool area is larger than most of the hotels on the island, and the rooms are lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bridgets40
Reviews.Content: Perfect-across from beach-away from hustle but hotel provides service. Room was clean,nice loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Alternative”
Reviews.Author: swoodson
Reviews.Content: My sister and I did a mid winter get a way to Key West. We researched all the Hotels and B&B's in Key West. It is expensive to say the least! But the Sheraton Suites is a good choice. The property is very updated, smells fantastic when you walk in the door. Our room was perfect for the 2 of us - even though we did not have a balcony - we did not miss it. The extra living space w/sectional couch was clean and fresh. The bathroom dressing area has 2 doors and the bedroom is separated by sliding doors from the living room. We used the hotel shuttle the first day - it was great but restrictive on when to return to the hotel. RENT THE BIKES!! We rented ours from Eaton's Bikes in town - brand new bikes - the hotel also has bikes. We biked it abt 2 miles into town and all a round for 4 days. Its the only way to really see Key West. See Duval Street and then move on. Best restaurant is Blue Heaven - must have the lobster eggs benedict. And their sister restaurant is Salute - on Higgs Beach very good also. Best thing we did was to rent the bikes and stay at the Sheraton Suites. Concierge Alison is the best. All the staff are friendly and really helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Poor cleaning of rooms”
Reviews.Author: patschicagoIL
Reviews.Content: We had a large but poorly decorated room but the housekeeping was terrible. Bathroom floors not cleaned, rug not vacuumed, very inconsistent cleaning. Great location by Smathers Beach away from the noise of Duval St.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: dairocket
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights,very clean and comfortable,staff very friendly,nice pool area and restaurant.The main point of stay, is that it had a free shuttle every hour to downtown,as it can be hectic to find a packing lot. Its one of only 2 hotels i believe to run a shuttle service. I will deffinately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and family friendly”
Reviews.Author: Nellec
Reviews.Content: The courteous staff, beautiful pool area, spacious suites, great breakfast, convenient location to great beach and town, comfortable bed, great pillows(subjective) all helped make our stay a great success.

Reviews.Title: “We Felt Like Kings!”
Reviews.Author: KataD
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights as a part of my honeymoon and we were very pleasantly surprised. The rooms are HUGE. Larger than our apartment in the city. Very well maintained, very clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. The pool area is awesome! Convenient parking. We had a great time! The only negative is that the location is a little far from the center of the action but they have a free shuttle that runs all day so it's not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, close to beach.”
Reviews.Author: Toddvacationing
Reviews.Content: I got this off Hotwire and it was a great deal. The hotel is right across the street from the beach... the suites were very comfortable with two rooms. All the amenities were nicely done. The staff was very friendly. The pool was comfortable. Easy location to get into town plus there was a shuttel. Enjoyed the weekend there and would definitely go back to this hotel..key west?

Reviews.Title: “Best Sheraton we have ever stayed at!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rater00
Reviews.Content: This Sheraton not only clean and updated but the service was very good... Our room was a pool side it was like a one bed- room suite, the bathroom very big clean and updated.. Pool was great, the location of it if perfect blocking the wind and the hot tub was really cool as well..Walking distance from beach.. Will be here again

Reviews.Title: “I wanted a view of The ocean.”
Reviews.Author: pizzaguy4u2
Reviews.Content: Well heres the deal, if you spend the money, you will have an unbelievable view, and by the way its worth it. You do here traffic but that was fine with me. even the non ocean views had views of the pool or court yard. the rooms are huge and beautiful. very friendly front desk and bar tenders.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Restful Stay”
Reviews.Author: e3brown
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights with my son and son-in-law. We had a suite and it was everything one expects from a Sheraton. Large airy rooms with standard amenities. A plus was the free shuttle to and from Duval Street. You have to sign up for the shuttle as its a 12 passenger van. Last return from Duval is 11:15 so plan ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: ERveterinarian
Reviews.Content: We stayed a weekend in the off season. The room was the best we've ever stayed in with a huge bathroom and huge luxurious shower with muiltiple shower-heads. Actually, that's how the whole place felt: luxurious. The bed was soo comfy. The pool was very nice as well with a little waterfall making it more appealing. We spent 2 days in Key West. The only drawback is the location. You really need to bike or drive to the historic area. But the hotel is great, and I would definitely stay there again. Also, it is across the street from a beach with watersports. All the staff we encoutnered were very friendly and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Its not worth the $”
Reviews.Author: ktpolley
Reviews.Content: The hotel is dirty. It needs a major renovation. The front desk seems disorganized. They have a shuttle service but it can only fit 12 people, its a problem when the hotel is full. The pool is crowded. Stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: gaye151
Reviews.Content: excellent rooms. able to view sunrise and sunset. ocean view across the road.courtyard and pool exceptional. high end, pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, awesome spacious rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Kivano82
Reviews.Content: We are staying here with my wife now. Its our third day here on Key West. The location is great, right across the street is the ocean. Rooms are big, with two plazma TVs, bedroom, living room with small kind of kitchen corner, dining table and sectional sofa. Very clean and neat. Staff are friendly and professional. A bit too expensive, but other than that satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Ly B
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay for a family of 5. The rooms are spacious and clean. Pool was nice. Smather's beach was small, but enjoyable. We had our own car so didn't use the shuttle service.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best!”
Reviews.Author: 60805Nancy
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise! Stay here, you cannot got wrong. The room is very clean, quite, and beautiful. The atmosphere was relaxing and calm and the front concierge ladies were very helpful to set us up with different water sports and tours. The only downside is the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Away From Duval”
Reviews.Author: NHBS
Reviews.Content: Large, modern, clean rooms across from one of the few beaches in Key West. While far from downtown, this hotel offers a lot of comfort, a nice little pool, and regular shuttle service. We would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “No Great Beach Views”
Reviews.Author: MocNJen
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife and 12 year old son for Thanksgiving. Iâ€™m Platinum with Starwood and used two free nights stays here. We really enjoyed ourselves, but I wouldnâ€™t pay the â€œnormalâ€� $200+ per night for a suite with an interior courtyard view. The exterior of the property is not that invitingâ€¦but the courtyard and the pool area are very pleasant. The rooms are decorated with typical Florida living room, wicker furniture. The hotel offers a shuttle to the main â€œdowntownâ€� area with all the restaurants and bars, but my family chose to walk as its just over a mile. Plusâ€¦you can see some interesting sights along the way!!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Staff and Service”
Reviews.Author: Rob J
Reviews.Content: We had a delightful stay at the Sheraton Suites in Key West. Our stay was only one night but my wife and I had a wonderful 24 hours that was topped off by a very positive experience. First of all, the room was beautiful, spacious and very clean, the bed was extremely comfortable. The bathroom was large and very handsome. I swam in the pool before we departed and it was perfectly clean, clear and a great temp. We walked along beach which was gorgeous across the street from the hotel . The hotel has easy access to Duval Street with our car and the hotel also has a shuttle. We found out the day following our departure that my wife had accidentally left a piece of jewelry in the room, most likely it fell on the floor. When we called the hotel, they were very supportive and put us in touch with the Exec. Housekeeper. His follow-up professional and polite. He was tenacious about checking the room and talking with staff. The day after our original call, he called us back and said that one of the staff members turned in the jewelry to the hotel. I can't say enough about the professionalism and the integrity of the staff to help us recover a special piece of jewelry that we thought was gone forever. Thank you Sheraton Suites Key West!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel but did not like location”
Reviews.Author: cumberlandga
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine, no negatives. It was a girls weekend getaway. My girlfriend's brother works for Sheraton and we got a great rate. I would not stay at this hotel again but only because of its location. We knew it was far when we researched it but did not realize how much time we would spend downtown. The outdoor tiki bar was under construction so we might have a different pool experience if it was open. The pool was fine but quiet. We were looking for a lil more of a people watching experience.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT place to stay”
Reviews.Author: noname30196
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was wonderful. The beach was right across the street was beautiful, clean and had rentals. The room was perfect for us because of the sitting area and the doors that closed off the sleeping area. The couches were so comfortable, we would sometimes fall asleep of them! There was no art, but that was okay with me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay for the holiday in Key West.”
Reviews.Author: mccainmom
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a wonderful location right across from the beach. We are there right before Christmas and it was fairly quiet. Room and bath area are nice and large with a small kitchenette with frig and microwave. Rooms fairly clean but a little blah as there is absolutely no art work anywhere in the entire suite. This property takes pets which was nice as we just adopted a small dog the day before. The courtyard in the center of the property has trash bags and can so your can clean up after your dog. Had a very good club sandwich at the restaurant. Please be aware it is large and full of turkey. Delicious. However, there breakfast buffet the next morning was a little pricey for what you get and the pancakes were like hockey pucks. When I mentioned this to the server, he said he would get me fresh, I said never mind don't worry about it but they came anyway but unfortunately those were a little hard as well. But the server was courteous and friendly. Lobby was recently re-done and the furnishings are quite nice if you look hard at them. Hard to see how nice they really were because of the holiday decorations. There is a free shuttle to Duval Street that runs until 11 PM for the last return so that is very nice. 10-15 minutes at the most to Duval but you don't have to walk too far or park, so this is quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing room and great location”
Reviews.Author: kristinmomof3
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. We are traveling with 3 children and the king suite with sofa bed was perfect. Seperate room for king bed alllowed us to have privacy. Very clean and nice. Comfy beds! Right across the street from Smather's Beach with activites such as parasailing, snorkeling, sailboats, and paddle boarding available. It is a short drive to Duvall St. area, but the hotel offers a shuttle. We drove our car and did not have any trouble finding parking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: Txloyas
Reviews.Content: Room was nice and clean. Hotel is right across from beach but far from Duval street, bars restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but far from Duval Street”
Reviews.Author: usjetjock
Reviews.Content: Key West classic style hotel located near airport, and across from a beautiful beach. (You must cross a busy highway with no crosswalk) If the bars and hangouts of downtown Key West are your thing, this hotel is 2.5 miles away, and cab fares will add up. Don't rent a golf cart....their is no place to charge them, and parking downtown is non-existent. Nice place, but I would recommend a hotel close to Duvall Street.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Spacious room...but one regreat Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: binnyrachel
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights, and were pretty much satisfied. What we liked were...#1. Location - In front beach, Close to airport, #2. Nice room - Very spacious suit room and clean, #3. Nicely decorated lobby - Welcoming atmosphere. What we disliked were...#1. No swim suit spin-dryer - It had a pool, so we expected one swim suit dryer at least, but nobody knew what that is, and when I tried to explained it, she said.."it may be very popular your country, but not in USA..." what?? I live in USA!! Because of my skin color she might assumed like that. Anyway, it hurted my feeling. #2. Not available late room service - We tried to order something around 10pm, but no room service is available, but frozen food in lobby. It was a little bit disappointed. Except these two things, overall our stay was very good, and recommend to others looking for nice hotel with close beach!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, Lots of options, Crowded pool”
Reviews.Author: southpugetsound
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1) Nice spacious clean suite-style rooms, lots of room amenities, lots of options for rooms choices, typical quality Sheraton service from the staff! Breakfast buffet (for purchase) was great. Excellent location across from the beach and beach activities. Cons: 1) High hotel rate prices BUT it's Key West; spoil yourself. 2) Had a hotel bar but it was closed/rarely open; pool bar seemed to be shut down. 3) Gorgeous swimming pool/hot tub but it was crowded with too many children. I love kids but it's hard to enjoy the pool area when 40+ kids (ages 8-12) take over the pool area and hot tub. It felt like an outdoor Chuck E Cheese. Perhaps an 'adult only' pool for those that just want to lounge/actually swim could be setup in the wasted courtyard space or replace the outdoor bar area that appeared to be shut down/unused? Overall, 'very good' and would likely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: Chny
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms are clean--a bit too cold and not very well ventilated. The shuttle service to the downtown area was convenient. Though the hotel does not have a private beach, the Smather's Beach across the street is less crowded than the downtown beach (or the one near the southernmost corner). The pool and other amenities are comparable with the star level. Not fancy but decent. Mahi-Mahi dish--or such a dish on the island--is overrated and overpriced. Everything else was decent.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeruk85
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at sheraton key west and won't be our last. The hotel was located across from one of the best public beaches in town. It was conveniently located about a mile away from the airport with free shuttles to/from the airport and to/from duval street. Our driver Mr. Ed was very friendly and knowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't have...”
Reviews.Author: mafootje
Reviews.Content: Parking fees, WiFi fees ( rare at Sheraton hotel not to charge for every device which connects to Internet ), no bath but a large shower. It does have two bottles of water in room for free every day, large rooms. Checking in was a good experience especially the personal touch when the Sheraton stepped from behind the desk to our side to better explain the inns and outs of the hotel. Renting bikes is possible directly from the hotel $ 15 for 1 day, $ 10 for the next day. Bikes are our main form off transportation during our stays at Key West. No parking problems when going to the center. Despite the fact there's a frequent free shuttle service from the hotel we prefer the bikes. The only thing that could use replacing or deep cleaning are the sofa's the are ran down and look dirty. It brings down the experience of the room. In our case there where tiny bugs on the sofa also. They came to spray them soon after reporting it but maybe it had been better to switch rooms because the thought of these bugs that caused me some bite marks stayed. All in all it is a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Key West Stay”
Reviews.Author: Frank C
Reviews.Content: The ocean view suite was a beautiful "residence". It's 3 miles from Duval St but the hotel provides a reliable shuttle service ( your Designated Driver ). Nice staff too.

Reviews.Title: “Just a touch out of the way but ......”
Reviews.Author: davidmwildman
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days at the hotel at the end of november and overall were very happy. The one bedroom suite had all facilities that you would need and the local beach across the street was absolutley beautiful. The only real drawback was the shuttle bus into town which was a little old and beat up but more importantly did not run often enough .Would go back even if the rates were a little high.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise found on the beach in the Florida Keys”
Reviews.Author: BOBAPPLEBY
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean inside and out. Location was excellent as it was right on the beach and not in the downtown traffic & noise. Parking was free and the shuttle took us back and forth to town day or night. The staff was very friendly and helpful as well. Meals could be either inside or outside at the restaurant as well as at the bar overlooking the pool. The laundry (2 washers & 2 dryers) was too small for the 184 rooms that they had available. The pool was beautiful and the hot tub was nice and hot. Overall we were very comfortable in November and look foreword to returning again in March .

Reviews.Title: “great find!”
Reviews.Author: MagicianManchesterUK
Reviews.Content: This hotel was chosen for me and I was slightly disappointed as it was not near Duval street and the action but after having stayed there I can't help but recommend this property to the highest degree. Duval street hotels in the 4 star category are around Â£250GBP/night whereas I got this one for Â£125/night and this was for a suite - large lounge area with L shaped sofa , big screen TV and table, a kitchenette with fridge and microwave. Wash area, bathroom and bedroom with another large screen TV. The hotel rm was clean , well appointed and comfortable. The hotel has a lovely pool area and is right across a 4 lane road which is very quite from a beautiful beach and watersports. the hotel provides a complimentary shuttle bus for trips into town, the only drawback being the last one is at 23:15, but a taxi with tip works out at $20, so is no problem especially when you consider the great rooms and price. Due to the hotel being outside the party zone it is quiet and relaxed. The staff were all very efficent and friendly, over and above what you usually experince at chain hotels. This hotel has got to be considered before you book one on Duval street, I don't think you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great time 5 night stay at the Key West Sheration Suites”
Reviews.Author: Hickswd
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the Boat Races and for the 11/11/11 weddings. My son and his wife got married on 11/12. The room was very nice and the resort was very nicely landscaped. The resort is located across the street from Smather Beach one of the few beaches in the Keys that has a sand beach. The staff was helpful and we were able to stay an extra night since we did not want to leave the Keys on a Sunday. The resort does allow dogs. The resort is a couple miles from Duval and taxi rides for 4 people was about $35.00 one way if I remember correctly. They have a free shuttle bus at the resort, but it fills up quickly in the evenings. We enjoyed the beach, seeing and hearing the boats go by and we probaly saw 30 couples all over Key West getting married on the beach since it was 11/11/11. The wedding were of all types from large formal groups to a couple and a photographer on the beach. We did the Duval crawl 4 nights the last night we stayed at the resort and relaxed by the pool and bar area. Overall I was very happy with the resort and will return when I go to the Keys.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Suites - Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: nomadjr
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Suites is situated right across from Smathers Beach and about a 10 minute ride to all the Key West action; the hotel is perfectly placed to enjoy all that Key West has to offer. The hotel has excellent, clean and spacious suites and the pool area is nicely situated with plenty of sun and is themed very well. The hotel offers a complementary shuttle to and from the downtown area (2 blocks from Duval St.); Mr. Ed (the driver) is extremely knowledgeable and can provide you with any recommendations or free drink coupons. The hotel has a descent gym and also has a solid concierge that will help make reservations or recommendations to any of the restaurants on the key. Highly recommend and we stayed with points, which was a steal at this property!

Reviews.Title: “Great property, bad staff”
Reviews.Author: Lily009
Reviews.Content: The property, the rooms, and the pool are beautiful. The "manager" and front desk staff practically ruined our vacation. Complaints to SPG provided no resolution. Stay here if you can't afford to stay in the main town. It's still nice. But don't expect fair treatment from the staff who made us wait until almost 6pm for our room, a LOOOONG wait after spring breakers reportedly left the place so dirty that they had to offer everyone free drinks by the pool. The "manager" made a mistake forgetting us entirely then lied about it, even though people in line after us were admitted to their rooms at least 45 mins before us. A call to the front desk for an extra pillow resulted in a no-show.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Ronlexus
Reviews.Content: Everything great except receptionist were new and had no much knowledge. Also when asked for extra night, we were not offered much help even they had vacancy

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: mycruz
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with the location of the Sheraton Suites Key West! It was right across the street from Smathers Beach and a short shuttle ride to Duval Street. The rooms were kept very clean, housekeeping did a great job keeping the rooms and grounds immaculate. My only disappointment was the internet service in the rooms did not work for the first three days we were there. I mentioned it the first night to the front desk and was told to sit on the balcony or open the door and that should help. On the last night I mentioned it again and the front desk notified the maintainence team and the final morning our our stay it was working in our room. The highlight was our shuttle driver Ed who really seemed to enjoy his job. The free shuttle service was a great feature of this resort since parking in town can be pretty pricey. The shuttle drops off and picks up in one place, very convienent to most of the town of Key West. This is a great place for a visit to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy the stay at Sheraton Suites Key West”
Reviews.Author: Susna92
Reviews.Content: Three of us spent two nights at the Sheraton Suites Hotel Key West. The front desk was very accommodating and helped us book the free shuttle to Old Key West. Our suite was very nice with plenty of room for three people. We had a king sized bed in the bedroom, and a pull out couch in the living room. The bathroom was very roomy with a large walk in shower. The room was very clean with free bottled water and a refrigerator, microwave, safe, and plenty of storage space for travelers spending enough time to want to unpack a few things. While the bed was very comfortable, the pull out couch was not so nice, but it would do for a couple of days. The pool bar was a friendly place with snacks as well as drinks overlooking a very nice pool with a waterfall. The restaurant had a variety of food with a nice breakfast. The entire staff was friendly and very helpful. The only drawback was having to ride the shuttle to get downtown. We have stayed there before so we knew the shuttle would be a little inconvenient, but this time we had to reserve time to go and return or wait about an hour for the next shuttle at times. The shuttles needed work and the air conditioners either didn't work or were so loud that you could not visit on the ride. I think they should run the shuttles more often so guests could have a better choice of return times to the hotel. They really need to get them fixed as it is quite annoying with all the noise. As a nice place to stay, this hotel is clean and friendly. With a few updates of shuttles and new mattresses for the couches, I would highly recommend the Sheraton Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but didnt get what i was promised”
Reviews.Author: bgrant73
Reviews.Content: be careful about booking through expedia. I was promised certain perks when staying here. I even printed out the advertising from the expedia web page. The front desk said because I didnt book through their web page that I did not qualify to receive the resort benefits. The front desk said that they had asked expedia to remove the ads. If I had known that the perks wouldnt have been honoured. I would have stayed somewhere else for the price. Pool was great and rooms were very nice. Beach was bad, smelled from the weeds. Too far from main street.

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms, great beach location”
Reviews.Author: jj114558277
Reviews.Content: This hotel has huge rooms and bathrooms and is in a great location across from the beach and close to the airport. Great food in the restaurant and staff is wonderful! I highly recommend to anyone needing some extra space and doesnt care about being downtown!

Reviews.Title: “Great amenities and public beach access”
Reviews.Author: NCinDC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Suites in late October, arriving the day of Fantasy Fest's big parade. (regarding the parade, imagine a smaller version of New Orleans' Mardi Gras celebrations, but with less clothes, more alcohol, and more gay men) The hotel provided a free shuttle to the parade until 2am, a great service that I believe is offered throughout the day all year long. The location of the hotel is great if you desire public beach access, which is situated directly across the street. (tip: if you want to be in the heart of Key West, I suggest another hotel) Beach access and free hotel parking are the two reasons I chose this property. But there were other great aspects of the hotel: 1) As is expected, the rooms are large, and having a microwave and refrigerator are great ways to save money if you want to prepare quick meals. A gift shop with microwaveable meals is available in the lobby. 2) The pool (with a waterfall) and jacuzzi were nice ways to relax. Our server at the poolside cafe was very courteous. 3) Free access to one of the computers and printers in the lobby came in handy when I needed to print my boarding pass or research local attractions. (my hotel is Fort Lauderdale charged $7.99 for 15 minutes!) 4) I needed to wash some clothes (Key West was the last leg of my South Florida vacation) and having access to a washer and dryer was great. 5) The woman who checked me in (Caucasian, dark blonde/light brunette, 20s) was extremely nice throughout our stay as was the night auditor (African American, woman, 20s) who I chatted with while my clothes were washing. The only negatives of our stay were the periodic elevator outages and introverted concierge. Overall, I would highly recommend the Sheraton Suites, especially for families or beach goers. (tip: if you're looking for an excellent restaurant and you love Brazilian steakhouses, try Braza LeÃ±a on Caroline Street) Full disclosure: I'm a Starwood employee, but my stay was not business-related, I don't know any of the Sheraton Suites employees, and no one has asked me to write this review.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to know the Keys and have fun!”
Reviews.Author: Eduardo P
Reviews.Content: I took this hotel based on the price and recommendations of TravelAdvisor. Was a very good choice, the rooms are very good, serivce is excellent including the breakfast and just cross the avenue to have the beach. Swimpool is not big, but enough to spend some hours of your vacations days. The non-alcoholic mojito served every days afternoon is the best hotel juice that I ever had. For my surprise we arrived in Key West during the Fantasy Fest, was funny, but very different of what we are used in Brazil. There are very nice restaurants in the city and the frontdesk people may help with anything.

Reviews.Title: “KeyWest Memories”
Reviews.Author: MACS242
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, great staff and proximity to all water activities. I wish they would have breakfast included with the room cost as prevalent with most hotels...The concierge was not friendly at all so did not feel comfortable asking all the questions I wanted to.

Reviews.Title: “near Smathers Beach”
Reviews.Author: WVfanCharleston_WV
Reviews.Content: The staff was helpful. After being assigned a room that was loud beyond all imagining (airconditioning units right outside the window), we requested a change of room and were granted a much quieter one without question. The room was clean but seemed a bit down on its heels. A shuttle was available to get to Old Town Key West, but it was difficult to schedule a ride when one was requested. The staff was helpful in suggesting where to park in Old Town.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Kim G
Reviews.Content: My friends and I just came back from Key West. We had an amazing experience. The hotel was clean, and the staff was attentive and nice. They couldn't do enough for us to make our stay a great experience. The rooms were spacious and the bathrooms were nice. It has shuttle service to Duval Street and def was worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, Helpful, and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: mrsferg101110
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Key West at the start of October for our 1 year anniversary. We really were hoping to go to the Caribbean but could not manage the lengthy flights or cost for a long weekend trip. After doing some research we decided to go to Key West. The Sheraton was a pretty nice place! There are a lot of review stating that they hotel is outdated and dingy. I did not find this to be the case. The lobby area is much more modern and up to date, however I feel the rooms are classic/standard of other Sheraton's I have been to. Very Clean! The common areas were incredibly polished. Pros: Each day around 3:30 or 4:00 the hotel serves this COMPLIMENTARY Sparkling Key Limeade Beverage that will knock your socks off! My husband and I literally would have about 10 glasses each day. Amazing! Lizelle Jacobs is EXTREMELY helpful and she really takes the time to answer your questions and arrange your services. It is most def a bonus to have someone with her knowledge available. We did a Scooter rental that was completely flawless and an absolute blast! The rooms are very spacious. The showers are huge. The toilet has its own room, which was very nice and allows for some extra privacy. We had a lot of room to spread out. We were also able to go grocery shopping and bring food back to our room and had lots of space to store it. Cons: Airport Shuttle is horrible. We arrived in and called for the shuttle at 11:20 AM and were told the next shuttle was at 1:30, really 2 hours for a trip that is a mile away? We ended up taking a cab which was $12 ($6 per person). Very expensive! Very disappointing as we purposely picked a hotel with a shuttle service. I was fuming on arrival, needless to say. Ants! We did go grocery shopping and picked up muffins which we put into a cabinet and the next morning it was infested with ants. Roaches! I saw 2 in the bathroom area over the course of 4 days. Not very comforting but we lived with it. Our room did not get serviced at all 1 day. We did not have a do not disturb sign out either. We waited all day for towels to shower (it didn't really matter because we were just lounging at the pool all day). Eventually around 5PM I called down and asked for towels and advised that we were out of towels and shower supplies, someone eventually surfaced with those items -but still our room was never cleaned. Salt Water Pool was not so fun. My husband and I are dolphins but the whole Salt Water Pool thing bothered both of us. We both had very itchy skin from it and found it less enjoyable then pools as other resorts. Smathers Beach sucks, but we knew that anyway so I cannot complain really. Key West is not for beaches. They are beautiful but you wouldn't go for beaches to swim. Internet access is only free for a little bit and then they shut you off and you have to pay. UGH! Shuttle Service was not very friendly, you have to schedule in advance and it only drops off at one part of Duval. I wish they had a pick up at each end. Tips: The hotels food is extremely expensive. Publix is only a few miles away, if you have a scooter or car go buy groceries! Save $! We also ordered delivery a few times from some local spots like Cuban Coffee Queen, $12 for two people to eat + tip. Half the cost of the hotel food. Rent a scooter, it really gives you freedom to go where you want to go and at your own time. Lots of fun and a very effective way to see the island. The hotels is pretty far from a lot of the hustle and bustle. Certainly not a walk. We purposely stayed away from the party but others like to be in the heart of it. The scooter allowed us to go to town when we wanted. All in all, it was a nice trip and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “grant paul chris at the pool and the cleaning staff”
Reviews.Author: neil820
Reviews.Content: it was a great experience to meet all of you yout thoughtfulness and help with all my needs were the best of the best

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cookie4u
Reviews.Content: My wife and I only had two days in KW and I'm glad we stayed at the Sheraton. Check in was quick and the man doing the check in was nice and helpfull explaining the guest services. The suite was very large and comfortable, and very clean. We had suite 355 and it overlooked the beach. We have stayed in KW a few times before and this was by far the nicest place we have stayed in.The grounds are well kept, pool area very nice and everything seems to be well maintained. We used the shuttle service twice. The drivers are nice and on time. We also rented bicycles for a day and it was a nice way to see the island.We just had such a good time here that I know that we will come back and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property. Away from the action though. Some staff issues.”
Reviews.Author: Kmagg
Reviews.Content: Rooms were nice. Pool is excellent. Ed and the rest of the shuttle drivers very friendly but with the exception of one front desk guy, the rest of the staff had an apathetic attitude. They have free shuttles that run to 11pm; be sure to have your ticket. Comfortable beds, two TV's, fridge, microwave, nice facilities in room. Internet speed painfully slow at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: drc225
Reviews.Content: Booked via Hotwire (Amenities: Suite, Near Beach, Airport Shuttle, Smoke Free Rooms, Fitness Center, Pool(s), Restaurant(s), Business Center), family of 4 spent 3 nights in two suites. Cost us Â£108 (~$170) per night per room inclusive of all taxes, etc. This hotel totally exceeded our expectations. The suites are huge and very comfortable. The pool and surrounding area is very pleasant. The pool bar and restaurant is also very pleasant and serves above average food - especially the soft shelled crab sandwich. It's right across from the beach if that is what you are into. We preferred the pool. The shuttle visits downtown twice an hour in the evening and you need to book it - but the process is efficient. The workout room is reasonable with a good choice of kit. The complimentary cookies and lime juice in the foyer mid-afternoon is excellent and goes quickly. Free wifi is slow but adequate for email and browsing. It's not in the heart of the action but the action is easily accessible via the shuttle and as we inadvertently turned up in the run up to Fantasy Fest with teenage kids not being in the heart of the action all the time wasn't necessarily a bad thing!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience, although a bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: aknight
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was everything I had expected... large comfortable suites, helpful & friendly staff, great pool, suitable amenities, etc. My wife and I particularly liked the extra touches, like the complimentary mojito water and fresh, warm cookies in the afternoons. We were also glad to find that we could rent bicycles on-site for a reasonable amount, which we did for three days. My only wish was that this hotel was closer to the main highlights of Key West, or at least somehow more accessible to them. We used the shuttle service quite a bit, but would have liked for it to run more often, take reservations for return trips over the phone, and drop off / pick up at a second optional location on the south end of Duval, for example. As it was, it was more convenient to ride our rented bikes or call a taxi (usually around $12) if we were not on the far north end of the island. Also, Smather's beach directly across the street is beautiful to look at but was not very enjoyable for us (we had low expectations to begin with, so no big deal, really). The sand is great until you get into the water, where the bottom quickly turns to mud. Since there were no waves, the water felt like warm bathwater, and the mud was unpleasant, we spent an afternoon at the hotel pool instead.

Reviews.Title: “short and sweet...just GO!”
Reviews.Author: shaimoon
Reviews.Content: i have written a few reviews...but im going to keep this one short, because i want you to make this stay what YOU make it. this is the smallest most romantic island we have ever been to. the people are really really nice, and the atmosphere is intoxicating. as for the Sheraton...Serge is the most energetic professional and friendly person and is perfect for his job! anything you want or need at any time they will fulfill...now thats service! we stayed in room 244. its almost the size or our apartment at home! beautiful. eat at IL Trattoria on Roosvelt just down the street from the hotel past the airport, take a romantic walk along the coastline to get there...you will not regret it! the service and food is amazing! very romantic! we also did watersports from FURY, you will see them advertised all over town, they are the only ones to use, they are professional and super nice. one of the bartenders on the snorkle tour told us to go to BO's Fish Wagon at 801 Caroline St...bosfishwagon.com its a local joint but the food is to die for! the BEST fish sandwiches in town (besides the fish tacos at the hotel bar-AWESOME!) look for our "graffiti" written in chalk beside the bar-Emily & Allan Sept 2011 all in all, i want to go back! hubby and i loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodations, fantastic pool!”
Reviews.Author: redacorn101
Reviews.Content: Traveled here with my husband and young children and were welcomed and accomodated with a crib. The room was always clean and fresh. The salt water pool was just the right temperature and the hot tub was amazing. Food was OK and drinks were a little weak. Easy to get around from here, although probably not ideal for a bar crawl since it's not near Duval. Friendly staff who went the extra mile.

Reviews.Title: “How suite it is!!!”
Reviews.Author: Traveller20203
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Sheraton Suites Key West recently and had a great time. Our suite looked out over the beach across the street and had a nice little balcony. The living room had a kitchenette and a fold out couch. The bedroom was nice and roomy. The hotel has a nice pool and a bar. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We slept with the balcony sliding glass door open and just enjoyed the ocean air. Wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Great value.1”
Reviews.Author: dmiller1974
Reviews.Content: Our first time staying in Key West, so we really didn't know where to stay. After reading good reviews of the Sheraton Suites on here, we priced it and found it to be very reasonable in comparison to some of the other places we were looking at. I'm very glad we chose to stay at the Sheraton rather than the pricier places! The room is beautiful, much more than we ever expected. There is a small living room, dining area, mini-kitchen, very large bedroom area, and a fantastic bath. It is very nicely decorated, the beds are very comfortable, and the kitchen has all the essentials (microwave, mini-fridge, small sink) including Starbucks coffee. Nice pool, nice little restaurant on site, the public beach is right across the street, and you're not far from all the action downtown. There is a free shuttle that will drop you off downtown, you can get a taxi, or you can drive your car and spend a little time looking for a place to park. We did this and it wasn't a big deal. You can't go wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Beach Suites”
Reviews.Author: ryanwest
Reviews.Content: Sheraton Suites Key West The Sheraton Suites Key West is located on the Atlantic side of Key West right across the street from Smathers Beach. It is one mile from the airport for which they run a shuttle until about 5 PM. If you take a taxi the cost is $6 per person. They also run a shuttle to the other side of the island and leave you off just a short walk from Duval Street. The hotel style is one that fits the Fl keys. It is a bright yellow with a blue trim. Due to its location, it is raised about 10 feet off the ground. When you enter the main building you are looking at the restaurant. To your right is the front desk and the concierge desk. All staff members we dealt with were very friendly and helpful. Our suite was located in the back of the property. Our suite was built in a true suite style, not a converted room with a bar fridge they call a suite. We entered to a tile lined foyer and a dinette set with two chairs and a phone. The living room had a tv, coffee table, and a comfortable sofa. A set of sliding plantation doors separated the living room from the bedroom. We had a king size bed covered in the standard white Sheraton bedding. The bed itself was of reasonable comfort and we each slept well in it. The bathroom was as large as the kitchen/dining room area. Most of the closet space was in the bathroom. The bathroom was well lit with a large mirror and a hair dryer. There was an oversized shower and a water closet. There was no tub. The noise level in our room was a bit higher than we cared for. From our room you could hear the humming of the airplanes approaching and leaving the airport depending on the flight pattern. The humming was not really bad until a 737 approached for landing. Due to the noise, I had to look out to see what was approaching. Each time we opened our door or our neighbors opened their door, the doors that connected the two rooms made an annoying thumping noise. The pool area was a reasonable size and well lined with lounge chairs. There is a jacuzzi behind the waterfalls. The restaurant and bar are nearby and made deliveries to the pool area. They pool staff was attentive and handed out ice pops to guess. There were several large iguanas around the pool that felt the need to check out people who were eating. The people and the iguanas interaction was humorous. There was a major storm just prior to our arrival that flooded the curb lane in front of the hotel. It took several days for the water to go down, which made the walk to the beach a bit difficult.

Reviews.Title: “You Cant Go Wrong With Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: dhomer
Reviews.Content: Standard Sheraton service is what you find here. You know what you get from Sheraton and it has always been very good for me. Modern and clean suites. All done in upgraded materials. Very comfortable. We stayed here for 3 nights while diving in Key West. This property is not particularly close to Duval street, but the hotel runs a shuttle that handles that problem. The hotel also rents bicycles which you can ride to Duval street and it is an easy ride on the bike. Upon checking in we found that someone had used the room after it was cleaned, there were dirty towels littered through the room. I called the front desk to advise and they had someone there in a blink. In fact they sent two maids to reclean the room while we waited. It took them about 10 minutes and we were satisfied. These rooms are suites. The living room has a pullout couch. The bathrooms are very nice with a huge shower, more than enough room for two. You can access the bathroom from either the bedroom or the livingroom which is nice when there are two couples in the room as what we were doing. We did sleep on the pullout couch in the living room and it was just ok, it coule use refurbishing. The staff here were outstanding. We did our scuba diving wipth Captains Corner and they were pretty good. Got two wreck dives in the same day, like the way they do that. There are other hotels you can stay at in the area, this one with suites filled our needs and it was a very good hotel. If you stay here you will not be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Resort”
Reviews.Author: Firebird8
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night. Our suite was extremely clean and spacious. On a trip with a friend and a large group. Could easily stay comfortably for a week or more. Plenty of closet space, mirrors, two flat screen tv's. Staff was very accommodating. Cafe food was very good and the service was also. Pool area was quite nice. They provide shuttle service to and from the downtown area every hour. We also used the trolley to get around on. Great two day get-away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice priceline find. Closer to duval than appears”
Reviews.Author: acon2012
Reviews.Content: I stayed here when I had an extra night in key west and got a room on priceline, and was pleasantly surprised. The pool area was really nicer than many, and there was a free shuttle to Duval Street. (I missed the last ride home, but the can ride back was only about $10) The beach across the street from the hotel stinks (literally) and was my only disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Property”
Reviews.Author: genxor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Sheraton for 7 days in a king ocean suite. The suite was clean and spacious. I am not sure I would pay again for the ocean view room, reason being you actually do not get the oceanview / oceanfront / on the beach feel. From the ocean rooms, you look out onto the front hotel parking lot , a bit of landscaping , a four lane road in front of the hotel , a 5 or 6 foot wall seperating the street from the beach, grasses and plantings on top of this wall and then finally the beach and ocean. So the higher the ocean room the better, but we felt removed from the entire beach / ocean. The staff is great and extremely professional. Housekeeping was a little hit or miss. Some days not cleaning our room until we had returned from the days excursions - 4 to 4:30 pm. A bit frustrating. The front desk did explain of a recent staff change and took care of an earlier cleaning time, but even afterward , washcloths were missing and the balcony door was left unlocked one day. The Coral Crab restaurant seemed nice. We only ate breakfast here one time. The pool and bar area also seemed nice. We only went to the bar once. The location is a bit far from town. Key West is small, but you cannot walk downtown to the action of restaurants / bars / shopping. The free shuttle is great , we had no issue reserving the times we wanted. The shuttle drops you off at the Conch Republic restaurant. This is very convenient to all of downtown. Shuttles run on the hour, and the last shuttle leaves downtown at 11:15 pm. A cab ride back to the hotel ( if you decide to stay later ) is about $10. When we return to Key West, I would not hesitate to stay at this Sheraton again, but would hesitate paying for the ocean room.

Reviews.Title: “Back in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl B
Reviews.Content: Ahh Key West!! What can one say about this place. The Sheraton as always was a great place for me to stay. The staff was great, make sure you become a member of their Sheraton guest list , they will treat you right. The location is great. It is not in the middle of Duval street therefore it is nice and peaceful, yet they offer you a shuttle service to all the craziness!!would go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again!!”
Reviews.Author: JRArnold
Reviews.Content: The rooms are great and the staff is wonderful!! Not sure about all the negative reviews because everyone that we came across was so nice!! Sign up for the sheraton preferred guest its free and you get a better room location. Its a little far from the action but there is a free shuttle which you will want to sign up for in the morning. A taxi back to the hotel from duval street is like $16.00. A taxi from the airport cost $13.00 for 2 people. The food was good at the hotel a little pricey but good. The beach across the street is nice. We didn't smell any weird odors expect when we were on the street which I think was the water laying on the road. Over all I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, had an enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Hambug
Reviews.Content: Well, this is an interesting Sheraton - it doesn't feel like a business hotel as most Sheratons do, but it was clean and the suite was good size with comfy beds. The hide-a-bed was so uncomfortable even my 6-yr-old couldn't sleep on it. But the sofa itself was comfy to sit on, and they had another sort of chair with ottoman connected which my 6-yr-old ended up sleeping on just fine. The kids loved the saline pool and it's waterfall! The pool felt more like a hot tub it was so warm, but the hot tub was so hot we didn't want to go in. The outdoor bar seemed popular. The restaurant was hit and miss - we had a great lunch on the outdoor patio one day, but the one night we had dinner at the restaurant, the service was really bad - it took FOREVER to receive our food even though there was only one other table occupied, and when it came, they had my order very wrong - the server was unapologetic and seemed a little spacey like he wasn't quite all "with it" maybe. We didn't go back for dinner so not sure if that is normal, but I see other similar reviews of the restaurant so maybe it is. We saw lots of tiny lizards around the property (just like everywhere else in Key West) but never saw one in or near our room. We did have a few small ants on the bar counter in our room which seemed to always be there but nowhere else... we just ignored them and didn't leave any food out, and we coexisted OK. It has obviously not always been a Sheraton and feels that way - a couple of strange design features (open a large cabinet and there is a big pipe running through the space but no shelves). But the location is good and they have a shuttle that can take you into town (if you get a reservation early). We had a pleasant 3-night stay and since I booked it with United Miles, it was worth the price (ha). I'm giving this a 4 only since I can't give it a 3.5 rating and it's better than a 3.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: wizardnolo
Reviews.Content: We visit Key West annually and usually stay at the Reach or Casa Maria resorts. Last year our friends stayed at the Sheraton Suites. We decided to try it this year and will likely always book there from in the future. Be sure to get a courtyard view, not a parking lot view! They offer free shuttle service, as it's too far to walk to Duval for most folks. The beach is across the street and the pool is a nice little saltwater pool. Lodging in Key West is expensive, the Sheraton is on the lower side and worth more than the cost compared to other hotels with the same price.
