Reviews.Title: “Loved staying at the Key West Sheraton!”
Reviews.Author: Am7star
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Key West Sheraton with my friends and family in August 2011. There are plenty of rooms, all with a great view. The pool is a bit small but it was very nice. The customer service was wonderful. Will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: glenisb2000
Reviews.Content: This place was so much better than I expected! The rooms are wonderful, very large with a couch and the bedrooms are separate. There is a free shuttle that takes you from the hotel to town every half an hour. Staff was very helpful. Great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff| Good location”
Reviews.Author: laKalandria
Reviews.Content: Hotel itself is dated, carpets on the hallways are old. It's in a very good location and has a complimentary shuttle which is a big plus. The way from our room (ocean view on the 3rd floor) is a little forrest with fresh grass and it is very refreshing. The room itself is very spavious, and very clean too. Could get some maintenance: the refrigerator door was out of place and the walls have marks. Food is ok, same as any Courtyard or Residence inn. Everyone in the staff is very attentinve and knowledgeable about the local area. I could not connect to the internet from my laptop in the room. Called Front Desk and I was walked through. After a couple attempts I gave up.

Reviews.Title: “Dog Friendly Paradise, Especially if You Like to Skate or Run!”
Reviews.Author: MsMMiler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted to take our dog on a trip to the Keys, and were we ever pleased with the accommodations here! We didn't use any of the facilities but we skated and walked all over the island with our dog. We found plenty of restaurants that would accept a well-behaved, quiet animal. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “So much room for family to spread out”
Reviews.Author: Tinkerbell_traveler
Reviews.Content: The Shearton Suites Key West is across to street from Smathers Beach and not too far from Duval Street and Key West Attractions. The room was a 1 bedroom with two Queen sized beds, nice sized bathroom, kitchen area and living rioom with L shaped sleeper sofa that was extremely comfortable. The stay included buffet breakfast for 2 each morning with a good variety to choose from. The pool was spacious, the staff friendly. It was very hot when we were there and the pool staff came around with iced water for us to have several times during our time at the pool. The pool bar had daily specials for food and drinks. The only bad thing was that after we had checked in and thank god, brought all our luggage/food (full kitchen) up, they decided to have the elevator worked on. We had to drag all our stuff down to the car from the second floor ( no fun) (no help from staff on that, no apologies for inconvience either). If you like to be close to the action, choose a hotel on Duval street but it will be more costly and less roomy. The hotel did offer shuttle to Duval Street/ Mallory Square but we opted to take our car instead becuase you had to reserve time to be picked up and we wanted to stay out later than last shuttle..

Reviews.Title: “not too bad”
Reviews.Author: Pierre55
Reviews.Content: The room are spacious and well equiped. Nice comfortable bed and nice linen. Safe in the room ;Free wifi ,free parking.convenient shuttle to downtown.Nice swimming pool. (but crowded) The beach across the street is very desappointing :it is not the sheraton private beach ;you have to pay for seats and when you come closer ,the water is full of weeds and it smell horrible... this is the case of most Key West hotel beaches.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing location and beach”
Reviews.Author: AshlieShea
Reviews.Content: Pros - check in was smooth and the room was nice, granite counter tops. Shuttle service is a great concept but the execution of it could be improved. Cons - to use shuttle service Tickets are required but they never tell you this at check in... So we couldn't get a ride because we did not know this. They also don't offer return shuttle tickets when you get yours... We didn't know those would be needed. The man who drove the shuttle was RUDE! Carpets are very dirty Housekeeper asked us to please vacate the room so she could clean it... Even though we weren't ready... She said she wanted to move on to a different floor. So we were rushed out.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel and we will be back”
Reviews.Author: Melissasal
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic. I know many people said it was not in old town- BUT it is only a 10 min FREE shuttle ride away. This hotel was clean, rooms were amazing and the pool was terrific!!! My husband and I would stay here again over anyother place in key west. And we went to look at many of the other hotels....but we would come right back here!!!!!!!!! BEDS were fantastic!!!

Reviews.Title: “I would have loved to extend our stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: sher0228
Reviews.Content: We love love love Key West!!! We have stayed in Old Town at guesthouses, and newer resorts on Roosevelt. We wanted to be near Smathers Beach this time, so selected Sheraton Suites on South Roosevelt. We used our car to go into Old Town and did not have any trouble finding reasonable parking on cross streets to Duval. The suite was BIG! and Clean! and Modern...great bathroom design. Our suite had a master bedroom with a very comfy king bed and a so-so sleeper sofa in the sitting room, kitchenette small. Decor average. The concierge desk in the lobby was helpful. We did not try the pool or restaurant, but both looked ok. Great beach access just across the street and good, free parking. We booked through Expedia, and had a good rate; however, I was not allowed to extend the stay on-site. I was told to go on-line and make a new reservation; the staff at the facility said they had no ability to make or extend reservations. REALLY?!? So we moved on, but find it very strange that staff can't make arrangements while the customer is face to face with them.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe you shouldn't stay past 3 days/nights!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mary D
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Key West from July 23-29, 2011. It was for a 6-night stay. This was our summer vacation. We love staying with Starwood, particularly with Westin. This was our first stay with Sheraton. We thought we were getting a deal with the hotel being across from the beach as opposed to staying at the Westin in the heart of old town. We are a family of 5 with children (ages 5-13) and thought that the location would be perfect, since what we wanted to do were mostly outdoor/water activities. Smathers Beach was a bit disappointing. Go to Fort Zach!!!! Anyway, the Sheraton suite/room we stayed in was spacious. The kids actually loved being in the family room more. So actually, we could have gotten a king suite (less expensive) than the double queen suite. lol The kids loved the pool! That was a major PLUS!!! The concierge was nice to book both our sunset snorkeling and parasailing excursions. She was actually nice enough to find a company that would allow our 5 yo to parasail. Overall, this hotel was pretty good until the 4th day. We travel a lot and we enjoy staying in nice, CLEAN, hotels. We are normally just there to sleep and get ready 'cause we love being out and about exploring the city we're visiting. We don't use much of the hotel's amenities but ROOM CLEANLINESS is very important to us! We had no problem with the hotel room being cleaned until the 4th/5th day. It just seemed that our room was NOT being cleaned as well as before (maybe a change in housekeeping personnel - I don't know). It appeared that all they were doing were making the beds and giving us new clean towels. We kind of let it go since we were always in and out of the room. On the last full day we were there, we got back at around 3 pm and our room still had not been cleaned at all. We only went back to get ready to go back out again and enjoy the sunset at Mallory Square one more time. Anyway, we called for service and were told that they would send somebody to clean. We decided to go and enjoy the pool. We came back around 5 pm, and the room was NOT cleaned - beds were made, new towels were there but the floors and who knows what else were not cleaned. THERE WAS A DEAD ROACH ON OUR BATHROOM FLOOR!!!!!!! That was totally unacceptable! Needless to say, they came back to clean and DISINFECT the room. We still made it to our last sunset (barely). But we ENJOYED Key West so much that we did not let this ruin our vacation. However, I do not know if we will be staying at this hotel again! Maybe we should have change hotels after 3 days, but really aren't we paying for every single night anyway?????? So, we should be getting the same kind of service whether we stayed for 3 nights or 6 nights!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: Daniel S
Reviews.Content: The entire staff were wonderful ~ from the momment we arrived till we checked out 3 days later! Our room was spacious and VERY comfortable. The salt water pool was a huge hit with the kids. The breakfast was very reasonable with generous portions. The shuttle bus drivers were very nice. One of the drviers took us to the other end of town so that we did not have to walk to the butterfly museum. We look forward to the next time we can visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mary4135
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. The room we had was a nice suite so when you got back from your day out, you could relax in the living room instead of sitting on the bed. It's across from Smather's beach and has a very nice pool. We went in August so needless to say it was very, very hot in Key West! I read in a lot of reviews that the shuttle service into Duval Street is hard to get on etc., but with very little planning we never had a problem signing up for the trip. The night driver, Mr. Ed was so wonderful, not only was he intelligent and well spoken he did everything he could to help you and find room for you on the shuttle, my husband and I were sorry we didn't take a picture with him. The food in the restaurant is very good and the service is excellent. We enjoyed our stay there and I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Key West that doesn't want to stay in the center of town.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Low Value”
Reviews.Author: topherashley
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel. I would rank it overall around a 3 star. The 1 star missing is for the exterior. The lobby is nice, the rooms are immaculate, spacious, and quiet but the exterior is run down, access to your room is not easy, and the ground are not well kept. The problem I have with this hotel is the price. They are charging 4 star prices for a 3 star hotel. They need to invest in the grounds and exterior to get their value back on track. If you are looking for a place in KW, I recommend this one but only after you exhaust all other options. There are several guest houses much closer to Duval for much less. If you are in KW to party, eat, and see the sites. You are in the wrong spot. If you are there to lounge at Smathers, by the pool, and drive everywhere. This is your place.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!!!”
Reviews.Author: cynthia k
Reviews.Content: This was a great place for the money. We had a two room suite that faced the garden. The room was clean and updated. The pool and tiki bar was great. We only had food at the hotel three times and each one was wonderful!!!! The only down side is that you are on the other side of the island from Duval street but the hotel does offer a free shuttle to town and the cab ride is only $10.00. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Will definatley be back to this hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: beverlyw71
Reviews.Content: We celebrated my 40th birthday here from 8/5/11 - 8/7/11 with another couple and had the best time. The room was extremly spacious, great decor, COMFORTABLE BED, fridge, coffee. You name it, they had it available. We stayed in room 101 with balcony pool view and it was perfect! I'm sorry to see the bad reviews of this place because I can't think of anything....well maybe if the shuttle to Duval Street ran later than 11:15 for pick up. But we did find a taxi for $4 person, so again, not bad at all.

Reviews.Title: “General Manager of Sheraton in Key West Florida is arrogant and rude”
Reviews.Author: discriminatedagainst
Reviews.Content: my husband and I are handicapped. We asked for a handicap room but were told that they were difficult to get to due to contstruction.. I booked a King bed Suite and wanted a balcony because I have fear of fire in hotels. We were put in a dirty, two queen bed outdated room. We had to ask for sheets just to set on the sofa that is falling apart. We had no light in the living room and the refridgerator wasn't working. We called the front desk and asked for maintence. He came and replaced a burned out light bulb and told us he could not help us with the refridgerator. Therefore, my husband had to Ao get a cooler and filled it with ice to put away our perishables. I called regarding the run down dirty room and was treated attrociously by the manager on Saturday evening shift on 8/6/10. He was rude and denigrated me. Little does he know that my husband is a consultant and project manager for starwood. I WILL NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN ! ALSO, WE ORDERED TUNA WRAPS DOWN BY THE POOL TO GO. wHAT DID WE GET ! CHICKENSALAD WRAPS. THE BARTENDER WAS IN A RUSH BECAUSE IT WAS CHANGE OF SHIFT! NOT MY PROBLEM! THIS IS NOT OVER YET! THIS ARROGANT, RUDE AND DENIGRATING EVENING SUPERVISOR NEEDS TO LOOSE HIS JOB AND NEVER WORK IN HOSPITALITY AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a relaxing family vacation”
Reviews.Author: Karen&Martin
Reviews.Content: The suite set-up is perfect for a family vacation. The rooms are spacious, well laid-out and clean. The hotel is a nice size, as is the pool. Though it will not wow you, the restaurant is pretty good and the meal prices are reasonable. We had no complaints about our stay and would probably stay again if we return to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: MikeyK
Reviews.Content: While the hotel is generally of good quality, the service was poor from the time that we checked in to the time that we left. The staff are certainly not up to the standard expected of a Sheraton hotel (I know this is generalisation, but I do not want to mention names) with lack of customer skills very evident. It has seriously made me consider whether I would stay at a Sheraton again.

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit-love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Momkimecon
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton is an all suites hotel. The room is spacious and very convenient. It is on the outside of town but the island is small. We brought our bicycles on this trip and it makes it very easy to get around. They are also rented everywhere. Beautiful water, not the beaches you see in Destin but very nice just different. Lots of things to do, different food and plenty of relaxing. The pool is great and so were all the employees. Compared to other hotels on this trip, the room was a great price and had a lot of benefits. Would definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but front desk needs better staff”
Reviews.Author: BeachShells72
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here for 5 nights during a family vacation. We are SPG members and found the Starwood Preferred service from the front desk personnel poor. The hotel grounds and rooms are very nice and it's in a good location that's a short distance to the center of Key West. They have a free shuttle to and from the center but we only used it once due to a bad 1st experience. A warning if you plan to use the shuttle-- you need reservations for each ride. We were not told this and planned to take it whenever we were ready and wait for the next if necessary. We didn't have a definite idea how long we'd be in the center and wanted to be flexible. While we easily got on one of the morning shuttles without reservations, we had a bad experience when we tried to return. After a busy fun day and great dinner we tried to board a return shuttle later that evening but were told there wasn't room. That was fine, we figured we'd just wait for the next trip, but the driver said we might not be able to get a ride at all that night without reservations. Why were we now informed about the reservation policy and not on our 1st trip? We called the hotel right away to reserve for a later shuttle. The woman was not helpful and didn't seem to care at all. She told us we would have to take our chances the rest of the night and catch a cab if there wasn't room for us. Fortunately we were able to get on the next shuttle..not sure what happened after we called or if it was thanks to the driver or the hotel staff, no one explained, we were just glad that we did get a ride back. We stopped at reception when we got back and were given a very bad attitude by the two women there. We were calm and matter of fact about what happened,but they were annoyed that we stopped by. They were dismissive and reminded us that we did get a ride back afterall. One implied that we should have known we needed reservations and said it was 'common sense'. Not only did she imply that we had no common sense but she was rude for no reason. We were unhappy about the shuttle mishap but willing to chalk it up to miscommunication, but the uncaring, don't bother us attitude and rudeness we received was unforgivable, left a very bad taste and bothered all of us. With such poor attitudes and lack of hospitality skills, these ladies should not be working at the front desk helping guests. Except for this unfortunate encounter with the reception staff we enjoyed our stay. The hotel is attractive, the pool area was nice and our suite was spacious and comfortable. We loved the Starbucks coffee every morning. The concierge service was friendly and helpful and the staff who took care of our room and refreshed our kitchen station each day were great. Any requests were taken care of cheerfully and promptly. They made up a little for the front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay. Really nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: LawdawgBR
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right by the airport, a good thing in this case. They have a shuttle that runs to the airport and down to Duvall St., so getting around is cheap but if you want more independence then rent scooters ($40 a day). Cabs are plentiful but expensive. I also highly recommend the jet ski tour that circles the island of Key West ($125 single, $135 double). The concierge can get it set up for you at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect quick getaway, big thanks to Jon at FD for making it even better!”
Reviews.Author: AirportDisco
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel for a quick getaway from Miami. As soon as I arrived I felt welcomed by Jon at the front desk, who was perfectly knowledgeable and inviting. I couldn't ask for more - got a great room - zero complaints - and enjoyed all of the amenities that the hotel has to offer. Thanks Jon!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: CrystalAston
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here for 1 night. Our room was absolutely beautiful and clean. We stayed on the 1st floor in a suite at the end of the hall. The room was clean and upscale. I would recommend this hotel to others. We were disappointed about not being able to get on the shuttle in time. I would have expected them to have more trips to Duval street. We were thankful that we had a car because we would have been out of luck. Overall, this was a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Florida777
Reviews.Content: Top floor with ocean view was excellent. The showers in the "suite" are incredible as well as the kitchen amenities. The couch pulled out to a bed which was a great feature that helped us accommodate 4 adults. I would highly recommend the Sheraton!

Reviews.Title: “Had a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: turbo911
Reviews.Content: The room was generously sized and included a kitchenette with microwave. The bed was comfortable and the a.c. was cold. Location is right across the street from Smathers Beach, which unfortunately looks nice from afar, but once you get closer you can see the water is nasty. Anyway, we didn't come for the beach so it wasn't a big deal. The hotel offers free Wifi but using it was impossible. I had a strong signal but the bandwith just wasn't there. It took over a minute to load the simplest of web pages, if they loaded at all. Finally, they could do a better job cleaning the tile floors in the room. My white socks were literally brown after walking around a bit. They're probably mopping the floors but not changing the water often enough and hence just pushing dirty water around. Overall, I had a nice stay and would recommend with the caveat that you can't rely on their wifi service.

Reviews.Title: “too much aggravation”
Reviews.Author: beachbum2463
Reviews.Content: If you want internet, tell them. They know which rooms it works in and which it doesn't and they acknowledged the point when I said mine didn't work. After getting my room switched, I found out it was single king so my 18 year daughter had to sleep on sofa bed instead of the double queens I reserved. Front desk understaffed and either really nice( Chan and the guy from Kansas) or really surly (guy from Europe and the ladies). Over five days, we had to have the key cards re-done at least 8 times. I have never had this problem at any other hotel. Shuttle was nice but don't let the front desk tell you to take a cab home. The shuttle will make extra runs at the end of the night. Assume you will spend a mint in their restaurant or eat in town.

Reviews.Title: “General Manager Needs to be Fired”
Reviews.Author: earlina
Reviews.Content: While the actual room accommodations are up-to-date and modern, the service at this hotel is atrocious. As Starwood Preferred Guests, my husband and I expected this hotel to maintain the Starwood brand identity...namely, great service, cleanliness, and making guests feel welcome. Not the case at this particular Sheraton. It was apparent that nobody has trained staff members to be knowledgeable or friendly to guests (I actually wonder if most of them were coming to work high on drugs). Housekeeping is spotty...they come when they feel like it...and don't do the best job. The SPG complimentary water bottles were only given to us on one of our 5 nights and when I mentioned this to the front desk, they seemed confused that we would have gotten any at all. Restaurant is poor quality (i.e. microwaved food). Waitress got an attitude when I told her she brought me the wrong meal (I'd asked for Mahi-Mahi platter and she insisted that I had ordered "fresh catch sandwich"....mind you, I'm gluten-intolerant...no way I ordered anything on bread). We left this hotel with a bad taste in our mouths for the Starwood Resorts chain...when just a month prior, we were pleased as punch with the service at their St. Regis, Princeville. I guess you get what you pay for...next time on Key West, we'll pay extra for the Casa Marina, Waldorf resort! Starwood certainly didn't make me feel like a preferred guest!

Reviews.Title: “Charming and next to a quiet sand beach”
Reviews.Author: PhilOlga
Reviews.Content: Large rooms and moderng rooms. The hotel is a bit outside of the old town of Key West. Neverthless, appreciated the pool and the neaby sandy beach. Would recommend it for 2 nights as it will give you enough time for visiting the area and take some good time at the beach.

Reviews.Title: “It was just okay”
Reviews.Author: Dakkin
Reviews.Content: The rooms are large and nice. However, it is right across from Smathers beach and that is not good. Smathers beach smells horribly and the smell leaks over across the road to the Sheraton The price of the rooms is fairly high and would be reasonable if you could use Smathers beach. However, Smathers Beach is not usable as there is way too much seaweed and follow ordor.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a family vacation”
Reviews.Author: Reodor1978
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel situated just outside downtown Key West, in a calm and silent area facing south. Clean and comfortable hotel lobby and rooms, courteous staff. Spacious and well-equipped suite, which contributed to make our family weekend a pleasant experience. The only (small) snag was a somewhat unreliable internet wifi connection.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden paradise!”
Reviews.Author: FinnWithFins
Reviews.Content: Hotel is offering great rooms and great environment for relaxing. ROOMS are large and clean. Starbuck coffee is provided in the room. GARDEN is beautiful and access from rooms to the pool and reception is crossing throught the garden on slalom pavement. POOL is big enough and deep, making forbidden jumps to pool enjoyable ;) Also hottub is available with privacy walls. Center of the Key West is close by, few minutes by car. Also public beaches are just near by. PARKING is private and safe. If coming back to Key West, this is the hotel we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wished we had stayed at the Doubletree!”
Reviews.Author: Sparker4524
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed in the customer service...checked in our room and we had 2 towels and 1 wash cloth...you would have thought we were asking for the moon when we requested more towels. We had stayed a the Doubletree a few years ago and had used their shuttle service to Duval St. It was always waiting and available...at the Sheraton you had to sign up for the shuttle and sign up for the return. We missed our time on the return so we had to take a taxi back to the hotel. The front desk personnel were rude...even though the hotel was very nice I would not return.

Reviews.Title: “I was disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: Lovely1212
Reviews.Content: The one thing I liked about the Sheraton was it was quite and the room had a mini-livingroom. However, for some reason the lobby had a really bad oder. Also the locks on the doors in the bathroom didn't work and while I was in the bathroom the doors kept opening. I was also disappointed because all of Key West smells like a sewer. The weird part is, I felt like we were the only people that noticed the oder. If you like beautiful beaches don't go here. If you don't have a strong sense of smell, then you may enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT PLACE TO STAY!!”
Reviews.Author: txashli
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I went on our honeymoon to Key West and stayed at the Sheraton Suites from June 27 til July 2. We had a GREAT time at the Sheraton. It is very close to the airport which was nice, however, we did have to pay for a cab to get to the Sheraton when we arrived because when I called the hotel there was no driver available, but not really a big deal. We loved being directly across the street from Smather's Beach, it was wonderful. We ate 2 lunches and a small breakfast(didn't do the buffet) at the hotel restaurant and had a good experience, the staff are friendly and the food was good. We had a few drinks at the bar too one night and had a good experience, Carolyn is a very fun bartender! We did not use room service so I can't speak for that. We didn't bring a computer with us or use the hotels computer, so I don't have a review for that either, it was vacation and I did not even want to look at a computer. The hotel is not too close to the action of Duval Street, but that is PERFECTLY alright! It was very nice to come back to the hotel to relax in our room, or swim at the pool after a busy, hot day on Duval Street shopping, eating, sightseeing, etc. It was very nice to come back to a quiet place to relax. We really loved that aspect of the hotel. Even though it is not super close to all the attractions, we used the hotel shuttle and it was VERY convenient and we did not have one problem getting seats on the shuttle, we'd get our tickets from the front desk and never had an issue no matter what time we needed, it was very convenient. There are 3 shuttle drivers. Randy and Ed are AMAZING!!!! They have great customer service skills and are very nice and very helpful. We looked forward to seeing them each day. Then there was Bill, well, lets just say he has the personality of a cactus!! He wasn't out and out rude to us or anything, he just acts like he just doesn't like his job and acts annoyed that he has to drive people around, he really should not be in a customer service position. But we just brushed it off, not really that big of a deal. Early in the week Randy & Ed announced that if anyone wanted to go to the other end of Duval where the Butterfly thing & the Southernmost Point are, to just stay on the van and they'd take us. But the day we wanted go, it was Bill's day and he said we had to ask. The only downfall to getting dropped off on that end of Duval is having to walk back to the other end, we did and we were fine, it was just extremely hot that day. But there is always the trolley or train option if you want to do that. The pool is very nice and relaxing, we loved it. Our King Suite was perfect for us, the size of the shower is amazing! The room is kept very clean, housekeeping did a great job the 5 nights we were there. All in all it was a great trip and a great stay at the Sheraton and whenever we go back to Key West, we will definitely stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Babyrn47
Reviews.Content: Super clean, spacious suite. Luxurious bed. Across street from beach w direct access path. Wonderful pool w tiki bar.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location, huge rooms, nice pool, would choose again!”
Reviews.Author: PurdueGirl84
Reviews.Content: Located on the quiet south side of the island across from Smathers Beach. Very short drive to Mallory Square/Duval Street. Chose this hotel because the room was a true 1-bedroom. Bedroom is separated from living room with sliding doors. Couch folds out, so perfect for families. Sofabed is NOT comfortable fo adults, but kids should do fine. Nice kitchenette area with refrigerator, microwave and coffeemaker. Coffee and tea are provided. Flat screen tv in both bedroom and living room. Nice table with 2 chairs. Bathroom is HUGE with tons of storage, however, there is NO BATHTUB. Most rooms open to outside hallways, but we were given a courtyard view room in an enclosed, air conditioned hallway. These rooms appeared to be reserved for Starwood preferred guests, so be sure to join their rewards program! Also be sure to check their website for specials (Florida resident, AAA, and others.) The pool is very nice with a waterfall, and "noodles" are provided. There is a very nice bar and patio overlooking the pool area. Staff was extremely friendly. We had a very pleasant stay and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “VERY nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: DeDe1112
Reviews.Content: Our spacious room at this hotel could be the cleanest room we've ever had the pleasure to stay in. Very impressive. The mini-kitchen w/ microwave, mini-frig, immaculate coffeemaker, delicious Starbucks coffee and complimentary bottled water daily, was wonderful. The room had a nice-sized dining table that could easily seat four, TWO flat screen TVs, and a beautiful spacious bathroom with door separating the tub/shower & toilet. Double sinks would have been a plus in the bathroom, but there's a sink in the mini-kitchen if needed in a pinch. The mattress for the sleeper sofa was horrible, but I survived it. Had good breakfasts at the hotel restaurant, with generally good service. One day the hotel decided to test the smoke detectors for over 10 minutes without informing the guests in advance, which was rather ridiculous. I thought I was going to be deaf afterwards. The beach across the street was "okay", and the water near the shoreline is murky and not very inviting. Thank goodness the pool was large & beautiful, with a gorgeous rocky waterfall. The shuttle is nice, but you must plan ahead to reserve a seat and sometimes can't get the time you want. That could mess up your plans for the day, or you'd have to take a taxi or rent a scooter. All in all, we had a wonderful stay at the Sheraton Suites!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Sheraton Suites”
Reviews.Author: sandra97
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a four night stay in late May at the Sheraton Suites in Key West, and enjoyed it tremendously. The hotel suite was spacious, immaculately kept and well appointed with everything - from toiletries to microwave-fridge, to coffee setup. Balcony was also nice to sit on and look at the ocean. The bed was so comfortable it was difficult to leave it in the morning. And the bathroom was huge and beautifully tiled, with a walk-in shower. Very luxuriant. We ate two lunches and one dinner at the hotel restaurant - the food was good, reasonably priced, and the servers were very friendly and pleasant. The pool is lovely. The beach is across the street, and lounge chairs and umbrellas are available for rent. Others have complained about the beach and water being "dirty" - not so. There is sea-grass growing on the ocean floor very close to the beach (which is soft white sand), so some of the grass floats in the water - but you can easily swim beyond it. The ocean swimming is fabulous. Another nice touch is the set of free laptops in the lobby for guests to use, and the rocking chairs outside to enjoy the night air. There is a health club, but we did not have time to use it. The hotel is not in the downtown, which is a plus as far as I'm concerned - we did come for peace & quiet relaxation - but the hotel has a free shuttle bus every hour to take guests to and from the town center, which is a short ride away. All in all a great hotel, and one to return to.

Reviews.Title: “Mr. Ed was fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: DCBasedForNow
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton Suites for the first weekend of June. Room was adequate, bed was comfortable, and pool was great. Tiki Bar was something to be desired, but will get the job done. Shuttle downton to Duval Street was always available, and Mr. Ed (the driver) was AMAZING! He even offered to drive my friend and I to a restaurant that would have been a bit of a walk. Super, super nice! Made the trip :-) If you are a USG employee make sure to get the gov't rate - saved a ton of money!

Reviews.Title: “Great Upgrade to Oceanview Room w/ Balcony 355”
Reviews.Author: CWBurn
Reviews.Content: We traded in our Starwood Time Share week and used our points for a week at a Poolview Room during the week of May 28 - June 4th. Upon check in, which happened to be very late (10pm b/c we drove from MIA after arriving at 3pm--traffic wasn't bad and we stopped for dinner is Ismorada), we found out that we were upgraded to an oceanview suite, 355. FYI, not all oceanview suites have a balcony. (see attached photos) The staff was very friendly and helpful. There are plenty of plastic pool toys and noodles for kids (and adults), some old books and magazines to read, and a couple of beach chairs that you can actually take to the beach, but keep in mind one of the chairs dates from the 80s. The pool is nice and my son enjoyed chasing the iguanas and gekoes around the hotel grounds. The hotel is a 5-10 minute drive to Duval Street, but we didn't have a huge issue wtih parking even on Memorial Day weekend. You'll need to reserve a drop off and pick up time if you want to use the shuttle. Depending on how crowded the hotel is you may want to do this early in the day. Since we had a suite, we shopped for breakfast and lunch items at a nearby Winn Dixie, and there is a liquor store about a mile away from the hotel. They did have a little shop that had some essential items like beer, juice, sunscreen, aloe, and snacks. Internet access is free and the concierge was very helpful. The staff did a good job of keeping our coffee maker stocked with starbucks coffee and they often returned to our room late in the afternoon because the do not desturb sign was up as our son napped. On our last day, their boiler went down so we had a cool shower on our last evening and morning of check out. While this could ruin some vacations, I didn't let this minor inconvenience get the best of me and my family. Overall, I had a great experience and would recommend this hotel, especially if you want a fairly quiet location to sleep and don't mind being away from Duval. However, you're near the airport, so you'll hear the occasional plane land/take off. We slept with the windows open every night and never had a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property..away from the action”
Reviews.Author: Charoo_Reuben
Reviews.Content: We drove down from Miami and stayed in the Courtyard Suite here. The suite was immaculate which is expected in a Sheraton property. The beach is right across the road. The only disadvantage is that it's away from all the action. The hotel does provide a ltd service shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Property - Just a Bit Far From The Action”
Reviews.Author: Zudnic
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Suites Key West with my wife and toddler in May 2011. We snagged it at a good price from Hotwire. This hotel did a great job meeting our basic needs, with plenty of space, fridge/microwave, and very clean. The rocky beach is right across the street, although the chairs were a $10 rental. The pool was nice, with toys for the kids, books on loan, and no "don't steal our pool towel" card-swap BS. Free parking was a plus, and at lunchtime the food trucks that set up shop at the beach provide decent food cheap. The onsite restaurant was reasonably priced, although we didn't try it. My only complaint was that this hotel was a good bit off the beaten path, necessitating taking the car into town. The hotel provides a shuttle but we didn't utilize it. The staff was OK, a little curt, and it took three requests to get a crib delivered to our room. Overall this hotel is a good value for generally-overpriced Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, nice added touches by staff”
Reviews.Author: win54
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights. It is a great property but is quite distant from the Duval St. attractions. They do have free, limited shuttle service to the Duval St area. It is across the street from a nice beach which was much quieter than the pool area (lots of kids when we were there). Our suite was very spacious and comfortable and the bed was great. The staff did little things that were really appreciated - offering cool wet cloths at the pool area, free popsicles to adults and children at the pool, refreshing drink and fresh baked cookies in the lobby around 3:00 every day. Bike rentals available right at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the 3 1/2 hour drive from Miami”
Reviews.Author: Keysdiver0227
Reviews.Content: My family and I decided to drive down last minute and when we wanted to find a hotel near the beach there was actually only one. With a hotel like this there does not need to be anymore. The checkin process, restaurant shuttle to downtown and everything else WOW. Great job

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: nycmom2
Reviews.Content: Upon reading such favorable reviews, we booked the trip using our points. I was traveling with my mom and a toddler and wanted to go to a beach area where we didn't need to rent a car and spend a lot of money on transportation. I called in advance to find out if they can pick us up from the airport and was told that I need to call when we arrive at the airport. The person I spoke with sounded iffy about it, but when I called upon landing, someone was able to pick us up. It takes less than 5 minutes from the airport so I think it's matter of availability of the shuttle bus. There are 2 guys who run the shuttle and one is a surly, grouch who is quite honestly a pain to deal with. Who wants to look at a sour face especially on vacation? He mainly works during the morning and afternoon. The other guys is very friendly and nice and actually makes conversation with you and says hello. Imagine that! We are Platinum members and they gave us a welcome gift choice of $10 credit or 500 points. They also gave us coupons good for $5 off per person for breakfast which costs $15 per person. We were hoping they would provide free breakfast since that's what Sheratons usually offer, but this was the next best thing. Room is spacious and clean. Ours overlooked the pool. I had brought our iPad, but couldn't get internet to work. There must've been a glitch with the connection, but I didn't bother with it. There's a small refrigerator in the room, so we walked to the nearest grocery store which is 20 minutes away (neighborhood is not that great...nearest stores are a liquor store and a small convenience store), but there are plenty of people that ride their bikes through. We bought some water and snacks there. Hotel's pool is nice and it's a salt water pool. We tried the beach once and didn't go back. It was dirty and murky and full of seaweed. I didn't expect that so it was disappointing, but my daughter's scared of the beach anyway and had a great time at the pool. We went into town a few times and walked around and did some sight seeing. The shuttle runs frequently, but you have to sign up at the front desk and get a ticket to get on. The hotel was overall nice, but I wasn't very impressed with Key West. We had to take a very small plane to arrive and that experience alone was nerve wrecking. I would opt for some other place where the beach is cleaner!

Reviews.Title: “You can't put a price on "Peace of Mind"”
Reviews.Author: AmerBeingAmer
Reviews.Content: I always say you cant put a price on "peace of mind." Sheraton Suites was simple, no nonsense, private, cozy. The perfect spot for a weekend getaway. If you need a well done room, that's private, quiet, simple, with a big bathroom, WELCOME HOME. it should go without saying (considering the name Sheraton SUITES), but all the rooms are suite style. You essentially have two rooms separated by a sliding door partition, giving you a living room, with a full sofa, dining table, TV, etc, and a bedroom with a huge bed. The bathroom connects to both. The shower is awesomely large! I want to say a special something about the concierge Pavla. She was incredible! One of the BEST concierges i've ever dealt with. She totally oriented us for the whole weekend with just a quick 20 minutes and a map. Now I'm going to go give great TripAdvisor reviews to all the places i went to because of her recommendation. Look for them! PS: If you are a high maintenance hotel guest that has their whole stay ruined because the sliding door slides further than you expected or because the mini-fridge is not a 5-star restaurant quality walk in. Don't stay here or anywhere. Stay home and leave the hard working people of the American hotel industry in peace.

Reviews.Title: “Expected better”
Reviews.Author: matrix_dave
Reviews.Content: We arrived to the Sheraton early but could not check in because the power was out. This was obviously not the fault of the hotel and we explored the city while waiting to check in. After checking in, we discovered the elevator next to our hotel room was not working so we had to carry our rather heavy bags up the stairs. The room was clean and spacious for two people. The bathrooms are quite lovely but our shower was plugged and did not drain at all. We called maintenance and the issue was promptly fixed. Very few of the rooms face the ocean and most of the rooms do not have balconies. Smathers beach is right across the road but we were extremely disappointed with the beach. There was a lot of sea weed and it smells bad toward the end of the day. The sand is rough and there were pieces of glass everywhere on the beach. We had to be very cautious when walking barefoot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and attentive to our needs”
Reviews.Author: Markeeta
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving to Sheraton Suites which was early approximately 1 p.m. our room was ready and there was not a wait with the usual check in time at 4 p.m. The staff were very courteous and attentive. The hotel manager gave us a free breakfast after we read our travel package incorrectly which we thought included all meals. The breakfast buffet was very good and plentiful. After explaining to us that it did not include meals, the manager was courteous and gave us breakfast free the next morning. The room was very clean and included 2 flat panel TV's. The only issue and it really was not an issue was that the couch needs updated in the room. The shuttle was also an extra plus into downtown Key West and the airport on arrival and departure. Smathers bearch right across the street was absolutely beautiful. Hotel pool was also very nice. I would definitely stay here again without any questions and recommend to anyone going to the Keywest area.

Reviews.Title: “Best of both worlds”
Reviews.Author: harmonytravels
Reviews.Content: So close to the airport and Smathers beach makes up for it being away from Old Town, but remember this is a very small island. There is a free shuttle that takes you to old town and one for the airport. The concierge was awesome, the pool nice, but we only used it once, to many other things to see and do. The staff was helpful and friendly, the fitness center alittle small, but there was never a crowd. They have bike rentals and that is a great way to get around the island. I will go back again.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, good food, good location”
Reviews.Author: Graps1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with 3 kids 5,7 and 10 for 6 nights and enjoyed our stay. The location is right across from the beach and just minutes drive from downtown. The beach is better than I expected based off of some of the other posts. The water is shallow and lots of seaweed, thats what I didnt like about it so we didnt spend as much time at the beach as we anticpated. The staff was very nice, in most cases; The bartenders at the cabana (both during the day and night) could be a little more friendly, felt like you were bothering them to get a drink. The restaruant is pretty good, I found the food at the hotel to be no more expensiven than 90% of the restaraunts we ate at downtown. The shuttle to downtown is convienent but fills up very quickly in the am for the dinner times. I never had a problem finding a parking spot downtown. Kids loved the pool although it gets pretty crowded between 2-5. The room was adequate but small (for 5). would prefer better kitchen for a suite. Overall would recommend this hotel and go back to it for a visit to the keys.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but always room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: JWHIII
Reviews.Content: For the most part, I found the Sheraton Suites to be a good hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful, my room was spacious and clean, and the hotel itself has a nice layout (with a resident iguana. I saw him running away from me at one point.) The restaurant carries a decent mix of food, and the poolside bar is staffed by friendly, knowledgeable bartenders. Indeed, I enjoyed my stay at the Sheraton. That said, I have a few suggestions: 1) The staff needs a better process to handle incoming guests. My flight arrived in Key West not long after noon, and I was at the hotel by 1 or so, only to learn that my room was not ready. The front-desk clerk said that my room would be ready by 4 p.m. and offered to call me if it was ready earlier. I returned at around 3:30 to find that my room was ready. However, I had not received a call from the staff. Moreover, the hotel did not offer to hold my luggage until the room was ready. These two items are small things, but if Sheraton staff had practiced them, that extra mile would have made a positive impression. 2) The hotel is very close to the beach, which is a plus. However, it's a good couple miles to downtown Key West. The shuttle is available, and I saw bikes available for rental. I eschewed the former, as I brought a rented car, and the latter, as it was 90+ degrees for most of my stay. :Has the Sheraton considered renting the motorized scooters or golf carts I saw everybody tooling around in in Key West? If so, that would be a great service. 3) Room was very clean, and I liked the architectural touches. the clothing-storage cabinets and drawers in the bathroom were a particularly nice touch. That said, the suite's televisions seemed a bit small for the space. I would suggest obtaining televisions that around about 4" to 6" larger than they already are. I also noticed that the channel guide provided was incorrect -- two channels were listed as "HBO Family," when one of them was normal HBO. ' In general, I would recommend the Sheraton Suites to friends and relatives visiting Key West, and when I visit again, I will strongly consider staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool and great location”
Reviews.Author: LKN4SUN
Reviews.Content: Love this place - I've stayed there four times. I love the drive to Key West, so this place has free parking which is great. All rooms are suites with refrigerators, so we get drinks and snacks to keep in the room. Very nice pool and across the street from Smather's beach. They run a shuttle to get you to Duvall Street and the other Key West Attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Service beyond our wildest dreams”
Reviews.Author: Gissegebba
Reviews.Content: We where supposed to check in at Sheraton Key West on Monday the 11th of April, but because I didn't read the reservation, we started driving down on Tuesday! We realized our mistake passing through Marathon and you could all imagine how we felt. We immediately called the hotel thinking the worst, but since we where only 1h from K.W. Mr Fotis, the manager of the front desk told us to keep driving. When we arrived at the hotel he had rescheduled our dates without any extra cost! If this would have been a "regular" hotel, we would have had to pay for the lost night or/and an extra. Mr Fotis did not charge us anything extra even though it was my mistake. Outstanding is a weak word! This is a hotel with extraordinary staff and atmosphere and it will always be our choice when we visit the Keys. /Andreas G.

Reviews.Title: “loved this place”
Reviews.Author: traveler48080
Reviews.Content: We went for my sons wedding. Extended family friends teens and kids also went, Everyone loved this hotel. The rooms were Very spacious, clean and comfortable. The people that worked there were very nice and helpful. The restaurant food was very good, we loved the buffet breakfast. We would go again and so would would my family members

Reviews.Title: “Family vacation”
Reviews.Author: Crano
Reviews.Content: This place was pretty average. Rooms were nice and clean. Concierge was helpful. Free shuttle into town(reserve early the day of, it fills up quick). Staff not very friendly. Pool area was nice. We stayed here to be by the beach, but the beach is not nice. Water is dirty and full of weeds. So we spent most of our time at the pool.

Reviews.Title: “A bit far from town but a beautiful hotel if you can get a good deal.”
Reviews.Author: namila
Reviews.Content: Key West is always pricey but The Sheraton is on par with the other nice hotels in the area. We had a great experience with our stay. As noted in other reviews, a bit far from town but close to the beach. Nothing within walking distance so the shuttle is a must. The only downside is that the slots fill up quickly & on two separate trips people had to sit on laps. Also, quite hot & you're tied to the hourly shuttle times. The room itself was huge and lovely. Staff seemed fine. Shuttle driver wonderful and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Bliss”
Reviews.Author: Jazzigirl
Reviews.Content: When the hotel staff realised that we were taking this trip to celebrate our Wedding Anniversary they kindly upgraded us to an ocean view suite instead of the standard one booked by Virgin Holidays for us. Imagine our surprise when we arrived back after dinner to find chocolate dipped strawberries and champagne in our fridge, what a lovely gesture! We found the free shuttle to town was no problem for us, we went on the 9.30am and it was nowhere near full. Mr Ed, the driver, was a delight and filled us in on a lot of local knowledge and dropped us where we wanted to be dropped. We had a taxi back, in spite of stopping at every red light on the way back it was only 12 dollars which we thought reasonable but then we are used to UK taxi fares! We thought the suite was fantastic and would go back again if we were in the area. I know other people have complained about the shuttle - but - it is free - so no complaints from us. Others also commented about the restaurant, again, we had no complaints about our breakfast which was good. Our other meals we ate downtown in Key WEst.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but away from the action”
Reviews.Author: rachel_vacation
Reviews.Content: Before you book this hotel, you should know a few things. If you are going to Key West to party on Duval, it is not walking distance from this hotel. Key West is not known for its beaches, but Smathers is nice. There is so much to do on Duval that I found myself down there most of the time. At the Sheraton itself, the concierge was great, we loved the shuttle and the driver, the rooms were wonderful and it is across the street from the beach. It is a (very hot!) shuttle ride to Duval Street though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: travelflix
Reviews.Content: I had to reschedule my hotel dates because of some unforeseen circumstances I had a very hard time trying to salvage my reservation but got in contact with Bob Grossman, the general manager for the hotel who went out of his way to reschedule my dates. He was sincere, professional and accommodating. I believe this hotel is in great hands and will grow to be one of the best places to stay in Key West. Keep this hotel on your radar, its hard picking a good one when all you have is pictures and limited information. Reviews are key.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Key West”
Reviews.Author: partypat52
Reviews.Content: Sheraton Key West was great a place to stay during our visit. Love the location, away from the hustle and bustle of Duval Street, but easy enough to get there. Loved that the beach was across the street. The shuttle service was a plus, however, we did have trouble trying to schedule at ride especially between 4:30 and 6:30. I would recommend adding more runs during this time period. Overall the staff was friendly and accommodating, service was great. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor Service - Outdated Bed, Linens, and Furniture”
Reviews.Author: north2alaska
Reviews.Content: Our phone did not work, we were charged for things we did not buy, the room service number went to voice mail and the staff that did answer could not speak english. All rooms open to the outside like a Motel 6 and security is poor. Secuirty was such an issue they wanted us to all wear arm bands for our whole trip, felt like we were in lockdown? In fact, they had police guarding the entrance to the property which meant that you had to show an ID each time you returned. The beach across the street is good but very busy. The parking spots are very tight and my rental car was hit twice by people trying to park next to me. I spend 100 nights a year in hotels - I can tell you I will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Suite Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Dimaro
Reviews.Content: I was a huge fan of the room set up. The suite was well designed and gave my husband and I more than enough room to lounge on a brief vacation. The hotel overall is modern and clearly recently renovated. I could tell though that there were remnants of the old, by an odd smell that just didn't seem right. Since we spent most of our time out of the room, it was only an initial offense upon entering. The customer service was excellent (save one idiot night front desk guy who just could not get off his high horse about how things were typically done - but that was just his bad personality not the hotel, and even he realized his mannerisms were not in keeping with the Starwood brand and shaped up). The hotel is located right across from Smathers Beach and made a great effort to keep the property for guests. Since its far from downtown Duval, the free shuttle to and from that area is a great option, and even better when it took us to the airport when our friends whose wedding we came for, decided they changed their minds about dropping us off. Its got a small, but interesting pool with a good bar and cool jacuzzi, which many of the other properties don't have. I know its Florida, but a late night Jacuzzi dip is just a vacation must! All in all, great stay. I rate it down one Star based on distance, and that hint of you used to be an older hotel. Also, because the price, likely inflated for the Spring Break crown was a bit more than I'd expect for a place not actually ON the beach.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I could have stayed longer!!”
Reviews.Author: mew0359
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Suites during Easter 2010. Considering it was my very first time visiting Key West, it was fantastic! The room we had slept 5-6, the grounds are immaculate, the pool is fantastic. We had no problem with the internet. Staff is great!There's also an Internet Cafe for guests. Trust me, my job is Property Management, so I spot the details! Ok, so the Hotel is not located on Duval Street, but Key West is only 4 miles long! Get a bike and you can be on Duval Street in 15 minutes. That way you can see more of the Island!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay. No problems.”
Reviews.Author: kirstinpimental
Reviews.Content: I was a little wary to stay here after some of the previous reviews. I went the first weekend of March 2011 with my Mom and Sisters. We had a great time. Everyone was very nice and helpful. The front desk was great. No problems like people have previously reported. The staff at the pool bar was very friendly, as was the people who worked at the restaurant. Everything was very clean. The shuttle service was great, very accommodating. It was nice to be across from the beach. We weren't right near Duval St., but it was so easy to get down there and back that it was no problem. Probably a lot quieter, especially at night. I would definitely recommend anyone to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: REDSOXFANTASTIC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton Suites and were married across the street on Smather's Beach. Prior to the wedding we shipped our wedding attire, flowers, etc. to the hotel as we were flying into Key West. The hotel staff was great to work with, had our packages ready upon check in and were friendly and accomodating. The balcony oceanview rooms are GREAT!!! See beautiful sunrises from your deck with a cup of coffee to start your day in Key West. Great beds but pillows are too soft. Rooms are very clean and HUGE!!! Restaurant is nice but pricey. The internet connection was virtually non-existant but there is so much to do in Key West who needs it... This is a nice quiet place to stay - and return to after a day of "doing Duval Street" - If you're over 30 you'll appreciate the quiet retreat after a day of shopping and pub crawling! We highly recommend the Sheraton Suites and will return next time we visit Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Rooms - Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: gbtrotter
Reviews.Content: Loved the Sheraton Suites! Located right across the street From Smathers Beach but far removed from the hustle and bustle of Duval Street. We checked in around 6pm on a Monday night. We knew the hotel offered a free shuttle downtown so we inquired. There was space for 4 at 7:30pm but no space on any of the returns. Since we had a rental car we drove downtown and had no problem locating parking. Generally the meters are the way to go but several of the lots vacant after normal business hours (banks, etc.) open up for a set price for the evening ($10 to $15). You usually pay the guy who's sitting in the folding chair at the driveway! We never had a problem finding a parking spot in the meters after looking for no more than 10 minutes. We ended up in a great King Suite at the corner of a building overlooking the pool from the top floor. I'd like to think my SPG Gold membership got us that room but maybe we were just lucky! The room was gorgeous with lots of living space. The patio overlooking the pool was a perfect place to relax. The pool itself has a large waterfall and a jacuzzi tub. The restaurant was reasonably priced and offered really good options for breakfast - we didn't eat lunch or dinner on property. Beach access is just across the street. There is a kiosk on the beach where you can rent all the beach toys (kayaks, small hobie sailboats, etc.) along with beach chairs and umbrellas. If you're going to be out there for more than a day you should probably buy a chair - the rental (if I remember correctly) were $10 a day. You can buy a chair at local stores for around $15. Same with a beach umbrella. Down the beach a little further on the street was a food vending truck. The nightly Sunset Celebration is a great, free event. But bring some bills for the hard-working entertainers who provide the fun. We also really enjoyed Truman's Little White House.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mplstraveler
Reviews.Content: The rooms at this hotel are just about perfect. Two rooms with sliding doors between them. Wonderful beds with new bedding. Alot of storage and a microwave and fridge. Nice vanity area. It all looked new except the sectional which was not that bad. Across the street from a very nice beach. Pool is large with a waterfall. Drinks are pricey. Will definetly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: lakita78
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about the Sheraton...everyone was so friendly, from the housekeeping staff to the concierge. The hotel is located directly across the street from Smathers Beach (which was also beautiful). The room was wonderful and spacious; there was even an in-room safe to keep you valuables; the couch and the bed were the most comfortable ever!!! The hotel provides a shuttle to take guests to the downtown area and it also brings you back. The concierge also provides lots of information and suggestions (coupons too) for things to do and places to go...the trolley tour was great. Eating out can be a bit expensive so if you are planning to stay for an extended period of time, a trip to the grocery store is strongly advised. I could go on and on about the Sheraton and Key West, but I suggest you go and experience it for yourself and stay at this hotel!!!!! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great beach front hotel ...off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: Maverick64
Reviews.Content: This place can be summed up in one word ... flawless ! Located across the street from the most beautiful beach in Key West - Smathers Beach and literally 1.7 miles from Duval street it is prefect!!! The service was fantastic, the grounds are very well kept, with a cool pool.... and the piece de Resistance ... the room - comfortable, huge, it is literally the size of a small apartment, with a small kitchenette, a dining table a huge couch and and super comfortable bed, oh yeah and the bathroom is also pretty darn big. We had a magical weekend staying here and every went on without a hitch, good laid back service at a very reasonable price. This is the place to stay in Key West. Since we brought our bikes, we did not have to move our car at all in the 3 days we were there, Duval street is just a short ride from the hotel.... don't own a bike? Or don't feel like shipping them down with you ? No problem, the hotel has plenty of bikes for rent as well.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 1coach10
Reviews.Content: Stayed Febuary 18--22. Check in was quick and efficient. When i read of some complaining about finding their rooms, I laugh how hard is it to take an elevator to desired floor and look at the numbers, Cmon!!! The room was average, but very clean with a big marbled shower. Housekeeping was up to par, as were the grounds, The pool area was nice and clean. I found the girls at the front desk very accomadating. The shuttle service was prompt as well it should be because the location for me is not where I wanted to be. I had breakfast at the Coral Crab and i thought it sucked, but i kind of figured that but I needed a bite to eat so shame on me. Really there are so many great spots to eat in Key West , why bother with this in house restaraunt. Smather's Beach across the road was nice. My wife was here for a work seminar so our hand was kind of forced to stay here and we did get a good rate for the first couple of nights because of the group rate for the seminar, but $300 plus with tax is too high for the caliber of this hotel. While in Key West we stay at Ocean Key and are spoiled by their superior resort. All in all the Sheraton was just average.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and near the water”
Reviews.Author: bdegs123
Reviews.Content: Though near the airport, we didn't hear any planes during our stay except maybe a one during the day. The hotel is across the street from the water in the quiet part of Key West which is a nice area to stay. it's a 2.5 mile walk to Duvall Street and the busy part of Key West. Though there is some benefit to staying closer, we found it a welcome change and quiet to be a little further from the partying crowd at the end of the day. the hotel was nice, the conceriege and people at the front desk were very nice and helpful. my son's braces broke twice and we asked for a flashlight and bought tweezers and they couldn't be more helpful. the pool is very nice too. our room was a suite and was nice and quiet. Overrall, a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed, terrible facilities missing the basics.”
Reviews.Author: JustAUser90210
Reviews.Content: We paid extra, hoping for a good experience with good service. We were VERY disappointed. Our room was a very long walk, all the way on the far side of the hotel. The room was on the 3rd floor, the elevator in that wing is broken. The ice machine was also broken. A number of rooms had no room numbers, which I believe means they are no longer being rented out due to something being very wrong with their condition. The Internet was slow and kept going out every few minutes, which was extremely frustrating, not fun or useful. We complained and they offered us another room in another wing, but the Internet didn't work at all in that room, leading me to believe their Internet just does not work for significant parts of the hotel. A real quality, service-oriented hotel would just buy a few inexpensive Internet routers or repeaters to extend their signal, this should only cost a few hundred dollars at most. Why are they skimping? The fire alarm went off at 10pm one night right after we had climbed the stairs to go to bed, so we climbed back down to the parking lot to wait. It was very loud, our child was scared. There was no fire, so either the hotel's system malfunctioned, or someone pulled the alarm. We returned to our room and the alarm went off again, due to the fire dept. testing the system. Elevator, ice, Internet access, working fire alarms, peace and quiet after 10pm. If they can't get even the basics right, nothing else matters.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, and spacious suites”
Reviews.Author: jus4fun46
Reviews.Content: Very clean, comfortable, and spacious suites. Everyone was very friendly and eager to please, less one gentleman at the front desk. Although not within walking distance of Key West, the free shuttle makes travel back and forth quite easy. Free internet and parking was also a plus. Short walk to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Very spacious accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: jcleary62
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay if you don't want to be in the thick of things! It's a great place to come back to decompress. Rooms are spacious and have ample room to relax. Bathrooms are also able to handle the storage of all your belongings! Beautiful beach across the street!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: leire38
Reviews.Content: I was in this hotel last december with some friends for 4 nights. The hotel is very nice, the room was big with 2 separates parts, one with the beds and the other with sofas, Tv (in the bedroom there is another one), coffee maker, micro wave, refrigerator...even it was december we used the swimming pool which is ok (probably too crowded in summer) and the jacuzzi too. The hotel is far from the city center to go walking but there is a bus service at the hotel that takes you to the city. There is a long way to walk but no bars/shops around. The beach is very close (not the best of key west). We didn't had breakfast, just some coffee/chocolate so I can't not give any opinion about it. Nice hotel in general

Reviews.Title: “We liked it”
Reviews.Author: OneLittleBug
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights, and found it to be very comfortable and clean. The front desk was nice and helpful, and the concierge was really really wonderful. We didn't try the hotel restaurant because it reeked of overpriced mediocrity. Our wireless worked the whole time, in each room, but it was a little confusing to set up. (You have to log in from the Sheraton homepage?!) The pool was really nice, everything was really clean, and the hot tub was the *best* one I have ever had the pleasure to see at a hotel or resort. It not only had mood lights, but it was HOT. Like melt your toes off hot. I LOVED that, but it may take some getting used to for those of you that don't enjoy boiling. It was also very clean. We didn't use the shuttle because we had a car, but we rented bikes there on-site, and used them most of the time. I highly recommend doing this - its not only economic but fun. The location was perfect for us - right across the street from the best beach on the island (don't let anyone send you on a goose chase to the state park beach - its not at all a swimming beach and its not free). Also, it was well away from the bar and cruise ship crowd - we could go there but we could also stay away and that was nice. Also, there is a little convenience store/liquor store on the main road to town. There is also a little window that serves the most delicious sandwiches and coffee. We had both cuban sandwiches and breakfast sandwiches and they were great. While I don't think this was really a 'resort' by any stretch, it was very enjoyable and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, spacious, well appointed rooms”
Reviews.Author: WVMtneer
Reviews.Content: Just finished my second 5-day stay at this hotel. We liked it just as much as last year. The rooms are large. Large bath with large walkin shower (no tub), separate toilet room, lots of storage. Nice safe that'll hold a laptop, large purse. Dining table, small fridge, microwave, bar sink. Comfortable couch and chair. Two flatscreen TVs. This year our room overlooked the ocean/Smathers Beach. From the balcony we can watch sunup and sundown. The wide sidewalk along the beach is a great place to walk, ride or skate-over 2 miles long. You can rent bikes at the hotel. The staff is nice, helpful. We'll probably go again next year. I'll never stay anywhere else in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, but far from downtown”
Reviews.Author: nacul
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff and rooms. The big problem is its location. Although is seafront, it is far from downtown, where everything happens.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: cwpicard
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and the SPG Suite we used our points to get was extremely clean, updated, and comfortable. The king bed was great - very comfortable. What we liked most about this hotel was the location - across Key West away from the cruise ships and crowds. It was located on Smathers Beach - a wonderful gem better than most we have experienced. One last note - our concierge, Pavla Sparenberg, wmade our entire stay successful. She listened to our needs and desires and everything she recommended was amazing. If you are looking for a quiet place away from the crowds, this is a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Except for Pavla....just average.”
Reviews.Author: JuJuTN
Reviews.Content: The wi-fi is not as advertised. Our balcony room had no access and when I inquired about it, was told I would have to go stand outside the room to gain access! They were kind enough to connect me to the tech, but regardless, there was no access and unless they update their equipment, there WILL be no access, save in the lobby. May I just share that the Concierge, Pavla, is this hotel's redeeming quality!?! She was very engaging, knowledgeable, and confirmed that her recommendations were top drawer! She remembered names and picked up with the same conversation from the day before...quite impressive! The pool area was lovely and IF you enjoy a soft bed, you will enjoy your sleep. I was particularly impressed with the maintenance staff. The ladies taking care of our room were most accommodating and willing to make our stay a memorable one. I did prefer the location of this hotel. While on the opposite side of the island from the excitement, it was quiet

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: RobertoAlbuquerque
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nicely located across the street from Smathers Beach, but away from Duval Street. The rooms are spacious, clean, quiet and very comfortable. The staff was very friendly and shared ideas of where to go for where to eat. The shuttle service to Duval Street was great. Good choice in Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, a little out of the way if you don't have a car”
Reviews.Author: oregonexpress
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, right across from Smather's beach. It is a bit out of the way for those who don't rent a car. Service was excellent, food was great. They do have a shuttle service in to the heart of Key West, but it fills up fast, so be sure to make reservations to get on it. There may be a wait.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and a Great Sleep!”
Reviews.Author: laurmich96
Reviews.Content: Made the drive into Key West from MIami on a motorcycle looking to stay one night in the Keys and return the next. We booked the Sheraton Suites online after looking at the reviews on TripAdvisor and were not disappointed. Arrived late (7pm) on Jan 26, and the front desk checked us in quickly and efficiently. The room had a large king size bed with doors that closed so you had privacy from the living room and sitting area. Nice big marble shower. Great pillows, comfortable bed and more importantly- a quiet sleep. We liked Key West so much we stayed an extra night in this hotel. It is located directed across the street from the beach and away from the busy downtown. There is a regular shuttle that takes you downtown to the restaurants/bars. Overall a great place to stay- You can enjoy the busy nightlife and come back to your quiet Hotel, just minutes away. Great for seeing the sunrise and sunset from your room also.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: srvary88
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nicely located across the street from Smathers Beach and away from Duval Street. Our room was to the rear of the hotel, but very quiet and easy to walk through the property to the bar and restaurant. The bar was not open late but the staff was very friendly. The shuttle service to Duval Street was great-nice not to worry about finding parking and also great not to worry about driving after visiting Duval Street. The shuttle driver, Steve was great. Need to sign up early for the shuttle but usually had a few no shows each time. Staff was friendly and shared ideas of where to go for good food and fun.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: PlanetR
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms across the street from Smather's Beach. Clerk at check in was dumber then dirt. Didn't give us any information, actually forgot to give keys to the room! Not impressed with her. Room itself is nice, spacious and comfortable. Microwave, fridge, safe in room with 2 flat screen tvs. Restaurant bar not open very late and people complained about that. Shuttle bus is convenient, but last shuttle is too early, should go till midnight on weekends at least.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem, roomy and elegantly relaxed, a perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Vintagebydesign
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location, across from the beach and away from Duval street, but a free shuttle every hour into town and airport. Rooms are all suites large and comfortable with microwave and wet bars, living room areas , well designed space with pocket doors to close off the bedroom for privacy. Comfortable beds and nice vanity area, lots of storage space. We were a large group and treated very well. The restaurant staff was particularly accomodating. As people in our group trickled into the restaurant , we kept adding to tables, asked for separate checks etc and it was never a problem. Many of us asked for a late checkout last minute and they accomodated as many as possible. Pool was heated and lovely, a hot tub in the corner. Restaurant closed at 9 and bar at 11pm, a little early for our crowd and Key West but that is my only complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Great property; desk staff needs a tune-up”
Reviews.Author: natbro
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with Starwoods points. It is a 3 minute drive from the airport and a 5 minute drive to Old Town where we had no problem finding street parking. As most previous posters have said, the suites are nicely appointed and the bathroom is spacious with separate WC. Wifi worked in the living room, but not in our bedroom, but it's free which is a nice perk. We had trouble finding the thermostat; after hunting around it was discovered behind the living room TV. We were in room 301 which has a balcony overlooking the pool. The room location is very quiet and we heard no noise from adjacent neighbors. There was some aircraft noise but it died down late in the evening. Housekeeping did a good job, but there seemed to be a shortage of washcloths because we had to ask for them a couple of times. Mr. Bruno checked us in. He was notable by his reticence in giving information. He gave us the xeroxed property map and showed us where to park to be near our room and told us there was a shuttle available to take to town. It would have been helpful for him to point out some of the items on the info sheet, such as- there is a guest laundry room, where the work out room is located and it's hours (24 hour access). He offered no map of the area. Getting tickets for the shuttle from him was like playing "20 Questions". Ed, the shuttle driver is delightful and full of useful and interesting facts (ie opposite of Mr. Bruno). We ate a light, late dinner in their Coral Crab Cafe. Food was average, but our waiter was outstanding and I'm sorry we didn't get his name so that I could note it here. We would definitely stay here again if returning to KW. Would have rated it a "5" but for Mr. Bruno's lack of people skills.

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: curlyt0p990
