Reviews.Content: The Sheraton suites is newly nenovated adn looks really nice. The rooms are comfortable and it's nice to have the space. The best part was being accross from the beautiful smathers beach and the free shuttle to downtown. We had a bit of an issue when we checked in - the bath water from the room above cascaded into our bathroom!! They sent the engineer immidiately, who cleaned it up and asked the people on the floor above to shower rather than have a bath, since it was the overflow drain that was the problem. However, since it was the weekend, and there were no rooms available, we had to wait till the next day to get a new room. We lost a good bit of the morning with the morning staff got thier act together and moved us to a new room, and we had a great stay after that. The staff did a very good job, given the holiday rush they were experiencing.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Key West?”
Reviews.Author: YackSPEED
Reviews.Content: We booked this room through AAA.com, needless say we got a great rate for our one night stay. The location can't be beat if you are looking for a quiet Keys experience, the hotel is right across the street from Smathers beach. The room and hotel were very clean and the staff was very helpful. This hotel also takes pets, my 2 Golden Retrievers love their stay. The courtesy shuttle to downtown was a added bonus. Not often can you take a weekend get away and feel like it didn't just fly by, I highly recommend the Sheraton Suites Key West if you are staying in Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience, maily with front desk. A 2 star hotel at most”
Reviews.Author: Avi911
Reviews.Content: The first point of contact with Sheraton, when I booked the hotel, was very positive. The chat over the Internet with client support was very helpful. It started to look bad when we arrived the hotel with a very cold welcome from a lady at the front desk, but an OK service. Than we found out that our room we were given is next to the machine room, so noisy, we couldnâ€™t sleep. I called the reception and asked to change rooms. After talking to four people I was told that the only available room are also next to the machine room and we will have the same problem. I replied that if is the case I will leave, since it's impossible to stay in ht room. Than I was asked to wait and surprisingly, a different room was found. We moved to the new room on the second floor carrying our 6 pieces of luggage (no assistance was offered to us) to find that the elevator isnâ€™t working. My wife and 3 children waited in the lobby while I approached the front desk saying the elevator doesn't work. Again, nobody really cared and we had to wait 20 minutes to get someone to look at it and operate it. The rooms need refurbishment. I would rate it as a 2 star hotel at most. Wouldnâ€™t go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “2 days of fun in Key West”
Reviews.Author: jewelrydiva247
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Sheraton Suites 2 days, Dec. 23 & 24, 2010. Very nice hotel, decorated lovely for Christmas! Room was very spacious and clean and the king size bed was very comfy! They could have supplied our room with more towels though-we had to grab a few more from the cleaning ladies in the hallway. I tried twice to contact the front desk and no one answered. Beautiful pool, loved the salt water, water fall and colored lights at night. The hot tub was not heated the first night we were there though, but it was the second night. We loved the gourmet breakfast buffet in the hotels restaurant-very worth the price, and a lovely view while dining! We walked over to Smather's Beach on Christmas morning around 6:00 and the sunrise was absolutely beautiful over the oceans beach area!! It was better than any sunset we saw in KW. What a nice treat for Christmas morning in Key West!! We also liked the shuttle service, easy and convenient, although the driver Stephen was not friendly at all (Ed must have been on vacation!). Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the Sheraton Suites and would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed at first but TWO great front desk staff helped make it pleasant”
Reviews.Author: caligreen
Reviews.Content: Similar to another reviewer, I was disappointed to hear that there was a difference between booking directly with the hotel and with Priceline or similar websites. I found that the rates were actually the same so I wished I had known better and booked directly from the hotel. There was some mixup initially as I had paid extra on Priceline for a room with a kindbed and ocean view, but apparently the hotel said that these 3rd party sites had no right to sell this. So they initially upgraded me under the Starwood program, only to then rectify that I had paid extra so got me a better room later. Fortunately, thanks to the initiative of Mr Ireland, who truly welcomed me and since I was also a Starwood Preferred member, was able to rectify the situation and gave me a good room. I was disappointed at first as the first floor ocean view room overlooks the road, and at street level is noisy and there is little privacy. Between him and Mr Fortis Tagliana, they changed me to a 3rd floor room for a few days of my stay so I could get a great view of the ocean above the tree level. I saw from my room the best sunrise and subset, and it was very relaxing indeed. The hotel offers shuttle services to downtown although these get booked up quickly. The restaurant downstairs is horrible---service is slow and food is average. Forget thus about ordering room service as the same waiters seem to offer room service and serve in the restaurant. Concierge desk is helpful but I suggest you do your own homework to substantiate before signing on. I had a 50:50 chance of a good trip she recommended. Having said that, the Sheraton overlooks the best beach in Key West and I hugely recommend it from that front. The rooms are very spacious and well laid out. Very clean and nice new fixtures. So eat out, and if you dont have to deal with bad service (almost rude--one waitress was even a little rude)=and ask for Mr Ireland and Fortis to make your stay a pleasant one---most of all, join the Starwood Preferred member and order your room direct from the hotel. PS. Appreciated the free Internet service although it did not always work. Nice heated pool!!

Reviews.Title: “Surprised and disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: jason55543
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™m so surprised and disappointed in this experience that I need to share it in the hopes that someone from Starwood will remedy this situation. Here it is- I was scheduled for a 3 day stay at this property but due to a blizzard could not get a flight out of the NY area. Refunds were promptly given for the flight tickets, but I was told by the manager of this property, Jitka P., that no refunds were allowed since I purchased through Travelocity. She continued that if I had booked direct sheâ€™d be able to authorize a refund easily. Travelocity of course is blaming Sheraton. Why does it matter how I booked? Shouldn't all guests be treated fairly? I find it incredible that I now need to battle like this over such a simple issue. Time to step up, Starwood.

Reviews.Title: “DIDN'T LIKE IT MUCH”
Reviews.Author: UKPeripatetic
Reviews.Content: With some hotels, you immediately like or dislike them without really knowing why. This was one I rather disliked. Perhaps it's because we feel claustrophobic in a hotel with internal corridors and no balconies. My wife uses a wheelchair, so we had booked a room with a modified bathroom. Reception was at first floor level (the term used in the British English way) and there were steps up to it from the car park. There was a lift, though its grotty entrance made it feel like a service lift. There was a chiliness to the whole reception process - no people-friendly service here. Our room was a couple of floors up, and we had to cross a bridge with self-closing doors at either end - not easy with a wheelchair. The suite was large and very comfortable, and with a particularly good bathroom. But - bearing in my mind this was an "accessible" bathroom - if you pulled the sliding bathroom door fully across there was no way of opening it from the inside except by putting your finger on the top of the door and sliding it back - so a lone wheelchair traveller would have been imprisoned. The courtyard area is pleasant, but as in many American hotels we smokers were made to feel like lepers. The pool area was good, but there were people erecting what looked like a stage, so in addition to the usual noise around a pool there was the din from carpenters and their power tools. It is located across the road from a wonderful beach, but to get there you have to cross a busy four-lane road with no crossing points.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, great prices.”
Reviews.Author: BigSeaton
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. Its in quiet part of Key West but just minutes from the action.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good place”
Reviews.Author: mkwald
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews about the rude staff, I was ready to do battle, but we never had anyone be mean or rude to us. The room was very nice, the bed was awesome and it seemed fine to us. There is a very strict no smoking policy that I wasn't aware of so beware of that. There is a smoking area hidden in the courtyard but don't even think about smoking on the balcony b/c they will yell at you (it's their right since it is their property; just follow the rules). The pool was quite nice (you can't do laps or anything but it was a nice size), but a little shady due to palm trees, etc. Iguanas tend to eat your popcorn if you leave it sitting on your beach chair. The location is ok - it's right across from the beach, however to get to Duval and downtown, you gotta take the hotel shuttle or a cab. Plan ahead if you want to use the shuttle. You just need to go into the lobby the day you want to use the shuttle, get tickets and be on time. We did this to get down there but used a cab to get back. I think next time we will stay closer to Duval since we spent a lot of time there. The restaurant in the hotel is pretty boring. Breakfast was great, lunch and dinner was blah. The guest services is nice but be prepared to spend about 10 minutes there while the girl goes through her prepared speech on restaurants. The bartenders at the poolside bar were awesome even if the price of drinks is super super high. Overall, I really thought they did a good job so I'd recommend it...just follow their rules and plan ahead for the shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for our Destination Wedding!”
Reviews.Author: nichall10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were married in Key West on 10/10/10 on Smathers Beach. We stayed at the Sheraton from October 7-14. We had about 50 guests attend the wedding and they all stayed at the Sheraton as well. After the ceremony, we literally walked right across the street to the hotel where we had the reception. We chose the outside pool deck area which was perfect. We had chosen a buffet style dinner and everybody raved about how great all of the food was. My dad said that he thought the beef was the best he had ever had. The buffet also included Key Lime Pie and chocolate cake. People kept telling me how great the Key Lime pie was and I never heard a word about how good the special wedding cake was that we ordered. We had also eaten some breakfasts as well as a lunch or two at the hotel. And all of the food was great! Our room was very large and very nice! When we got to our room after checking in, they had a bottle of champage and chocolate dipped strawberries waiting for us, along with a very nice welcome note. We had an ocean view room and it was great getting up in the morning and looking out the window at the beautiful Smathers Beach. We slept great! The beds were very comfy. Our room was cleaned every day and the staff was all very nice and accomodating. I really enjoyed the coffee/tea maker in the rooms! We really loved the location. It was so nice to have access to a great swimming pool at the hotel as well as having the beach right across the street. It would have been nice to have been a little closer to Old Town, but the free shuttle was great and we took advantage of it often! As usual, we ran into some minor issues here and there. But with the help of Bob Grossman, Mo Khan and Carly Risko Rowland, they made sure that everything was well taken care of for us. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, especially for those getting married on Smathers Beach! It was so worth it not having to provide transportation for everybody to and from the ceremony.

Reviews.Title: “Stay again in a heart beat!”
Reviews.Author: kkroe77
Reviews.Content: The hotel was decorated beautifully for X-mas and I loved the Palm trees with Christmas lights! The staff was very helpful and friendly. The rate was what is to be expected for Key West, right by the airport! The beach is across the street from the hotel with multiple activities for one to participate in. Since the hotel is out of the was a smidge, they offer shuttles, numerous shuttles to all the hot spots in Key West. The rooms were beautiful, and very clean, unless you looked directly behind the toilet, which could use a little extra scrubbing. I would stay here again, tomorrow!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: RhodeIslandBlinny
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5day stay. We really loved our stay and would recommend this hotel to all. Hotel seems to be recently renovated or updated. Even though it was just the two of us, we could see this hotel is great for families too. Rooms were very large, modern and clean. Encluded in our king suite was kitchenette with sink, cabinets, fridge, one cup coffee maker with starbucks coffees and cups, wooden dinette with chairs. We noticed the couch pulled out for an extra bed with it's own tv. Bedroom also had its own tv. Double access to large stone bathroom with lots of cabinets for storing clothing/bags, Iron/board, private toilet, safe. We absolutly loved the salt water pool with waterfall, hottub, and lots of chairs and shade for all. Onsite open air bar. Restaurant with inside a/c or outdoor seating overlooking the pool. Hotel is located directly across from Smathers beach were you can rent chairs and water toys. Hotel does offer onsite parking however island does provide hourly shuttles. The Key West airport is about a 2-5min drive from hotel, however it didn't affect our time there. Hotel is not within walking distance to Davall St. or other restaurants/shopping. We booked our trip on priceline.com and really was not sure what to expect and as you can see we were very surprised and happy.

Reviews.Title: “Way Over Priced! Do not Deliver Whats Promised!”
Reviews.Author: voigtfam
Reviews.Content: stayed two nights mid november,told front Desk that it was 25th Anniversary,and was given what i consider one of the worst rooms on the property.The farthest corner with some kind of huge fans making a racket,and some kind of banging noises.Stayed there one night ,then internet stopped working.Next Morning asked for a different room with internet that works,got a different room but wifi still did not work.After complaining again all i got was they were going to reset the router.Anyway it never worked.Very Disappointing for aSheraton.I expected to pay more for our special ocasion ,but this was a real let down

Reviews.Title: “Return Trip a Must!!!”
Reviews.Author: SteveS22601
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed here November 6th & left on the 11th,2010.Great room. Breakfast Buffet was great. Landscaping very beautifully done. I liked the quietness of not only our room but the entire area. My wife & I work 12hour-a-day jobs plus I own a business so when we get a chance to take time away, we hope our money was spent wisely.....in this case,,, it certainly was. Only problem I encountered was the downtown shuttle should have been more frequent. Overall, there's no need to spend $400.00/night when this Hotel is as nice as it is....Oh yea, loved the Mojitos in the lobby....nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but.....”
Reviews.Author: SLSpa
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was acceptable, but their lack of attention to detail made an otherwise very nice hotel into a somewhat frustrating experience. The rooms were far above average for comparably priced hotels in Key West. However, the pool area was too small for this size hotel, and the majority of it was shaded for most of the day. The biggest disappointment was the "free" shuttle service, which proved to be difficult and inconvenient. The shuttle filled up quickly and required reservations, and this required far too many taxi rides at about $15 per trip one way. Reservations had to be made in person, at the front desk, and they could only be made the same day. This was extremely difficult for the first shuttle of the day (9:30am). The overall hotel staff (drivers, conceirege, pool attendant, housekeeping, and wait staff) was very friendly, but this was overshadowed by the lack of concern displayed by management.

Reviews.Title: “would stay here again without hesitation”
Reviews.Author: justjulie2me
Reviews.Content: This was our third time to Key West and our first time at the Sheraton Suites. We chose to stay there based on availability, price, and ability to comfortably accommodate 7 adults in 2 suites. We liked: close proximity to white sandy beach; spacious, well-appointed, clean suites with super nice bedding, mini fridge and microwave; pretty pool area with jacuzzi tub and waterfall; poolside restaurant's convenience, excellent service, and good quality food at reasonable prices; and free parking and free shuttle to/from town and airport. The only thing some would consider a downside is that it is pretty close to the airport, so you can hear the rumble of jets departing, which seemed to occur mostly in the afternoon. For me, it planted the idea that next time I come down I'd like to fly directly into KW airport and not rent a car. On my next trip to KW I would definitely stay at the Sheraton Suites.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: domvaca
Reviews.Content: just got back from 4 night stay during fantsy week and i recommend this hotel 100% great room, good food , nice salt water pool, pay movies, shuttle into towne, beach across the street, very friendly and helpful staff and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: StickyQuilter
Reviews.Content: Clean, well appointed suites - more like an apartment than a hotel room. If I were staying in Key West for a week, this would definitely be my choice. Not convenient to old town, but they do run a complimentary shuttle to get you there and back. Microwave and refrigerator, nice bathroom area, plenty of space, plenty of shelf and cabinet space. Nice pool area. Didn't try the food.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Just Out of the Way”
Reviews.Author: flowergirl4
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton is a great hotel with many amenities. We stayed here and were quite happy with the size of the room. The hotel staff was very friendly. The only downside would have to be it's location. It's a distance from Duval so you either have to drive or take their shuttle. The drive to Duval isn't bad but you do have to pay for parking which can range anywhere from $5.00 to $20.00. We used the shuttle service one morning( which you must prebook with the front desk ahead of time) problem was they forgot to tell us about prebooking for our return trip. Thank God the driver was having a good moment and allowed us on the bus without a ticket. If you are looking for a quiet nights sleep this hotel isn't it. I'm not sure if it was our room location but it sounded as if the people on the upstairs floor were moving furniture at very early AM hours and outside in the hallway a herd of buffalo were running. On another note I'm not quite sure why hotels have gotten in their mind that all the bedding should be down. It's really isn't best for people with allergies.

Reviews.Title: “After the bad reviews I was pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: Durrordie1
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Hotwire.com and at $130 a night I was dissapointed to find that we were in "New Town", but I am so glad we found this Gem! We arrived in Key West right at sunset on a Saturday night. We were put in a Double Queen suite. We pulled the sofa bed out and it was very uncomfortable. We called the front desk and asked to have maintenance come up and replace some missing springs, and they instantly upgraded us to an oceanview suite with 2 king beds and a comfy sofa sleeper! The 2nd shift manager went OUT of his way to make us happy. He even held up the shuttle so we could go downtown and enjoy the Mallory Square festivities.....complete with local bar/restaurant drink coupons!! The last return shuttle was full, so we thought we'd have to get a cab, but "Ed" the driver told us to hold tight and he'd come back to get us.(Note to future riders....enjoy the ride, and toss a few bucks his way! He is amazing!) The Hotel/Island hospitality is something that keeps my family and I coming back! The next day we rented mopeds only to find we were only few blocks from "Old Town". We had the best of Old Town without the crowds! It was fantastic!!! We will certainly stay here again! Now also, keep in mind, we made this trip with 3 teenagers and they were ecstatic. The hotel had WiFi, a stellar pool and perfectly manicured grounds. We left this hotel planning another trip down where we would fly right into Key West, forgo the rental car, stay at the Sheraton and get scooters for the week at $90 a person, instead of driving from Tampa.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Komada
Reviews.Content: I would never stay in this hotel again if Jitka[---] still the front office MANAGER, she is rude and very unprofessional, she doesn't know what customer service is about, I stayed in this hotel for my sister's wedding and I literally missed half of the ceremony waiting for the front office manager ( [---]) to come out of her office , I was locked out of my room and couldn't get ready on time for the wedding. She was not very accommodating with my situation and decided to make it hard for me. I felt mentally abused by her and offended by one of her comments, she said that if I wasn't ready on time for my sister's wedding, then that was my problem, I refused to be treated like that again, I have more than one reason not to go back to this hotel. This lady doesn't deserve the front office manager position. The rest of the hotel staff was very nice but unfortunately overshadowed by the manager's actions.

Reviews.Title: “Rest, rest and more rest.”
Reviews.Author: LyndaHowlett
Reviews.Content: We had a few days here before travelling up to Orlando to do the parks and shopping. we are a large family group of 9, of various ages and stayed in 4 suites. The staff were friendly and helpful. The reception staff were more than accomodating, and endevoured to meet any requests made, especially the concierge, who organised some trips for the younger members of the group, at some very good rates. The hotel was clean the pool was sheer bliss, the location is also amazing. No complaints from any of us, we were all very happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: v82
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights, New decor in rooms, fresh paint and granite countertops, 2 flat screen TVs, marble floors in bathrooms, nice pool area, does not charge extra for parking or "resort fees", (YEAH!) Did not use the restaurant. Free shuttle bus to downtown key west, free wi-fi (poor signal in rooms), did have a good business room with 4 computers and a printer that had a good wi-fi signal. Was not Ocean front, but was across the street from Smathers Beach, not a private beach. Loved it, hated to leave. Got a great last-minute price at key West Visitors Center.

Reviews.Title: “Location to a beach is great, friendly shuttle drivers”
Reviews.Author: fieldops
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the hotel and the price was in line with Key West. Front desk check in was quick by female employee but male had a smart attitude (don't think he was trying to be funny). Room was nice, great pool area. Ordered an $8 breakfast via room service which end cost was $17. (didn't do that but once) shuttle service to downtown was a plus and the drivers Doug and Ed were great. (especially Ed) we would return if back in the area

Reviews.Title: “awesome trip with great shuttle drivers steve and ed”
Reviews.Author: Karyl54
Reviews.Content: read what the hotel gives you the first day. everyone was awesome very helpful and very knowledgeable about the area and what to do here. ask questions everyone can help you and tell you exactly where to go and what to see. can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel with accommodating staff.”
Reviews.Author: IrishRover34996
Reviews.Content: I was very pleasantly surprised after reading a number of negative reviews on this hotel after I had made my reservation. There were no bed bugs, the wi-fi worked just fine, the staff was more than accommodating, the beds were heaven to sleep on and the overall appearance was excellent. There is a great pool with hot tub and outside bar. What else do you need. We had our own car so no problems with going into town about 2-1/2 miles away. Great beach with plenty of toys like Hobbie-cats, jjet ski's etc.

Reviews.Title: “DONT GIVE THIS HOTEL YOUR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: Pink1141975
Reviews.Content: The staff of this hotel (particularly Managers Fottis and Perutkova) are dishonest. We were going to depart early from this hotel for other obvious reasons (i.e. its terrible location and its less than satisfactory state) and there is a $75 fee for an early departure. The Manager Fottis assured myself and my friends that we would not have to pay the $75 fee. Nevertheless the fee was assessed to us despite the manager's representation otherwise. When confronted the next day, the Manager Fottis lied and said that he had never made such a representation. Essentially accusing me the customer of lying about the hotel's promise to waive the fee. I have never been treated so poorly by hotel staff. Please dont give this hotel your money. There are far better places to stay in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: Deenusser
Reviews.Content: We were staying at another place down the road. After exploring the grounds of this hotel, we decided to check in here. Called them up and asked them what it would cost? They gave it to us for $99. The best thing about this place is their beach. Hotel room is a bit dated, but we don't spend much time in our rooms-it was adequate and did have a great bed and linens. We had dinner at their restaurant upstairs-and it was very very good. Would definately recommend eating there. Good spot for exploring the Keys-including Key West which was a 2 hour drive if I recall correctly. We would go back again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “An OK place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jlp306
Reviews.Content: We used priceline to get a nicer hotel at a lower rate and ended up at the Sheraton. It was actually Bike Week the weekend we went so hotels were fuller than expected so not as willing to take priceline deals. The Sheraton wasn't bad. The room was great, the lobby, and pool, and other facilities were very nice. The staff was just ok. It was a little strange how to get towels, sign up for the shuttle, and do almost anything, you had to go through the front desk staff, which was always busy, and sometimes not so smart. Signing up for the shuttle is a must, but the times we wanted were never available and slightly inconvenient. It wasn't close to Duval, but it was nice being right across the street from Smather's Beach, so that was a redeeming factor. I had a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your points!”
Reviews.Author: TripletsMommy
Reviews.Content: We are amazed at how poor the customer service is in an area that prides itself on tourism and customer service - we've received anything but good customer service (with the exception of Mr Ed, the shuttle bus driver) - ever question, comment, request is treated as an inconvenience and it's not all that busy right now so we're hard pressed to find a good reason for the poor treatment. Each interaction with the hotel staff has been practically laughable at how bad it is - thank goodness the pool is relaxing and the weather has been enjoyable. As a frequent traveler who acrues points for family vacations such as this one, this is a definite 'never again' - don't waste your points coming here and definitely don't pay for it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, very happy”
Reviews.Author: stemar09
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 weeks at the Sheraton Suites in Key west the first 2 weeks of August. Our stay was excellent. We enjoyed the facilities a lot. Swimming pool was great and staff (except for the outdoor pool) was friendly. Rooms was huge and cozy. Room cleaning was not impeccable but acceptable. Overall would go back

Reviews.Title: “Would expect more from a Starwood hotel”
Reviews.Author: elgmar
Reviews.Content: I wasn't impressed with this hotel. The rooms were alright, nothing special. The 'suite isn't that big at all. When I first walked into the room that carpet was stained and the decor was outdated. The bathroom, which must have been updated, was great. Tons of space. The pool is fine, pretty shaded which made it hard for the wife to sit in the sun. The location is not good. You have to look out over a road to see the beach. It is not where the nightlife is on the island, so it is quiet, but I would recommend a car to get to Duval street. Overall, I just wasn't impressed with anything here. It was less than average for a Sheraton. There is a reason why it is ranked half way down the list. However, if the price is right, stay here and party elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE HOTEL AND STAFF DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY OR SAFETY”
Reviews.Author: extexaschick
Reviews.Content: We went to enjoy Key West and our daughters were so excited and this motel was a complete disappointment!!!! Dirty, unsafe, only thing really redone was the lobby!! Elevators were very scary, our daughters would not even ride without us.

Reviews.Title: “excellent, they love doggies”
Reviews.Author: warfarin
Reviews.Content: me and my girlfriend went there for one night. we checked in at 10.00pm. the clerk was super nice. we have a dog and he even gave us treats for him. there was no charge for the pet. in addition, i asked for late check out and it was given to me at 2.pm. after asking the clerk if it could be later than 2pm he said yes and gave us a complementary late check out at 4pm!!!!. you cant beat that. we used the swimming pool late until past time and no one gave us a hard time. we got one of the suites on the second floor. it was very nice, we felt like kings in there. the dog was happy too. everyone had to say a compliment about him too. very friendly. our puppy is 45.5 lbs. in the morning we went to the buffet. for $15 it was a simple yet very diverse breakfast that should accommodate any basic demands. great hotel over all

Reviews.Title: “A+ for Sheraton Key West”
Reviews.Author: Vizsla31000
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with very accommodating staff. From reservations, desk, restaurant and cleaning staff, everyone was wonderful, every question/ request take care of with a smile and a wilingness to go the extra mile. The rooms are spacious (bathroom is bigger than most rooms in your typical Key West B&B!) and nicely appointed. Bed was super-comfortable. The grounds of this hotel are beautiful, and unless you crave the constant noise of Duval, the location across from beach is great. (There is a shuttle to take you there, very short ride). We are locals, and just stayed for one night. Key West is losing its reputation as a dog friendly town, but the Sheraton happily accepted our dog and also provided free parking for two cars and internet. We have stayed here before, and have recommended it to friends coming to Key West, and will continue to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: DreamgirlBoston
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Suites for 2 nights and got an oceanfront room. The views were beautiful! Unfortunately we ddn't get to spend much time at the hotel as we were short on time. The restaurant is pretty good and so is the pool. Very large suites!!! The Smathers beach is right across the street. They have a shuttle running all through the day to and fro from Duval street, but we didn't use it, instead we drove down and parked there. Only complaint is about the hotel conceirge who sold us a tour with false promises. We ended up wasting our time on that trip she sold us and have great regrets about it as we didn't not have another day to fix things. I would suggest do your own research and book your own tour.

Reviews.Title: “no complaints...fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: bradyk
Reviews.Content: wife and i stayed 2 nites...7/22-7/23 for Hemingway days festival ( i was a competitor in the look-a-like contest at Sloppy Joe's)..had some trepidations because of prior negative reviews about the surliness of some staff....but we had only positive relations with staff...as others have noted, Mr. Ed - the shuttle bus driver was exceptionally courteous and helpful....we found front desk also very professional and friendly...as was was the bartender on Thurs nite...she was excellent and very very cool under pressure of "closing time"...our room w/ocean front balcony was just what we had hoped for...spectacular view!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, just a bit out of the way.”
Reviews.Author: BonVoyageDenver
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, just a bit out of the way. It's near the airport just off Smathers' Beach. The beach itself is OK, yoo much sea grass for my liking. Make sure to try and get a room off the main corridors, otherwise it gets pretty loud with guests walking/runing out side your door! There is a Shuttle bus that goes between the hotel and downtown hourly, which is convenient, however, you need to make e resv daily at the front desk. Mr. Ed, the main Shuttle driver is a delight. Always friendly and helpful! Overall a good experience. I was able to book the room for almost half the published rate thru Priceline, which is the most I would pay for a room at this property.

Reviews.Title: “Just sign up and be on time!”
Reviews.Author: atlantatraveler0725
Reviews.Content: Overall, the hotel was fine. However, here are some tips if you are going to stay there. Get up in the morning and sign up for the shuttle. Even for the shuttle at night. There were a couple of days we didn't know what we were doing at night so we waited to sign up. When we tried to sign up later in the afternoon, all the shuttles were booked. So either we went in really late, or really early or needed to pay for a taxi in. Also, be on time for the shuttle. They will leave on the dot. You would think they would get more shuttle times or shuttles if there are people wanting to leave but I think this happened only on one day. So just sign up early for the shuttles you need the entire day. Also, you MUST sign up for the airport shuttle. You must. I don't care what the person behind the counter says. We came up to leave for the shuttle only to be told that it was booked. The guy behind the counter gave us this sorry for you look. I told him that I got up at 7am to book my shuttle for that day and was told I could just come whenever for the shuttle. Thankfully, they got the bigger van and we got to the airport. Some minor things. Bring your own shampoo. I didn't want to bring my own since I didn't want to hassle with airport security stuff and I figured the hotel would one suffice for a couple of days. I understand it's not the greatest stuff, but the hotel shampoo did not do anything. It barely cleaned my hair. It was so greasy and gross after a few days. I could have bought my own there but by the time I realized how greasy my hair was since the shampoo wasn't working, I just sucked it up. The wireless internet they're supposed to have did not work in our room. It may work well in other areas, but it barely worked in ours. We needed to call in for a conference call but could not. We called in several times but it never got fixed adequately. There are computers available for internet usage by the main lobby. However, when we were there, at certain parts of the day, there are kids on it checking facebook or playing games. I waited and waited and they did not get off. There should be some kind of enforced policy. The concierge is very nice but she talks too much. Sometimes we waited forever to finally talk to her. Some of the people at the front desk were a bit rude and put offish. The drivers are all very nice. Make sure you bring lots of $1 bills to pay for tipping each time you take the shuttle rides. I would not recommend this hotel because of some of the minor things. I would have rather paid just a bit more to make sure we got internet access and better transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Very Spacious, and Relaxing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KRyor
Reviews.Content: We used the shuttle service from the airport upon arriving to Key West. Excellent service and on time, which we appreciated after a long trip. When we arrived at the hotel, check in went smoothly and staff was friendly. We opened the room door (357) to find a spacious and beautifully decorated room with a balcony overlooking the ocean. Everything was clean in our room, including the couch. (I've read other reviews that voiced a different opinion) and I especially loved the toiletries that were offered here. Roomy shower and vanity area with separate bathroom. Our only complaint about the room was that the internet was in and out, which was somewhat annoying when we tried to upload photos of the trip to family and friends, but we did use the internet station in the main lobby and that was fine. Bar and pool area were clean and staff at the bar was friendly. The beach across the street is nice, with palm trees and beautiful blue water. There is quite a bit of seaweed at times, but they do an okay job cleaning it up in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Relaxing Place away from the tourist traps”
Reviews.Author: RoyP_CO
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton for 8 days, and couldn't have liked it better. The rooms were awesome, service was good, and the location was close to everything but quiet. The check-in desk had a great drink available- a mix of Key limes, fresh mint leaves and club soad- sooo refreshing after fighting with luggage in the 90 degree, 95 % humidity heat. Nice little bar next to the front desk- really pleasant for a quiet late night drink in the tropical breezes. My only complaint was the couch in my room could use replacing, as the middle sagged and the cushions were blown out.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: capejoy
Reviews.Content: This is an unusual looking hotel that has tried to blend in with the whole Key West ethos, although it is set well away from the town centre. There is easy on site parking and a free shuttle is provided to take you to and from Key West which was very useful as there arenâ€™t really that many places to park in the town. The suite was big, comfortable and clean and sliding doors shut off the bedroom from the main living/dining/kitchen area. The bathroom was huge with an enormous shower. Both Reception and Concierge were very helpful and the whole place was very clean without being antiseptic. Complimentary computer access is provided just off the lobby and the little restaurant looked very pleasant although we didnâ€™t try it. The pool was really much too small for the size of the hotel and when we went down it was almost standing room only. The lovely Smathers Beach is just over the road from the hotel but I didnâ€™t see much in the way of shade over there which could be why people preferred the pool area. This is as good a hotel as any if you want to stay on the outskirts of Key West but if there was a next time, I would try to stay in the town.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: twolittlemonkeys
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and had a wonderful stay. Very clean rooms, friendly staff, quick service when we called for something. We really enjoyed the pool area and being able to walk across the street to enjoy Smather's Beach. Having a beach across the street was awesome. The hotel is away from the major tourist areas which was very nice. We never ate in the hotel restaurant so I can't comment about that. Even though we booked with Priceline, they were happy to accomodate our request for a room with two beds. I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, convenient, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeFTL
Reviews.Content: I'm just coming back from a great stay at this Sheraton hotel. The property is large with many buildings and feels like a resort. The pool is very nice. Check in was fast and efficient, Benjamin was friendly and gave us tips about the property. Our rooms were great - seemed recently renovated and stylish. The bathrooms are oversized with separate toilet and a lot of storage space. The rooms looked very clean. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. slept really well. The location is good, a little far from Duval street, but right on the beach with water acticities offered right infront of the hotel. There is a complimentary shuttle service also. Parking is free and very convenient, all around the property. Pavla the concierge is absolutely amazing, made reservations for us for all kinds of water activities and was genuinely interested to hear our feedback. Everyone at the restaurant was really friendly and polite. The breakfast buffett is great and fun - you make your own waffles. The key lime coladas at the bar were delicious and drinks were priced very reasonably. Also Olga at the front desk and the manager Jitka were very accomodating. Thanks to everyone! Would definitely recommend that hotel to all my friends!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: mauncg
Reviews.Content: After reading so many negative reviews about the staff at this hotel I was a little nervous about check-in after we arrived. We reserved this hotel with FF miles and basically due to its proximity to Smather's Beach for the the family. Check-in went smoothly and efficiently and at no time did we encounter any rudeness from the staff. We were pleasantly surprised at the spaciousness of the king room and the sofa bed for our 6 year old and was better than most we've endured. A lot of shelf space in the bathroom and the big, modern shower and fixtures were pluses. I liked the fact that there were dividing doors between the master king bed and the living area. Also, the dining tables and chairs were a nice touch, along with the big fridge, microwave and Starbuck's coffee. I also liked how are room had a lot of natural light, but shaded at the right moments of the day by lots of trees. Loved the pool with it's cascading waterfall and how it was lit up at night. The only negative point was the man distributing towels. He seemed a little grumpy, like he didn't want to be there and looked like he didn't want to be approached. We didn't use the free transportation into town, but drove and parked instead. Overall, I'd say we had a better than expected stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location is bad but parking was easy. Good food and pool.”
Reviews.Author: ChrisTCPD
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel via Priceline and glad I did. The room was a nicely appointed suite. Big shower, big bathroom, fridge/microwave, sitting area with a comfy couch and a bedroom. The bed was comfy. The pool was nice. The hottub was too hot though. That could have something to do with a tan though. The restaurant had really good food considering it was in a Sheraton. The hamburger was to die for! Highly recommend it. Seriously, there was nothing wrong with this hotel as far as I could tell. It was not upscale but still very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected after reading reviews”
Reviews.Author: Dawnygirl
Reviews.Content: I had read reviews prior to leaving to go to the Sheraton and was seriously condsidering canceling and finding a different place, but I'm glad I didn't. The location was perfect for us, a family with 6 adults, 2 teenagers, and 3 younger children. We occupied 2 suites comfortably for 2 nights. For the price, we got twice the space, we would have had to have 3 rooms anywhere else. The beach was right across the street, it had palm trees close to the water for shade, and you could rent watersport equipment there also.. The children enjoyed snorkeling for free (with our own equipment) there were crabs, urchins, and fish in the rocky area on the beach. The swimming pool was nice with a decent bar. We did not try to use the free shuttle as we were not sure when we would be ready to come back, but you have to go to the registration desk and get tickets ahead of time. Since it was off season there, we did not have trouble finding parking in town. I highly recommend eating at the Blue Heaven for breakfast, and have the Lobster Benedict YUMMMM! It was even worth the about $22 it cost me. We did not have a bad meal anywhere we went. We did try the Better Than Sex Dessert shop, it was very good but overpriced $11-$14 for dessert! We survived the Duval Crawl and a taxi ride back was about $13.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tikibaytravel
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived and took the shuttle from the Key West Express, everything was perfect! Since we came by boat, we used the shuttle every day and found it to be dependable and convenient. All front desk staff were very friendly and accommodating. The rooms were very clean, bright and cheery, spacious and comfortable. The food was excellent and the happy hour specials were a nice surprise. I will definitely tell our friends to come here if they are going to Key West and we can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “My friend and I stayed in this hotel for...”
Reviews.Author: Komada
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights, we really enjoyed all the services and facilities, the amenities were very nice, they really make you feel special, the shuttle is very convenient and the rooms were very clean and beautiful ly decorated. The front desk staff was extremely friendly, specially Mr Blake and Mr Bruno, they took care of us in every possible way, also Mr Ed was very friendly and helpful, I will definitely recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: alicefrommaitland
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious and clean. The staff friendly and helpful. The room and bath very nice. We loved the shuttle into town, Mr. Ed very friendly and helpful as were rhe other drivers. The food in the restaurant was excellent and a good value. We have already recommended this hotel. Breakfast at Camilles was the best ever.

Reviews.Title: “Wow. What a beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: Webpuccino
Reviews.Content: Excellent property. Rooms are spacious and have microwaves and refrigerators. In room water is 4dollars/bottle. The property does have a snack shop near the reception for soda and snacks. All rooms are the same size and feature marble and granite baths. No tubs but huge walk in showers. Blake was nice when checking in. The pool is fun and beautiful at night with lights and fountain.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful - use the services”
Reviews.Author: efitzger
Reviews.Content: my fiance and i paid for this sheraton with points. We were upgraded to an ocean view suite. It was fabulous. Everything was clean and fresh. I am not sure I would want to be at the back of the hotel though. we had plenty of room and the furnishings all looked new and beutiful. Very tasteful and spacious. A private balcony. The hotel offers free shuttle to downtown. make sure to make reservations on the shuttle for a busy weekend. the people were all so friendly and helpful, but pamela the concierge was outstanding!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great choice”
Reviews.Author: travelhobo
Reviews.Content: we got a deal with these and paid half the price the hotel website was offering. Beautiful, clean, friendly and big. Everything you could need from an island hotel. There's a shuttle that runs every hour into town and back again but you must book early in the day. The pool is lovely but if you'd prefer the beach there's a great one across the road from the hotel. A very reasonably priced restaurant for breakfast and lunch. Try the fish ceasar salad...big enough to share.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of little things wrong with this place...read this before you book. Mr. Ed should be put in charge of the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: tutorturtle
Reviews.Content: We were booked at this hotel as part of an American Airlines vacation package. I have a feeling that is the only way this hotel gets most of its customers. Generally the hotel was safe and clean, but there were many *little* things that everyone should know about. Some of these were written in past reviews of this hotel and I'm surprised that none of them have been addressed since 2008. Here are the basic ones that I think everyone might want to know about: * The hotel is not near Duval street and is not walkable by most people. It *is* very close to the airport, but there is no way you can walk from the airport to this hotel. * The hotel *is* across the street from Smathers Beach. It is a public beach and very small since it is man-made. It is groomed every morning, but there is a ton of seaweed there no matter when you go. The only shade is from a few palm trees. Bring a towel...chairs are $10 a day. * The main entrance to the hotel is set up so that you have to climb a flight of outside stairs. While I can walk easily, I found this really annoying after walking through downtown Key West for hours. I saw children and senior struggling while dealing with these stairs. What was the hotel thinking? * If you want a shuttle from the airport to the Sheraton, call and book it before your flight arrives. Get the name of the person that made the reservation and the driver for your records. Although we confirmed that there was an airport shuttle before we left, we were told that none were available when we arrived at Key West International Airport. We ended up taking a taxi which cost $15 ----for less than a few miles. You can go from one end of Chicago to the other for $15. We did get a shuttle to the airport when we left, but only after arguing the point with the front desk staff at the time. * As others have mentioned, there is a shuttle to/from downtown Key West. Actually, it leaves you at a pickup point used by DoubleTree, Marriott, and Sheraton at a restaurant called the Conch Republic. Pickup and drop-off times are strict --- follow the rules or you will regret it. You can only reserve a shuttle seat by going down to the front desk *on the same day* and specifying which times you will leave and return. Really. And that leads me to my next point... * The hotel front desk staff reminded me of Senfeld's "Soup Nazi." If you don't follow the rules at the front desk, you will regret it. With a few exceptions, most of them are surly and do not want to help you. They truly seemed to be annoyed by anyone that comes up to the front desk. I personally saw several of them "bully" customers so that they would just go away. They do not smile; they do not greet you. They do not want to help you. You are interrupting their chit-chat which never stops. After traveling for many years, I can honestly say this is the worst front desk I have ever dealt with on any trip. Note to Starwood: Re-assign them or re-train them. * Pavla (that's the way she spells it) can not possibly be an employee of the hotel, even though she is the concierge. She doesn't have anything to do with the operation of the hotel and only points you to the front desk, if you ask about anything other than restaurants or boat trips. She certainly is nice enough and willing to help, if she can make a dollar or two doing it. When she is not at her station next to the front desk, her replacements are basically zombies that mirror the rest of the front desk staff. * My wife and I laughed a good bit when we saw the earlier comment about not even the towel guy being happy. We saw several of them during our stay and none of them were happy. Again, they do not smile: they do not greet you. The only hotel staff that were nice enough to say "hello" were the cleaning people and groundskeepers. Which reminds me about the pool... * The pool was like bath water whenever it was open. And it was a little slimey and salty for some reason. No hint of chlorine or other normal pool chemicals. * As many others have mentioned this is a suite-hotel and not a resort. Don't expect anything more than what you would find at your average hotel. * Make sure that you obey the many warning signs that are found wherever you find yourself at this hotel. BTW, in keeping with the spirit of the front desk, none of the signs contain the words "please," "thank you", or anything remotely similar. Also, none of the signs were in Spanish or any other language. Very few had icons to make them clear to people that did not speak English. Despite all of these signs, we had to ask directions to the ice machines. * The description of the hotel's restaurant is laughable. It is primarily used as a breakfast buffet in the morning ($15 a head). The rest of the day it is used primarily as a quick order grill with indoor and outdoor seating. Don't plan on having any nice dinners here. * You can eat in your room, of course, but as others have mentioned, there really is not a kitchen to speak of in the room. We had a microwave, a small sink (with a constantly dripping faucet), and min-fridge, and a coffeemaker. It was OK for us, but a small family might want more. * If you plan on eating on your room and saving some money, plan ahead. Unless you have your own transportation and can go to the new side of the island, you will need to get groceries on Duval Street. There are several small groceries, but the CVS and Walgreen's are your best best. Remember, you will have to carry back to the shuttle point and then on the shuttle home. * We did not know that this was dog friendly hotel until after we got home and read other reviews on TripAdvisor. We probably would not have stayed there if we had known that. And if you have read this far, you must be wondering who Mr Ed is. He is the nicest and most hospitable person we met on the entire island of Key West. He understands why people are there and tries to help at every turn. He gave us tips for places to check out and places to avoid. You might think he was the hotel manager or other person of authority. Nope. He drove the Sheraton shuttle back and forth from downtown Key West. As others have mentioned below, he was Sheraton Keys Hotel to us. The only fond memories of the Sheraton Key West were going back and forth in the shuttle talking with Mr. Ed. I will bet some other hotel hires him away from the Sheraton Key West. In closing, my wife and I were amazed at how accurate most of the TripAdvisor reviews are and will consult them without fail for future trips. I hope the comments above help others that are thinking of staying at the hotel. Starwood's Sheraton Key West management certainly is not reading them. Take me back, Mr. Wizard!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms... very rude staff... extra charges...”
Reviews.Author: DebSTravelAgent
Reviews.Content: The weekend staff treat you like you are bothering them. I expected to see the woman roll her eyes any minute. I stayed using Starwood Preferred Points and yet they are still charging me 75.00 a night (they are not supposed to) and I am now waiting to hear back on those charges. Also... had my own vehicle stolen out of the hotel parking lot. The manager on duty was only concerned about covering her own behind.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms!”
Reviews.Author: spe739
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for my honeymoon on the way back from the Carribean. On our way in, we met someone at the visitor center who used to work at this hotel. She got our room upgraded to a nicer area (room wasnt bigger - but it was in a more private area). Everything I experienced was great and have no complaints. We booked our trip on a website negotiating tool and got the room for $130... great rate! I thought the staff was great.. and very helpful. The only thing I thought was funny was one of the bus drivers had a sign that said "Tipping is customary and appreciated..." If tipping is so customary - do you really have to tell people that? I thought it was petty so I didnt tip. The other bus driver just put down a baskey (Mr. Ed) in which people could put money.. he was also very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel-would stay again”
Reviews.Author: teamkimme
Reviews.Content: Had a king suite room. Bed was awesome, separate living room with a pull out with separate tv. Mini kitchen (microwave and mini fridg). Pool nice not very big, pool side bar. Nice restaurant, free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, rude staff”
Reviews.Author: kmstep2
Reviews.Content: Every year my girlfriends and I go on a yearly vacation. This year we decided to go to Key West and stay at the Sheraton. The hotel was very nice with large rooms (6 of us girls were able to fit in one room), a nice pool and was very close to the beach. It was a little off Duval street, but everything still worked out for us. We would reserve the shuttle around noon to leave for Duval street around 830pm. The last shuttle leaves Duval street at 1030pm (and we would be out much later considering the fact the bars do not close until 4am!) so we would take a cab back to the hotel which ran about $4.50/person. The negative was the staff, especially Stacy Kennedy who worked the front desk, and when we asked her to hold our luggage she let out a huge sigh and began throwing our luggage! Steven Flint was also a mean man. His job was driving the shuttles. He drove us to Duval street a couple nights, all of which we gave him a good tip. When it was time for us to go back home, we signed up for the airport shuttle, which Steven was driving. We went to get on the shuttle when he rudly told us he did not have room (even though there were only 3 people on the shuttle AND we had a reservation.) We told him our flight was leaving in 1.5 hours and he said â€œWell thatâ€™s good, not my faultâ€� and then got in the shuttle and drove off leaving us there! I could not believe it. On the positive Fotis who worked the front desk was very accommodating as well as the women who worked the concierge and Ed who drove the shuttle buses on the weekend. I would stay here again, only if I did not have to deal with Stacy Kennedy and Steven Flint.

Reviews.Title: “25th Wedding Anniversary Road Trip”
Reviews.Author: tebb
Reviews.Content: We ended our trip at the Sheraton, after staying in 5 * hotels in Orlando (Ritz Carlton), F. Lauderdale (Altantic) & Miami (Fontaine Bleu) ) for our trip of a lifetime. We were not disappointed at all. It was charming, friendly and a pleasure to come home to at the end of the day, particulalrly after the pretentious snobbery we had endured at the Fontaine Bleu! We stayed 5 nights at the Sheraton, got on the free shuttle bus every night, there & back and had a fabulous time. The locals were so welcoming, especially to us from the UK.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: vtbrooklyn
Reviews.Content: My experience at this hotel was nothing that I'd like to experience again. The employees were not just rude but really seemed to go out of their way to be mean! So much for a relaxing vacation. The front desk was anything but helpful, and the parking attendants berated me as I tried to enter the property. The one upside was the large room and the proximity to the beach. The 'free shuttle' was always full and taxis into the town center start to add up. You almost have to reserve a spot a day in advance.

Reviews.Title: “very poor houekeeping”
Reviews.Author: maberdy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at your hotel in key west from May 6th to the 12th. We had been planning this get away for quite sometime and as such a lot of planning went into it, with a great deal of detail into where we would be staying. For this reason, and because of your reputation, we opted to stay at your hotel. We thoroughly enjoyed the breakfasts and especially your dinning room staff. We also interacted very well with your bar tender Mark, who was a delight. We, however were highly disappointed with the housekeeping at your place.. During our time there, the 1st couple of days were well served, the remaining of the days, we had no housekeeping services at all. When we ran out of toilet paper we had to call the desk and wait for someone to come around to bring it to us, the same with towels. I honestly am not too anxious to recommend your hotel to any of our friends who may be planning a vacation. I am asking that you look into this and at least give us the courtesy of responding to this e-mail thank you John and Maria Berdy (room 108)

Reviews.Title: “The best Hotel for dogs and the only Hotel that has the beach across the beach.”
Reviews.Author: milrockee1
Reviews.Content: I loved how pet friendly they were and it's one of the few hotels that has the beach across the street. Other hotel are across the ocean but it's filled with ricks and there very little sand to sunbath. Overall a bit expensive but great rooms and great location. The bad thing is despite the very expensive rooms they could at least provide continental breakfast and add more shuttles to downtown key west. The shuttles were filled before we even checked in.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel-friendly staff-would recommed highly!”
Reviews.Author: poetzmuse
Reviews.Content: We are just back and cant say enough positives of the 5 star Sheraton Suites Key West! This was our second visit to Sheraton KW and both times we loved it! We upgraded to balcony room overlooking the ocean and it was lovely,clean, comfortable. Staff we loved-Mark at bar-the friendliest bartender you will ever meet! Mary is sweet at bar at night, Martin in resturant was pleasant and couldnt do enough to help. Moe managing the resturant was friendly and on top of his game. Lindsey at the desk was smiling and patient with my loads of requests! Petra at concierge desk was ever pleasant. The cleaning staff always smiled at us. Great staff Sheraton! The landscaping is beauitful; plants blooming all over, big banyan trees, huge palms, and also the lobby and resturant are decorated beautifully and comfortably. Beautiful pool, great across from beach location. Yes, far from Old Town but you know this when booking. We get a scooter and used the shuttle. The shuttle drivers were friendly, too, offering info,advice. We loved the free coffee and the bottles of shamoo, conditioner, body lotion. Excellent hotel and highy recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here! Unless you like RUDE staff, that is!”
Reviews.Author: Jovanitta
Reviews.Content: I planned a weekend in Key West for a group of my girl friends. We stayed at the Sheraton Suitesright in front of Smathers beach. Staying here was the one thing I would change. The Good: the rooms were nice, clean and pretty large. Housekeeping brought us extra towels whenever we needed them. The concierge, Pavla, was so sweet and helpful. The Bad:Location; the hotel was right in front of Smathers Beach which is a couple of miles away from the action of Duval Street. The hotel boasts a free shuttle to down town but we weren't successful in getting on it once during our 4 day stay. You have to make a reservation, in person and there are very limited seats. Also, it only runs once per hour. The staff was pretty unenthusiastic about assisting us with cabs. We spent a lot of time waiting outside the hotel waiting for a cab "they called" to come. It never came. We called our own from then out and they were there a LOT faster. If you plan on spending time on the man made beach, the location is great. We laid out by the pool but didnâ€™t end up visiting the beach so the result was a lot of money wasted on cab rides. The pool is okay. There is a bar but no cocktail servers or music. The pool boy didn't seem happy to be there. The Ugly: The staff at this hotel (with the exception of Pavla, the concierge) was AWFUL! The front desk staff never smiled and seemed to be annoyed any time you walked up. One of them even snapped at me upon picking up my bags from storage. I shared that my bag didnâ€™t come out and she snapped back saying they werenâ€™t done setting them out. Sorry I asked. At first I thought maybe the dismay was just toward us, a group of 13 and potentially overwhelming girls but then I witnessed the rudeness occur to other guests and realized they evenly distribute the love. Even the pool towel boy was miserable. There was one semi-friendly girl at the front desk but I was too distracted by her lip ring, long acrylic nails and glittery hair clip to notice. Sheraton is a part of Starwood Hotels. I always stay at Starwoods if theyâ€™re available and up to this point, theyâ€™d never disappointed. I would NOT recommend you staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: hoglilly
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property right across the road from Smathers Beach, the best on the island. Spacious suites with separate living area and small kitchen, large bathrooms, and heavenly beds. Restaurants were just normal, but with all the great restaurants in town, no need to dine at the hotel. Only about 10 minutes away from Old Town, and hotel has a shuttle that fills up quickly. The concierge, Petie, took care of all our plans and reservations with efficiency and enthusiasm. This hotel is beautiful, tropical and away from the hustle & bustle of Old Town, but easy to get to. Loved it and can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “This is a must stay”
Reviews.Author: SunapeeNHLoveTravel
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip to Key West and I have to say that we absolutely loved the Sheraton. The staff was helpful, informative and friendly, the room was exceptional. We had a King suite with an ocean view, it was clean and beautifully decorated, I felt like a queen. The grounds are beautiful and the wait staff in the restaurant we pleasant and helpful. The concierge Petie was outstanding, she booked us on some wonderful excursions and recommended many restaurants and also gave us some discount coupons. If you want exceptional service and a clean, friendly place to stay you MUST stay at the Sheraton Suites Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room close to the beach but far from Duval St”
Reviews.Author: perogiman
Reviews.Content: We stayed Friday to Sunday. The Hotel's shuttle to and from the airport and to and from Old Town Key West was crucial and a major decision in our stay. Otherwise it's a $15 cab ride to Old Town. Aside from that the King room is awesome and probably one of the nicest rooms in Key West (we stayed in 201). 2 Flat screens, steam shower, nice large bathroom. I can't say enough nice things about the room. The staff were average and couldn't answer many questions outside of hotel specific things. The pool is small but nice. It is right across the street from smather's beach. If you are traveling with kids and don't plan on going to bars then this would be a good option. The last shuttle comes back from town at 10:50pm. Also it is very close to the airport so you have the occaisonal airplane noise. I did really like the room. We also attended a wedding on the beach which was across the street which made this place a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “It's good for the price”
Reviews.Author: dennyloo
Reviews.Content: We were just at the Sheraton Suites for 5 days and really enjoyed ourselves. I have to say that the reception was not great. The employees have no personality and seem to not care much. But the room was fine and comfortable. The couch was worn looking, but we had it opened most of the time for the bed. The gym was enough but could have been better. Still, we used it every day no problems. There is a washer dryer which is nice to have since we were away for ten days total. The best part was the pool and hot tub. It was very nice and the kids loved it. The lounge chairs were not that great but there were plenty. The pool bar was ok. We were disappointed that it closed at ten because that was usually when we got back and the kids went to bed so we could have used an extra hour alone at the bar! The bar tenders were nice. The food in the restaurant was ok. Breakfast was good. My kids had room service one night while we were out and it was fine. Of course, most of our eating was in Old Town. Smathers Beach is beautiful. One thing that is nice are the trucks out on the street. You can get a good meal for $5! I had a chicken wrap and a soda and my husband had a burger, fries and drink all for 5 dollars. There is also a truck that rents out water toys, rafts, snorkels and things like that , All in all, it was a really FUN TIME with my kids and husband. I guess it is what you make of it alot of times!

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sarad26
Reviews.Content: I went to Key West with my mom for a week. We stayed the whole time at Sheraton Suites and after being on the island and seeing all the other hotels, I believe the Sheraton was our best choice. Staff was very friendly, rooms were big and clean, the food was good. Everything about this place was perfect. We plan to go back very soon and we will always stay at the Sheraton. Would recommend to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: DeniseRN
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in December and it was wonderful. We liked that it was not on Duval with all the noise, and enjoyed riding bikes all over Key West. We stayed in a pool view room instead of a beach view due to the fact that you will have the main road in between your view. We went 2 weeks before Christmas and it was very slow on the island.

Reviews.Title: “Could NOT have been better”
Reviews.Author: imshocked2
Reviews.Content: I suspect other reviewers visited at the same time as the air show. And the extensive security was for the benefits of the guests. I had a wonderful experience. I wasn't expecting much and not excited about the proximity to Duval Street, but found it a wonderful break. I arrived to visit my son ( an active duty Marine, there on a work up). The hotels proximity to the beach (across the street) was FABULOUS. Shuttle to Duval and then retreat to a much quieter place. Our group found the restaurant and bartender offered fast, friendly service and the most amazing Mahi ever. The rooms were clean and very spacious and enough room to give adults plenty of privacy.

Reviews.Title: “Super Service”
Reviews.Author: HOBO85
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from a trip at the Sheraton Key West. We ahd a wonderful trip the hotel was clean, friendly and beauitful. We went on many outing during our stay. We went to view the dolphins and skoral along with jet sking around the island. Wonderful experience! Will return again. Very good food also.

Reviews.Title: “Inhospitable is an understatment”
Reviews.Author: GoVTHokies
Reviews.Content: I have done a considerable amount of traveling all over the world... this hotel had by far the worst service I have ever experienced. To say they were inhospitable would not cover it. They were beyond rude, they actually threatened us threw my friend and his girlfriend out in the middle of the night. We were visiting Key West for a wedding and chose to stay here (big mistake). We were continuously berated by the staff about some sort of bracelet. I am not sure what the bracelets were for but apparently it was a big problem that we didn't have them. We also met other guests obviously in their late 50's early 60's that had the same problem. The staff must have assumed that we were all spring breakers. I figured people in their 30's wouldn't be mistaken for spring breakers... but the staff here apparently doesn't care too much. If the wedding bands on our hands wasn't a clue... the 7-month pregnant woman may have been a good tip that we were indeed not spring breakers. They have hired a few weekend GI Joes that come complete with Laura Croft style leg holstered tasers the harass you every time you return to the hotel ground. You need to present the parking pass, room key, and some other documentation that we never seem to have right every time you come back on to the hotel grounds. It is basically like crossing a military checkpoint in the middle east (not enjoyable on vacation). When we stepped out of a cab upon returning from the wedding reception one of these "hotel greeters" immediately lost his mind on us. We hadn't said a word or done a thing, which apparently prompted this person to fly into a rage. After we told him to chill out his head pretty much exploded. He was extremely out of line and had no business addressing anyone in the manner that he did. Out of spite he followed one member of our party to his room then called the police to throw him and his girlfriend off their property, hours later at about 3am. No less than 7 police officers came to escort this extremely dangerous technology consultant off the property. They must have been worried that he would swing his lanyard around like Tarzan and hit someone in the eye with a USB drive. This hotel comes compete with a surly bartender, unhelpful desk staff and other undelightful characters. When asked if they were running the shuttle to the airport the response was "if someone is here to drive it". When asked if we could get on the shuttle to downtown the response was "sorry... it's full all evening... you should get here earlier next time". There were all sorts off "pffff" style responses to our questions. They were rude to everyone in our party at every turn. Mr Ed: There was however one highlight (seriously). The one time we actually could get a ticket for the shuttle downtown our driver was superb. Mr. Ed was his name and I am not sure what he is doing driving the shuttle for this operation. If this were my hotel I would get Mr. Ed to give the entire staff a lesson on hospitality and tourism management. He was helpful courteous and provided great local information. The rest of the wedding guests paid a little more and stayed at other hotels. They all enjoyed their experience and had no such issues. I would shell out a few more dollars next time and avoid possibility of getting tased and/or thrown out.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: Vaconthego
Reviews.Content: writing this review from the Hotel. The room and reveiw are great. The food and the shuttle into town are great also. Not so good is the fact that the elevator in the oceanview building has not worked for 4 days now. Not so good when you are on the third floor. The only hot tub has been out the same length of time. This is surprising for a Starwood owned Sheriton.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cardsfan40
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival for our 2-night stay, we were pleased to find a friendly staff at the desk that were very helpful in answering questions from a couple of first-timers in Key West. The concierge was equally helpful in advising us about parking and such near Duval St. Didn't get an opportunity to enjoy the pool and hot tub, but the area was beautiful and well maintained. Smathers Beach is directly across the street from the hotel and easily accessable. Our king suite was perfect. Not sure where some of the negative reviews are coming from as we encountered nothing but friendly and helpful people during our stay. We would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Staff / Service I've Ever Had”
Reviews.Author: vthokie311
Reviews.Content: Everyone that worked at this hotel was extemely rude from the front desk employees to the bartenders, and especially the security personnel. They had no interest in helping us get transportation (shuttles or taxis), the rooms were not cleaned the following day after repeated calls to remind them. The security guards harassed us and were beligerent to the women in our group which was especially concerning especially since no other hotel employee would speak to us about this matter. If you choose to stay in this part of Key West there are much nicer hotels to stay at but I would recommend areas closer to the duval street area. We moved to the Southermost hotel and the staff was extremely accomodating and a welcome change to what we encountered with the Sheraton Suite staff.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service anywhere I have ever been!”
Reviews.Author: virginiavt
Reviews.Content: I just recently returned from Key West after visting for a wedding. There was a group of 8 of us (4 couples) that booked here and from the very first day at the hotel we all agreed this hotel had the absolute worst service that we had ever experieinced. Every single staff member we came in contact with was VERY rude. I would NEVER return to this hotel and don't think it is possible to be treated worse. The staff was extremely rude and when we tried to speak with a manager about this awful behavior we were told there was no one there we could speak with and to leave a voicemail. We left a voicmail and our call has still not been returned.....

Reviews.Title: “A decent choice for a short stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: ajinternational
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for a one night stay in Key West because of a very competitive price and the free on-site parking. As a party of three, a suite was a very good option for us, meaning we didnâ€™t need to book 2 rooms, but still getting a wee bit of privacy. Away from down town Key West, and opposite a quiet sandy beach, this hotel is really easy to get to from Highway 1. The hotel has a pleasing Colonial/Caribbean style exterior with wood painted in cool shades and lots of palm trees. The reception area has been finished to a very good standard, modern but calming. The restaurant and internet area has a similar finish. Reception staff were professional, if a little distant; the Concierge on the other hand was very helpful with plenty of suggestions on where to eat. Pictures on the internet seem to show that the rooms were renovated fairly recently. Although an improvement on the previous (somewhat garish?!) dÃ©cor, the reality is that they already look a bit worn and in need of further renovation/updating. Having said that, they were comfortable and clean. The bedroom was well furnished, with a fairly neutral dÃ©cor. The living room had a large L shaped sofa bed (which was a little stained) a dining table, and a wet bar area with sink, microwave, fridge and coffee/tea maker with lovely velvety Starbucks coffee! The bathroom was quite small, but clean, with good shower pressure and a plentiful supply of hot water. There was also a dressing room/antichambre with sink, storage space, and a useful safe in the cupboard. Both the bedroom and living room had flat screen TVs with a wide selection of channels.
