However, the remote from the bedroom TV changed the one in the living room which became annoying! Wireless internet here was free, and of a decent speed. Although the hotel is very close to Key West airport, the noise of the landing aircraft (mainly turboprops) wasnâ€™t an issue. Thereâ€™s a very useful shuttle service to down town Key West, with a fixed timetable and limited spaces, but saves the mission of find a parking space. This has to be booked at Reception, but it is free, reliable and taxis certainly aren't cheap! (Also quite a unique experience â€“ friendly driver with a quirky personality and a fabulous soundtrack playing on the stereo!). Down town Key West has a many great places to eat (highly recommend El Meson de Pepe Cuban Restaurant!) and plethora of bars and clubs for everyone (certainly lots of sights not for the faint hearted!) Breakfast wasnâ€™t included in our rate, and we didnâ€™t eat at the hotel. We also arrived later in the afternoon, and so unfortunately didnâ€™t get to take a dip in the pool. All in all, a decent choice for our whistle-stop visit to Key West given the price paid. However, the next time I visit, Iâ€™d chose to stay in one of the smaller, more charming boutique hotels closer to the southernmost point for a more authentic Florida Keys experience.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely comfortable & conceriege outstanding”
Reviews.Author: teemurphy
Reviews.Content: Room was spacious, clean and lots of storage for 2 adults and 16 & 17 year olds. Wireless internet worked very well to allow the kids and us to stay in touch. Both weekend & weekday concierges were amazing. We enjoyed the water adventures and sunset sail very much. They helped us with selecting excellent restaurants and gave us coupons for various free items. We drove into town most days and found ample parking (concierge directed us to). Enjoyed the beach one day and relaxed by the pool also. Both very clean. Played cards by the pool late one afternoon and were bothered by 'no seeums'. We did get a lot of bug bites and retired to our room. Recommend to stay away from pool area later in the day. Ate a very good meal from room service one night. A memorable week in Key West for our family.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor service”
Reviews.Author: apmga
Reviews.Content: We had booked early and paid extra for a ocean view room. On arrival we were in formed that there is no ocean view AND NOTHING CAN BE DONE ABOUT IT. To quote.... Our hands are tied

Reviews.Title: “Good, with one problem”
Reviews.Author: stlouistraveler12
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, rooms are spacious enough, clean and the location (away from commercial areas) is good. The pool area is also very nice. Having a shuttle to Duval Street area is a plus. The only problem was the wireless internet. Unfortunately, we have to be in contact with work even on vacation. Our first room received no signal at all. When the desk was contacted, they connected us with their IT department, claiming it must be the fault of our laptop. After wasting several hours with their IT department and a work IT person, we finally tried the laptop in a different area of the hotel. Big surprise, it worked fine. They did let us change rooms (after we insisted!) to one where the internet worked great, but it was still a waste of our time and a hassle to change rooms. While testing other rooms prior to changing them, we ran into 2 other people who saw what we were doing and stated they had no signal either. So, if you have to have internet access in your room, be sure to check your signal before you get settled and save yourself some time.

Reviews.Title: “Best location on Key West - Will definitely return”
Reviews.Author: WVMtneer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 5 days the first week of Feb 2010 - on Starwood Preferred points. The only hotel directly across the street from Smathers Beach, it was completely updated. Beautiful pool area. We had a large room - probably 500 or 600 sq ft. Liv room had a sectional couch with chaise. 42" flat screen. Kitchenette with dining table. Gorgeous bathroom, separate water closet, beautiful demilune shaped vanity/sink, tons of storage and a safe big enough to hold your purse or laptop. Nice touches like a wicker clothes basket. Large walk in shower for two, nice marble. Balcony overlooking the pool, facing ocean with 2 chairs and tables. Those wonderful beds, with another 42" flatscreen in the bedroom. I'll never again stay on the other side of the island. It was quieter w/o barhoppers partying all night. Loved walking the long wide sidewalk or along the beach--or bike riding. In Feb we could see both sunrise and sunset from the hotel. We are definitely coming back next year to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “our dream trip”
Reviews.Author: jkcrn
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, staff were great. Right across from the beach, wonderful view! My only complaint was the internet access but other than that we could have not asked for a better place to stay. We do recommend renting a car and driving up the keys. A most wonderful trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Smathers Beach Area”
Reviews.Author: douglasrob
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week. The hotel is located close to the airport and Smathers Beach, which is very attractive with white sand. The hotel itself is a little older and you can see small signs of wear and tear if you are ultra picky. Our room was a one bedroom suite with microwave, sink, refrigerator and a pullout couch in the living room. The bathroom was enormous and was acessible from both the living area and bedroom . It had a gigantic walk in shower but no tub. It was very clean. The king bed was extremely comfortable. Nice features included two flat screen TVs and free wifi internet. The hotel is located about two miles from Old Town and Duval Street but they have a complementary shuttle every hour on the half hour going and on the 40s on return. Bad feature is that you have to make advanced reservations including for the return trip at the hotel desk (no phone calls) if you miss your return trip you are on standby. The hotel has a very attractive pool/hotub area with a adjacent bar.

Reviews.Title: “Famous & upscale Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: glamsmile
Reviews.Content: Fortunately only two nights in that "money talks & [--] works" hotel. Bed sheet with multiple yellowish spots and small dark unregular hair. Bath studded with rust at al metal parts and must on walls and ceilings. That in mind, we avoided getting into the honor of tasting the skills of the kitchen or other facilities. My suggestion: change the name into Sheraton Inn and charge less a zero at the end of the figure

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MidnightandBalloo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights in early January, 2010. The rooms were outstanding. Huge sitting area with comfy couch, flat screen TV, desk, microwave, and fridge. GIANT bathroom with a very large shower (no tub) lots of closet/cabinet space and drawers for storage. Beautiful tile work throughout the bathroom. The sweet sleeper beds here seemed exceptionally comfortable. My husband, myself, and my mother-in-law all remarked on the great sleep we had here. There is also a second flat-panel TV in the bedroom if you prefer to watch in bed. The breakfast buffet in the restaurant was of slightly higher than average quality and included scrambled eggs (with cheese or plain), various breads/pastries/bagels (the croissants were yummy), bacon and sausage, make-your-own waffles, yogurt, fresh fruit, cereal, oatmeal, etc. Breakfast was the ony meal we had in the restaurant. Also, they have a little snack shop by the check-in desk which was nice for our in-room movie. They had chips, candy, popcorn, pretzels, sodas, milk, fruit, etc. The pool and hot tub were beautiful. Everthing was as clean as you could want. The location was great for beach access but a bit far from duval street, museums (Hemmingway home, Little White House, Lighthouse), and most restaurants and shopping. However, if you want a more quiet, remote location with beach access 50 feet or so away, this is the place. The staff was always friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: maverick06
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very nice, large, clean, new. Very pleased with that. If you came to Key West to party on Duval St. stay at another hotel, this isnt very close, you need to drive or take the shuttle. But there is a free/public beach across the street. For me, this was WAY better than staying in town, more laid back. It is near the airport, so expect some aircraft noise, but you wont hear that in the rooms. Free wifi in the hotel that is actually modestly fast. I will definitely stay here again when i go back to key west.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach across the street”
Reviews.Author: lastcallforboarding
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because my husband was using his Starwood points. The lobby and pool area could use some serious renovation, but the rooms were great: newly tiled bathroom, spacious rooms with separate suite: fridge, microwave, couches. The location of this hotel would be under debate; good or bad? If you like a beach holiday and have a car, it couldn't be better, as there is a gorgeous beach right across the street. However, downtown: Duval St and all the restaurants , bars and shopping are a good distance, even in the car. The parking downtown is brutal and expensive ( I live in a big city, so I know parking prices: $12 flat rate for the evening is high in my books). In a downtown hotel you could walk everywhere and park at the hotel but miss out on the beach.. The hotel offers a shuttle service into town, but you have to reserve ahead of time and it was often full as well as not always convenient. Not a bad place for nice big rooms and beach proximity.

Reviews.Title: “Super Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: LSK09
Reviews.Content: Sheraton Suites in Key West, across from the beach, is a perfect place to stay in the keys, especially for families. The hotel has been totally renovated while preserving the hallmark Victorian architecture and relaxed atmosphere of the keys and the suites are large and extremely comfortable with ocean views, plush king sized beds, sleeper sofas, kitchens, large screen TV's and free internet service. The hotel restaurant serves a magnificent buffet breakfast and the hotel staff is extremely friendly and helpful. There is a free hotel shuttle for those who wish to explore Duval Street and surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “good value but not so great location”
Reviews.Author: funinthesun1009
Reviews.Content: Overall, our stay at the Sheraton Suites was good. The room is a decent size with up to date decor, including 2 flat screen tv's, however, the bathroom is small and totally lacking in towel bars. this sounds like a small thing, but with 3 teenage girls, things can get pretty messy. similarly, little drawer space and only in the bathroom closet. Our room did not have a balcony ,which was a big disappointment. To me, a fun in the sun vacation is not complete without a balcony, even if there is no special view. Service was inconsistent - the concierge, Petie, goes out of her way to please, but the check-in staff is not particularly friendly or knowlegeable. I overheard a few arguments while waiting in line. Staff seems a little put out to write up shuttle tickets or hand out pool towels (very strange to have front desk staff do this, but the pool desk was not staffed 90% of the time) the shuttle drivers were pleasant, esp the one working on christmas. Housekeeping was erratic, coming at all times and some times doing bare minimum. Restaurant/bar staff was pleasant and efficient. Location. Well, the hotel is across from the Smathers public beach, but it wasnt particularly populated, perhaps because many people, myself included, dont want to pay $10/rental chair. the hotel is not walking distance to Duval street, so the complimentary shuttle is a bonus. Be advised to book early that day or you will be SOL. If you want to try other areas or restaurants not on Duval, you'll have to take a cab which is a minimum of $16 each way (most drivers do not accept credit cards). A car is truly waste if you will only use it to go to dinner a few times. There is really not much else near the hotel that is walkable. Overall, you do get what you pay for at Sheraton suites - it is clean, has a nice pool and a good concierge. The restaurant food is decent, but like all hotels, expensive. I think this hotel is perfect for a 3 or 4 nite stay. i would stay again, but would reserve an upgraded room with a balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: taffer10
Reviews.Content: After viewing some of the post online from this website, I was a bit spectacle about this hotel. However, rest assure everything was great! The rooms are a good size, clean room and lobby. Clean pool and tiki bar. Our breakfast was included as well. We even enjoyed our shuttle drivers...Especially Mr. Ed. Even thou it's not right next to Duval...It is across from one of the best beaches on the island. And it's not crowed. So, for what it's worth...My two cents.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: jgold22
Reviews.Content: The rooms at this Sheraton are HUGE. We did not expect to have such a large room. There was a bedroom with a very comfortable queen size bed and a large living space with a pull out couch. The pool was located in the center of the hotel so all of the rooms are very close. The beach is located right across the street. This is the perfect place to stay if you want to experience the beach and beauty of key west while being a short ride away from Duval Street. Great Stay. Can't wait to do it again

Reviews.Title: “The suite was sweet!”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust5678
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Sheraton for the first time. We were extremely pleased with the spacious suite which included a King size bed, a separate living & dining area, kitchen area with coffee maker, microwave, sink, and a small refrigerator. The bedroom had doors that could be closed off from the rest of the suite. The bath area had a huge walk-in shower, marble floors, and plenty of storage space. Both the living area and bedroom had large flat screen TVs in them. The Sheraton is directly across the street from Smather's beach but we spent most of our time at the pool. The pool area was great with lots of space and nice pool lounges. There is also a nice hot tub in the pool area. Drinks at the Tiki bar were a little pricey. Our package did not include breakfast at the hotel. We had breakfast there once and found it to be good but a little pricey. There is a lounge area with internet access available. We had a car so we never tried the downtown shuttle. You have to select a departure time and sign up for it ahead of time. So since we had a car, we never used it. We didn't have any problem finding parking on the street. The most convenient parking was at a parking meter but you need to have change on hand for the meter. There are a few places where you can park within a designated block and use a credit card to pay in advance. Favorite places to eat were Fogarty's (Duval St.) and The Conch Republic Seafood restaurant (on the water front). Be sure to go up to the roof top bar at the La Concha Hotel (on Duval St.). It's open to the public and the view is spectacular. Of course, who can go to Key West and not stop in at Maragaritaville?

Reviews.Title: “This is a wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JenWashington_DC
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of a special that Sheraton Suites offered, staying four days over the Thanksgiving holiday. From the moment we arrived, which was an hour or two before check-in, we were treated extremely well. Without asking, we were upgraded to a suite that offered a view of the pool and gardens and were told about the various amenitites (concierge to give information and book all trips, a shuttle bus to take guests to the heart of Key West and back, etc.) The hotel is beautiful inside and out. The suites are spacious, beautifully appointed and extremely comfortable. The living-area can be closed off from the bedroom, as can a separate dressing area. There is also a section with a small refrigerator, microwave, bar sink and cabinet for preparing snacks, which is an added convenience. And, off the lobby, there is a wonderful work station with six or more computers, offering very fast internet service and a printer, available to guests 24/7. Along with a great pool and hot tub, there is a beach directly across the street that offers rentals of water equipment, lounge chair and umbrellas, etc. Mallory Square was about 1.5 miles and a beautiful walk along an oceanfront walkway, but the hotel provided shuttle service every hour (and every 30 minutes during the evening hours). We really didn't want for anything and the staff could not have been more accommodating. We travel frequently, always staying in hotels rated 4-stars, and I'd have to rank this as one of the nicest hotel experiences we've had.

Reviews.Title: “Well-located, clean and comfortable - not on Duval, but close enough”
Reviews.Author: pprabs
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we stayed at the Sheraton - we went over the long Thanksgiving weekend. The beach is right across the street (Smather's beach) and has absolutely gorgeous sunsets. The hotel is clean and has wonderful staff. Room service was prompt and left the rooms spic-and-span each morning. The room had a tiny microwave (probably the smallest I've ever seen), a fridge and a wet bar. The bathroom was well stocked with towels and toiletries. The room also has a small safe to store your valuables in when you're headed out to the beach. Every room in the hotel is a suite, so we had two queen beds and a pull-out couch. Both rooms have large flat screen TVs and a table to fit 4 people (we played board games each night). The pool at the hotel is wonderful, lots of beach chairs to lounge around on and a great poolside bar. We made full use of the concierge's knowledge of the area to explore the island. We rented bikes at the concierge desk and biked everywhere. The hotel has a free shuttle to Duval street and back, but on holiday weekends, the shuttle gets filled pretty quick. Although, a cab ride from the hotel to Duval is $4.50 per person - so not very expensive. Smather's beach across the street is great, but the best beach on Key West is definitely Fort Zachary Taylor beach (state park). Again, the distance between the hotel and the better beach is absolutely do-able by bicycle. In fact, bicycle was our preferred mode of transport even to Duval Street because of the difficulty of parking on the main strip. There are plenty of bicycle racks everywhere to lock up bikes safely. Overall, very happy with our stay and will definitely recommend it for couples and families.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Beachfan88
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights for a romantic getaway. We can't say enough about this resort. Much nicer than we expected! Our room was beautiful and spacious and we loved the bathroom. No mold or other issues. The staff upgraded us to a beautiful room overlooking the pool when they found out we were celebrating an anniversary. Pool is great with a beautiful waterfall and nice spa. I had read extensively about Smathers Beach, so I knew what to expect, but it was nicer that I thought it would be. The beach is directly across from the hotel so you can go back and forth easily. Food prices were reasonable, and the food was good, but since we had a microwave, sink and mini fridge we did most breakfasts in our room, and dinners in old town. Can't say enough about the staff. I can't remember every name, but special thanks to the wonderful Mr. Ed (shuttle driver), Anita and Boris in the restaurant.. Every staff member we met though was wonderful and friendly. When we go back to Key West we will definitely stay here again. We spent a few nights a pricey hotel off Duval and this was much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton; what else?”
Reviews.Author: Opiwan
Reviews.Content: Sheraton at it's best. I arrived with my wife and Granny at Key West Airport late in the evening. The Sheraton Shuttle was not at the Airport but a Cab Driver took us 2450 yards to the Hotel for the outreagous price of 19,90 USD. He gave us a receite and said, that the Frontdesk will give us our money back. What they did. Even I had send them some mails before, asking for some specials, because it was our Silver Wedding trip, something went wrong. I had to call them twice, but as usual in Sheraton Hotels, the problem was fixed within minutes, beside that the front desk gave us a lot of coupons 25 USD per coupon. So we ended up with Coupons worth 150 Bucks. So we had free Breakfast and free Drinks at the Bar the whole weekend. Beside that I stayed free of charge by my Starpoints. (It was Easter Weekend) The Suite was very big and everything from A to Z was spotless clean. There was a breeze of fresh air in all rooms. You came in and the full kitchen and dinning area was to your left. ahead was a big living room with TV. Right of that was a big door and our sleeping room, another TV and with private Balcony to the Pool area (which was spotless like the rest of the Gaarden) The Sheraton Sweet Sleeper is a gem. From there you came to a room with hot tub with built in Jacuzzi and shower. Make a right turn and there was a bathroom with two sinks and big wall unit with a lot of Towels and very big room for you own stuff, and a free safe. The Toilet was in an extra room so you did not bother others with bad odor. Everything was brandnew nothing smells funny. The stuff was absolutly wonderful. The Breakfast room had a wonderful carribean style and the Buffet was extraordinary good. Service was great. Inside was also a Souvenirshop with some real nice things. The Hotel had an own Shuttle Bus to Downtown. It was our second stay and we can recommend this Hotel with good conscience.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel was very nice”
Reviews.Author: LAP10
Reviews.Content: This hotel was across the street from Smathers Beach, which is a small quiet beach with no ameneties. The hotel doesn't even provide chairs but you can rent them for $10. a day. The hotel was away from the busy part of Key West which we liked. There was an hourly shuttle that fills up quick so book early. The suite was very nice and clean all the amenities you needed.

Reviews.Title: “not bad for the keys -great price”
Reviews.Author: kttk
Reviews.Content: I went for business so I was there for one night. Its easy to find. Comfortable and clean. Across from the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs, Yes, me too!”
Reviews.Author: Cyannesauntie
Reviews.Content: When I reported that I had been biten by bed bugs, I was at first ignored and then dismissed with the same line given to the person earlier who was bitten. This hotel was a disgrace. We had to ask for a chair to sit on. The rugs were torn and dirty. And when we needed creamer, we were told to go get it ourselves. The blow dryer broke right in my friend's hand. Our vacation was ruined becasue of this hotel. Please beware!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Cruising on a sailboat in FL Keys
Reviews.Title: “Get 3.5 stars for the price of 3. Affordable luxury after a thorough renovation!”
Reviews.Author: DocFraud
Reviews.Content: When I look for a hotel I look for a comfortable bed, good HVAC, a decent shower and a proper place to work/surf the net at an affordable price. We have stayed at this Sheraton several times over the years and we keep coming back because the suite format gives us lots of space for the price of a regular room. It has always been comfortable, but since the property received a complete face lift, the rooms are as nice as any within the Sheraton Suites brand and would certainly fall into the high end of 3 stars or even the low end of 4 stars in another market. The new furnishings are Sheraton Standard, and there is the large well lit table/desk to provide a comfortable place to work, and of course there is the truly heavenly, "Heavenly Bed" for which Starwood is so well known. Yes I said Heavenly Bed and not Sweet Sleeper, because the bed linens are more Westin than Sheraton. The towels however were more in line with the Sheraton brand. The voice mail system is a little quirky, but since we were on a leisure trip, it really didn't matter. Internet was provided for free, but I needed to fire up my external Engenius Wifi card to get a decent signal. Once connected however the free Wifi was fine for surfing and e-mail. The location on Smathers Beach makes it a little remote, but the hotel provides a free shuttle to get into the heart of the Duval strip. Otherwise it is a long walk or an ~$10 cab ride to get to anyplace for dinner, unless of course you dine in the predictably average in house restaurant. The remoteness however is also an advantage because during the busy times of the year in Key West, such as the annual Fantasy Fest this weekend, the activity tends to concentrate on Duval, so the hotel can become an Oasis of quiet. I was offered an upgrade as a Starwood Platinum and given an "Ocean View" room. While it was true that I could see the ocean from my room, I also had a pretty good view of the parking lot and of US Route 1a which separated the hotel from the beach. Since there is a fair amount of traffic on Route 1a during the day, the view does not make up for the noticeable road noise that gets past the only double glazed windows and balcony doors. My recommendation if one is offered an upgrade, is to request south facing rooms overlooking the hot tub area of the pool on the 200 or 300 level. We will definitely recommend this property to others and will stay here again ourselves, the next time our travels takes us to Key West. The hotel is a solid value in a market where price is no indication of quality.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel-but Don't Eat at the Restaurant!”
Reviews.Author: proftravlr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property last week. I got a great deal and a nice room. The only thing is it is by the big turbines that make a lot of noise. I thought it would bother me but didn't, but it might bother others. So don't get rooms that end in 11. I also saw some other noisy turbines by the pool. I was in a room at the back, no one hardly was there-parking was full by the beach view rooms, but that was okay for me. I was there for the Dry Tortugas tour. But don't eat at the restaurant-we were tired when we got in and ate there..it's bad and we were the only people there. The shuttle was nice and quick. It is far from the action but good if you're not into all that craziness (like me). Suites were roomy and nice. If you can get a good deal like I did, this is a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: MichalK3
Reviews.Content: We went for our 10th anniversary. It was a great spot to get away from it all, have time together and fun activities if we chose to participate. We went snorkeling and rented the wave runners. Most of the time we ate at the beach with great food and drinks. For a great night out we ate at the restaraunt super romantic. We were supposed to spend 3 days in Key West and 2 days in Key Largo, after one day in Key West we called Key Largo and asked if they could take us. They gave us a great room and no problems using our frequent traveler points with a change in the last minute.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal but far from city center”
Reviews.Author: hellochristy01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Suites in Key West over the July 4th weekend. I traveled with my husband and several friends and there actually 5 of us staying in one room. The room was very nice- it had a refrigerator, microwave, and bar area in the living area which had a pull out sleeper sofa and a flat screen tv. Our bedroom had two full size beds with another flat screen tv and two french-style pocket doors that closed it off from the living area. The bathroom was nice- there was a quite large closet area with granite counter top sink and separate shower/toilet area. There were only a few negatives about the hotel. One is that we went while the hotel was undergoing renovation so the lobby area was in a weird, hard to reach area. Another was the location. While this is right across the street from the beach, it was a drive from the city center. We drove so we had a car but parking downtown is very limited and can be pricey. We actually did walk back to the hotel after a long day/night of drinking but by the time we got back to the hotel we had all lost our buzz and decided we wouldn't try it again. The beach across the street is not that appealing either. It's nice and large but the water was kind of gross and warm. We did enjoy watching fireworks from the beach on July 4th. Overall I would recommend if you don't mind driving and paying to park downtown. It was definitely a good deal for the money as you can fit a bunch of people in each room comfortably.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location excellent suites.”
Reviews.Author: EveElizHelen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights at the end of september. The hotel and the suites are beautiful. We were just accross the road from the beach. Although a bit outside Key West the hotel ran a mini bus at regular intervals making it easy to visit Key West and it's attractions. The hotel has free internet access and a lovely pool and bar and also meals should you require one. We never tried the meals so can't comment choosing to eat out at one of the many restaurants in the town centre.

Reviews.Title: “Oustanding Renovations”
Reviews.Author: JDawson
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Key West in August and visited the Sheraton. The hotel has recently undergone extensive renovations and looks AMAZING. It is well worth the visit!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: avidwalker
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here over Labor Day weekend for 2 nights. The rooms are fabulous. The pool was very nice. The concierge, Petie, was fabulous in giving recommendations and booking a trip to the Dry Tortugas (a must!), the check-in was seamless and staff very nice and overall I would recommend this hotel. And with all Sheratons, the bed is AMAZING! However, the drawback for us was it was not convenient to walking to downtown. Next time I will stay at a hotel closer to the downtown area. There was a shuttle, but we never used it because the times weren't convenient for us. Also, they told us the spots fill up quickly. If you are interested in being right across from Smathers Beach, this is the place for you. Overall, a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Relaxing Time”
Reviews.Author: YasBerry
Reviews.Content: Well lets see...The pool is small.but the drink next to pool bar is good, they offer free shuttle to main shopping areas.service was amazing people were so chill. the room omg amazingly clean and comfortable.bathrooms clean clean sweeeet! restaurant was good :) we had continental breakfast which was delicious. the beach was all filled with seaweed upto sand and not to go in but the sand was white! Great time you wil have Relax at the resort and party at DUVAL st. w freee jelly shots!! ;) pick up free coupons from hotel! they have free jello shot coupons heehhe:) have fun!

Reviews.Title: “A lot nicer than I expected it to be”
Reviews.Author: Roxanne1908
Reviews.Content: I knew that the room would be a suite, but it was the nicest suite I've ever had the pleasure of staying in. There was no bath tube in the room, but who takes baths in a hotel anyway? The shower was AMAZING! It was huge. I've never seen a shower that large aside from on HGTV. My only "dislike" about the room is that there appeared to be tiny bugs (which I cannot identify) crawling on some of the hard surfaces of the room (i.e. desk, counter tops).

Reviews.Title: “THIEF THIEF THIEF ONE OF THEIR EMPLOYEES IS A THIEF AND THE DESK NEW IT AND DID NOTHING”
Reviews.Author: jahlive57
Reviews.Content: MAFIA STYLE THIEVERY THE FRONT DESK MUST BE IN ON IT They knew what happened but nobody was man or woman enough to admit it. We prayed every day that our room would be cleaned. They get around to it sometime. Bring your own soap

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious stay, GREAT room's & hotel”
Reviews.Author: veromania
Reviews.Content: This hotel just got it all: luxus, quitness, friendlyness, style and more. Rooms offer a small fridge, microwave( no oven function!), dining area, hugh couch/sitting area, hugh bed, great bathroom with a shower for fitting 3 people, nice furniture, free wifi in room and in hotel lobby, great staff, nice pool and just a cross walk from the beautiful beach with coconut palms all over. We felt like some stars being able to use this suite hotel. To get downtown use the free trolley bus offered by the hotel. There is no cheaper way to get there:-) Mr Ed (the driver) is veeeery friendly and helps out with all questions reg. downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: CruzinRob
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I visited this hotel for a 3 night geta way in key West. After travelling all over Florida we had never been to the Keys so we figured we would check it out finally. The hotel has just finished a big renovation and although I cant compare it to how it looked before it was very nice. The lobby is pleasant and very bright. The suites are large and contain a fridge, microwave, coffe maker and a very large comfy king size bed as well as "two" large lcd tvs ! Try to request a top floor as we heard some noise quite often coming from above us. Also, some rooms have balconys which we should have pushed for but we didnt. Try to get one of those as they look really nice. We had no problems with the staff although the front desk guy was a little strange and really didnt help us at all. The hotel shuttle is free and runs every hour until about 11 pm. It was great and the driver was really friendly. They drop you off in a central location in downtown key west. We had to cab it back everynight because we stayed too late and partyed !! A cab ride is approx. $12-15 so it wasnt a big deal. The pool area is real nice and a shopping mall is only about a 10 min drive away so no problem getting what you need. Right across the street is a beautiful beach but, the water is not that great to swim in because it is very weedy. You are better off going to Taylor Park if you really want to swim in the ocean. They do have a restaurant which we never tried just because there are so many dining options in downtown you dont want to miss them. Overall a excellent hotel. We would probably go back again but we might try something else downtown as it is always fun to try new places but I would not hesitate recommending this hotel to anyone. Oh ya of course, the free parking is nice too !!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Me215
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before our stay. For the price, it's hard to beat the Sheraton Suites in Key West. We would surely consider staying here again when we return to Key West. The location is about a 15 minute drive from downtown - but with the free shuttle service, this is no problem. The hotel is right across the street from a lovely beach, and a short walk to an AIDS Memorial park. **The AIDS Memorial park has a great pier to view the sunset if you want to avoid the crowds at Mallory Square.** Overall, the room was large - but the bathroom was HUGE compared to other hotels. The vanity area was a combination walk-in-closet and vanity with the shower and toilet in a separate room. All granite and marble in the bathroom/vanity. We stayed in a suite with 2 queen-sized beds, no balcony. The decor in the room was not new, but everything was clean and comfortable. The beds were very nice, as I've come to expect in Sheraton Hotels. Our room included free breakfast each morning and free wireless internet. Our friends stayed in a King suite with a balcony. Their room was a bit nicer - with flat screen TVs, newer furniture, and a gorgeous view of the beach. It's definetely worth the upgrade if you enjoy balconies. There was construction going on at the hotel. However, the front desk explained that this is due to fire damage caused by a smoker throwing a cigarette from one of the balconies. Other than some of the hotel not looking so great, it didn't bother us much. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: TampaHpyTrvlr
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, the room we had was overlooking the pool and was HUGE! The only problem we had was room service on the 2nd day, we ran out of towels and even though we had been "out" all day, when we returned at 4:00 p.m. to get ready for the evening activities we had scheduled the room still had NOT been cleaned. We called Guest Services and within 30 minutes the housecleaner was at our door, so while they were very slow in getting the job done, it did get done quickly once we contacted Guest Services. The shuttle was great, you just have to make sure that you sign up early each day for each shuttle that you need to get where you want to go each day. We had several things we wanted to do (parasailing, sunset cruise, Mallory Square, etc.) and all of these events were at the opposite end of the island, but with the shuttle and good planning, we were able to get to everything without any problem at all. Victor, the bartender on the patio was awesome! The bar does close by 11:00 p.m., so if you want to "party the night away", make sure your own refrigerator is stocked up! Lastly, we used the Key West Express to get to/from Key West. It was also a great trip, the only problem is the return on Sunday was packed with a lot of people that were hung-over and the waves were a little choppy, so if you come to Key West this way, get to the boat terminal early for check-in so you can select a good seat! Also, we found a great "luggage hotel" kitty-corner from the boat terminal, for $10 per person (2 bags each), they can hold your luggage until you go to check-in @ Key West Express. One of the owners, J.R. Fogarty also runs a cab, he was very helpful to us since we didn't know our way around the island and took us to a great sandwich shop (Paradise) for our cuban sandwiches...that too, was awesome...the sandwiches were HUGE! The hotels make you check out by 10:00, 11:00 a.m. and the boat doesn't leave until 6:00 p.m., so rather than leave your luggage at the hotel and then have to come back and pick them up, you can leave your luggage right by the terminal and spend those hours getting in your last "shopping" experiences or whatever. The luggage terminal also provides you with 2 for 1 drink coupons nearby, so the $10.00 per person can easily be redeemed with your drinks. We had a great time and will definitely do it again!

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay and booking my 3rd :o)”
Reviews.Author: morganrdunn
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd visit to Sheraton Suites Key West and we will be staying here again next year :o) The staff is extremely friendly and accomodating. You can even find the hotel manager outside on the deck every morning greeting you for breakfast, serving your orange juice. The rooms are very nice... SUPER comfy beds and a HUGE stand up shower! We wake up every morning and sit out on the balcony (poolveiw is the best, the waterfall into the pool sounds so inviting in the morning ) and drink the free Starbucks coffee from your own Keurig coffee machine. The Poolside barkeep is so sweet. She is a local, so we always check w/ her for the fun happening of the evening. Food and drinks are always very fresh, and satisfying. Not a walk to Duval Street, but a great 5 minute drive on a scooter (part of which is right along the beach). The hotel is right across from Smathers beach, which I'm pretty sure is the only public beach in Key West! We love Key West, Sheraton Suites are TOO affordable, and I can not wait to go back!!! Stay here... u will love it!

Reviews.Title: “The Sheraton Suites..........almost there. Keep working!”
Reviews.Author: REBLE
Reviews.Content: My family stayed @ the Sheraton. The maid service needs some help. They forgot to clean the room on three of seven days. They also forgot to restock the coffee, sugar, and or towels DAILY. Seemed to be something every day. Although they are renovating they don't offer a discounted price. The hidden "state" charges bring the nightly cost to almost $300. per night. The pool was nice & Petie (concierge) was excellent. Very helpful and informed of all activities around Key West. Overall.... I would recommend this facility.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: geodogs
Reviews.Content: We had the 1 bedroom suite. Lovely, large room, recently redecorated. Make sure you get a room that has been redone!!! Comfy beds, 2 flat screens, cold a/c, thick towels. I'm picky, but they pretty much hit my hot spots. Hotel staff, OK; not very friendly, but competant and not rude. Their concierge was very helpful. This hotel is being redone. When we visited (July, 20, 2009), the lobby and restaurant were almost finished and done in lovely plantation/island decor, dark wood floors contarsted with classy rattan furniture and fabrics. Nice pool area and lovely grounds. The hall areas that have not been redone yet look a little scruffy, but not bad. I'm sure they have to work at it constantly considering the weather they have to deal with. Located across the street from a nice, large beach, but not close enough to town to walk. We found parking each evening without much of a problem. Dogs welcome and they provide "potty bags" and disposal on the grounds.THANK YOU! We'll stay here next time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room, comfy, very nice”
Reviews.Author: Armypeople
Reviews.Content: It was a clean room that could sleep up to 6 people. Beds awesome. Nice windows. Parking included. Across the street from the beach. I would definitely book this hotel again. Laundry on-site, $2 to wash and $2 to dry, but bring your own detergent. Nice fluffy towels, elevator works. They were doing remodeling but not too much inconvenience for me, workers polite and relatively unobtrusive to guests. I thought it was great! Their concierge lady was enthusiastic, knowledgable, nice and really a great ambassador for that hotel, we felt very welcome!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, great location, awful customer service”
Reviews.Author: FleurDeLis1222
Reviews.Content: Our room was beautifully renovated & we liked the convenience of the mini-fridge & microwave. We comfortably fit 4 adults (2 in the master bedroom & 2 on the sofabed). and the room layout was brilliant because the bathroom had 2 doors: 1 door to the master bedroom and 1 door to the living room. Another big plus was having Smathers Beach immediately across the street. This Sheraton also has a great pool with a machine that gives you complimentary cold drinking water in the provided cups. We had the breakfast buffet and I highly suggest that you stay away from it. It was just potato wedges, eggs, bacon soggy with grease, sausage, really dry pancakes, breads, and fruits. They ran out of things quickly, including syrup for the dry pancakes, and weren't fast to refill the items. Many patrons also walked up with their dirty plates and used their hands to get items- I know the servers saw them, but no one said a thing. I thought this was especially gross when the guy in front of me picked up a piece of watermelon with his fingers, put it on his dirty plate, and then put it back in the watermelon dish b/c he decided not to eat it. I also tried to call room service several times and they never answered the phone. I finally walked down to the bar and ordered there. The food at the bar was good, but the options are quite limited- a few sandwiches and a couple of salads. Sadly, the customer service was pathetic. The shuttle didn't pick my inlaws up from the airport- as advertised. My inlaws called upon arrival and were told, at 1 pm, that the shuttle would not be available all day. They were forced to take a taxi instead. The bathroom by the pool was not tidy and my mother-in-law was horrified at finding a used condom wrapper at the sink. Housekeeping did not clean our room until very late in the afternoon. Strangely, our housekeeper took all of our toiletries (including our toothbrushes in a toothbrush holder) and layed everything out on the bathroom counter. And, as stated before, room service never once picked up the phone. Would I stay there again? I'm the kind of person that prefers a really beautiful room- even if it means the place is lacking in service. Sometimes you just want a great room & that's all that matters. So, if you want a great room and don't care about service, then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Warning Warning Warning”
Reviews.Author: ilovedogs05
Reviews.Content: Make sure that you have a confirmed reservation in writing with the specifics of your room - number of beds, view etc. They will try to give you whatever they have. Make sure to ask them for a newly remodeled room or they will ask you move furniture durning your stay. Make sure to call the front desk for maid service or they will forget to come to your room. Make sure to ask them if the pool, hot tub work because they might not be working. The front desk is not very helpful. There are tons of mattresses around because they are remodeling. Front desk staff not so friendly. Try everywhere else first.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for family, location and price”
Reviews.Author: KaiEli
Reviews.Content: I looked at most if not all of the hotels with suites available in Key west. I narrowed my choices to 3. Casa Marina, Westin and Sheraton Suites. After researching and weighing the pros and cons since I have small kids, I decided to stay in Sheraton, which was the best choice. Casa Marina like most hotel also have a man made beach and is 3x more expensive than Sheraton even though they were having a special the week that we were there. They do have a nicer lobby and pool than Sheraton, but we were on the beach most of the time so this really didn't matter to us. Westin is nice too but unless you're single the activities on the Marina can be noisy and very busy, price is not that far from Sheraton's. Sheraton has Smathers beach across the street. If you have a car, you can also try other beaches. Fort Zachary Taylor park has a much nicer beach, the entrance fee is worth it ($8 for 1 car with 4 adults). Memorial beach is free, which is next to Casa Marina hotel. We rented bikes for few days. You can bike to town and also along the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs here... Beware”
Reviews.Author: djcuba
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at this hotel. The first stay was in May of 2008. We had one of the most pleasant experiences of our lives. We returned based on that experience only to find a completely different hotel 14 months later. The staff looked stressed out and tired (which is not a fun thing to be around on your vacation), the cleaning staff actually told us how underpaid they were ($250 biweekly????) which was their way of excusing the lack of room service, and every time we called the front office for legitimate reasons (ie no toilet paper, broken refrigerator, lack of bath towels) we felt as if we were bothering them. To top off our experience, our room had bed bugs in it. We all kept waking up with bite marks. We wrote it off as mosquito bites until check out day that I found blood stains on both the sheets and the inside of my shirt. When we brought this up to the staff, they acted as if this was a strange isolated incidence. As soon as we left the regristration room, I bumped into an Orkin Pest Control inspector and spoke with him. He stated that he was there today because of a bed bug problem.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: eich76
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton for 2 nights before our wedding. We were very happy with the room, but had previously decided to spend the last 4 nights after our wedding at a B&B closer to Duval. Big mistake! The B&B (Albury Court) was not good at all. So, after one night we left the Albury and went back to the Sheraton for the last 3 nights in Key West. Both of our rooms at the Sheraton had recently been updated. The carpet even smelled new. The rooms were very spacious, clean, and updated. The Sheraton is in the midst of renovation, but this barely affected our stay. The gentleman at the front desk was very helpful when we returned from the B&B. He helped us get a great rate for our final three nights. The pool area was very nice. The water was clean and warm and it had a nice waterfall. The hotel is just across the road from Smather's Beach, which was nice. It was kind of far from the action on Duval, but that was not a problem since we had a rental car. They also offer a shuttle to downtown, but we did not use it. We will definitely stay at the Sheraton when we return to Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place... would go back.”
Reviews.Author: HollyHollyUK
Reviews.Content: Great service... great location and lovely rooms. Not really more to say, as we were bought the trip by a friend as an anniversary present!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: rubysaab
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton from 16-19 May 2009. The hotel is undergoing refurbishment to the public areas which may affect your stay and may be worth checking first. The reception was to be found located in a meeting room, the staff were very polite and courteous and did apologise for the disruption. We had an oceanview suite which was lovely and spacious and looked as though it may have recently been refurbished. We did have to request extra towels as there werenâ€™t enough for our party of 4 which arrived promptly. The indoor restaurant was closed for refurb and seating was on the veranda which was chaos on our first morning as more guests than chairs! This seemed to unnerve some of the staff who are perhaps not use to things not running smoothly and having a queue. At times the breakfast buffet was in need of replenishment. The pool area was clean with lots of chairs, loungers and towels although this was going to be closed for several days after our stay. The bar staff were very pleasant if you intended staying for a while and plying them with trade but for one off drinks to take to the pool or room rather offhand. The Shuttle service to downtown Key West is well worth taking advantage of. It ran to schedule but booking is essential and we were let down once when the bus we had booked was full but the driver did make a special trip back for us as we had 2 young children.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate At Best”
Reviews.Author: muffiy831
Reviews.Content: First off, it's far away from downtown Key West. The shuttle is nice but only runs once an hour and you have to reserve it in advance so spontaneity is difficult. The whole place is being renovated, so the pool was closed and the construction starts early and loudly. The rooms are perfectly adequate and reasonably clean, but outdated and nothing special. On the upside, the beach across the street is quite nice and the staff was VERY friendly. The first room they put us in smelled gross and they were very accommodating to us switching rooms for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “bad location, ugly lobby, staff from former soviet union paid very poorly most likely and taking american jobs when eve”
Reviews.Author: cara2001
Reviews.Content: I went to KW to attend a conference.Everyone knows KW is the drunk people's paradise, so let's not even talk about it. Sheraton is located across the street from a public beach-dirty, lots of drunks and strange people sleeping there at all times.the hotel is operated by a bunch of young foreign guys, I was very surprised to see that they got a summer job in a country where every American is desperate for a job, maybe they get paid $2/hour who knows. the lobby is dirty and very small, the rooms are OK, the restaurant is ok as well. overall, I don't think I will ever go back.

Reviews.Title: “Girls Getaway”
Reviews.Author: amy613
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Suites in April and had a wonderful time. While the rooms were a bit run down ,the pool area and location next to Smather's beach more than made up for it. The shuttle service was fabulous and made getting to downtown so easy. My favorite part of the day was sitting outside at breakfast overlooking the pool and drinking coffee. I would absolutely stay at the Sheraton Suites again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Under Constuction”
Reviews.Author: warcaw
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently made our yearly trip to Key West. We decided to use Priceline and bid for our hotel. Sheraton accepted our bid for $120 per night, not a bad price for Key West. Upon arrival we were greeted by construction workers boarding up the main entrance to the hotel. Luckily a manager walking past led us to the new location of the front desk, a transformed conference room down the hall. She was very apologetic telling us that the front desk was being moved so that renovation could begin. We wouldn't have cared about the construction, we just would have liked a heads up before we came. The hotels website made no mention of any work being done nor did our confirmation. None the less we were greeted every mourning at 7:30 by the sound of construction equipment dumping trash into the dumpsters behind our room. It's really good that they are renovating, our room alone had several minor problems: toilet paper holder coming out of the wall, mini fridge stopped working, and stains on the carpet. Also we thought the price of the breakfast buffet for $15.95 was far over priced for the selection of food and quality that was offered, but I guess you can check this up to it's Key West. Also if your not a fan of airplane noise, the hotel is located just off the approach end of the airport. My suggestion would be to stay away from the back building. On the plus side the hotel did offer free internet, free shuttle service to downtown, Free parking, and its located across the street from Smather's Beach .

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is great”
Reviews.Author: whitluver
Reviews.Content: I went to Key West for my honeymoon, and my husband and I stayed in a Sheraton Suite. I loved it! The staff was friendly and helpful. They told us about the attractions in the areas. The hotel room was clean & spacious and stylish. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Rooms & Location”
Reviews.Author: SAtraveller3
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to center of town. pleasant 10 minute walk. Across the road from the beach. Free parking. Fabulous large well equiped rooms. HUGE shower with seperate vanity, sink and toilet. Little kitchenette with microwave and bar fridge and sink.Free coffee-maker with starbucks coffee...perfect for early mornings.Very comfortable big bed with lots of pillow choices. seperate lounge area with folding doors for privacy.Breakfast had very nice buffet spread with option of a-la-carte.very nice pool area with loungers but you need to get there early to find a spot. staff were very friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay a defarnate recommendation”
Reviews.Author: londonerica
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and wished we had stayed longer, what a wonderful hotel, the rooms were very spacious with very decadent interior also offering free starbucks in room coffee bags for the coffee maching, a major plus was the walls were thick enough that i did not hear the people next door , this hotel offers free parking, is located right opposite the beach, is a bit of a distance from Duval street and the harbour but the hotel offers free hourly shuttle service or if you have a car is easy to get around however parking does range from about $10 per day but there is defarnately enough parking around. The staff was very friendly and helpful, especially our concierge who helped us with all of our daily excursions, and the friendly guys that drove the shuttle bus, however one thing i could say that could possibly improve would be the frequency of the shuttle service to maybe every 30 min.

Reviews.Title: “Nice family hotel”
Reviews.Author: brady33
Reviews.Content: We are a family of five and I booked this hotel as they accomodated all the family in the one suite and I did not have to book two seperate rooms. The hotel look nice from the outside and had a lovely pool/bar/restaurant. The room was large, had a nice bathroom and a couple of tvs and a microwave. However, I would totally agree that the rooms are a bit tired and need updating. Carpets were stained - not sure why they just don't pull them up and put wood/tiled flooring down and I am still wondering why they need carpet on the outside walkways! The shuttle bus was a big plus for us and we used it lots of times. Even if you don't book in time if they have space they will take you. This allowed you to leave the car and make full use of the bars in the town centre. The hotel is directly opposite the beach which also looked nice.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Suite”
Reviews.Author: tucci82
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Key West in March 2009. The trip was spur of the moment and was planned the week before we left. Neither one of us have stayed in Key West before other than day trips from cruises. The Sherton Key West staff was great over the phone. Although the prices were higher on the Sheraton website, they were able to beat Expedia's price when I called and asked. The morning we arrived the hotel had a fire so we were pretty nervous pulling up but the staff handled it beautifully. The suite was very large, well kept, and very clean. The location was ok depending on what your looking for. It is on Smather's beach which it nice but too far to walk to Duval Street and all of the action. It was a great hotel and would absolutly reccomend it to a friend. The only down side was the "free shuttle" It was a joke. The shuttle need to be reserved in the morning but everymorning it was all full by 10 am! Also, last return shuttle back from Duval Street 11pm. Key West is a party town! We ended up taking a cab which was about $10. Everytime we called the cab was there with literally 3-4 mins.....MUCH MORE convenient !!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel but rooms need re-furbishing”
Reviews.Author: klpsmom
Reviews.Content: Dive trip took us to Key West and price dictated lodgings. We normally prefer to stay on Duval, but the Sheraton seemed like an affordable alternative since they offered shuttle service to downtown which ran every half hour until 10:50 but you did have to reserve a seat as the shuttle only accomodates 16 passengers at a time. The rooms are large and have tremendous potential but the carpet is horribly stained throughout and the furniture beat up and scratched. On a positive note, the bathroom is it's best feature. Very large with cherry cabinetry and granite countertops. The shower was nice and large but we had almost non-existent water pressure. It was also clean. There was also a nice little "kitchen" area w/ sink, fridge, microwave, complimentary water bottles and best all, Starbucks coffee and coffee maker. Bed was comfy. Service was good and breakfast buffet ok. They need more variety. Pool are was very nice as well as the Tiki bar. It's literally across the street from the beach. I would stay again, but only for a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Evrything you need”
Reviews.Author: vermillion2000
Reviews.Content: This place was very impressive. Shuttle to Duval, resturant onsite, beach across the street and a pool. You don't "need" a car but you may want one so you can be completely on your schedule. Fort Zachary is the best place to go see the sunset and the nicest beach. Fort Zachary can be crowded if there is a cruise ship in dock at Mallory Square. Mallory Square is also a great place to see the sunset, get there about an hour to an hour and a half before sunset. Many things happening. This hotel is worth the money.One thing to note, the walls are thin, if you are beside kids of any age, they will be heard. I booked thru Orbitz. Much better than your above average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastice hotel”
Reviews.Author: crizzy1982
Reviews.Content: After spending 5 days in New york City then 4 days in South Beach Miami, this was the hotel of our dreams. I drove down from Miami and WHAT A FANSTASTIC DRIVE. Just as the sun was setting. When we arrived the staff were fantastic. Are room was a suite with courtyard views seperate bedroom. lovely. Vist Sandy M in hotel gift shop what a fantastic lady, a real fountain of knoweledge when it comes to Key West. and she also knows the exact time the sun sets everyday so you don't miss it. Vist Shelly G in the pool bar, we loved her fantastic lady very friendly we wanted her to come home with us. We sat chatting all day about her travels around the states. Lots of good information and helpful advice. The free bus from the hotel to Duval Street the main street in down town keywest. Thge drivers are great, really excentric with all the advice you will need to have a great day or night out. Wea re for defo going back to this hotel and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful rooms, and close to beach”
Reviews.Author: wwtraveller101
Reviews.Content: At first glance this hotel looks a bit "older" than some - however the rooms are absolutely beautiful. even though there was only 2 of us, the rooms would be great for a family. The staff was very helpful. The hotel was just across the road from the beach. Although it is too far to walk downtown, there is a very convenient shuttle - we took it several times back and forth - only a 10 minute drive. We only had supper there, as we preferred to try out some of the other small restaurants in the downtown area for breakfast and lunches. Other than the fact that the internet didn't seem to work (but who cares, we were on holidays), I would go here in a minute again!

Reviews.Title: “out of the way but great room and great service”
Reviews.Author: PDBTexas
Reviews.Content: The hotel is an all suite hotel so the rooms were very spacious and allowed us to kick back in our room mid afternoons and mornings. If you like a slower pace and a public beach across the street, this is a good place to stay. You will have to drive or take the shuttle to Duval Street area and the shuttle is only once an hour. Parking in the Duval Street area will cost from $10 to $35 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we stayed longer...”
Reviews.Author: jollyroger09
Reviews.Content: This was the second hotel we stayed at and it was great. The room was clean and looked relatively up-to-date. I am assuming that we didn't get one of the outdated rooms people are referring to in previous postings. It was close enough to downtown and right across from one of the beaches (public/free). The price was great for what you get and I would definitely stay there again...wish we had been there the entire time. Some of the other hotels on that strip are about the same price...so beware! I think the Travelodge was only about $20 cheaper/night and it was NOTHING SPECIAL. Staff were very helpful and friendly...grounds were well kept and the shuttle was useful.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Every Penny!”
Reviews.Author: debracake
Reviews.Content: Beautiful and roomy. Loved this place and wish we could have stayed longer. Hotwire gave us $25 credit because it dripped a half a star but I cannot figure where, unless it's because the elevators are not immaculate. This is a wonderful place and I don't think you can do wrong here!

Reviews.Title: “Just love it”
Reviews.Author: thefirstreader
Reviews.Content: The stuff were friendly and suite room was very spacious and clean. Although not located at KW's downtown, the south beach was just "on site."

Reviews.Title: “not over the top, but nice”
Reviews.Author: taitinc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Key West from Jan. 17 - Jan. 28. The location of the hotel was about a five to ten minute drive from Mallory Square. The hotel provides a shuttle bus into town. I don't know any specifics about the shuttle because we rented a car. If you rent a car parking in town can be a nuisance and become expensive, but allows you to see a lot more of Key West and the other Keys. We flew into Miami, so we made the approximately three and a half hour drive down. I have always liked the drive from Miami, so I usually opt to take the drive. There is plenty to look at along the way and the time goes by very quickly. My fiancÃ© and I booked this trip for our wedding / honeymoon. We booked all of our wedding stuff over the internet before we got there. We got married on Smathers Beach on Tuesday the 20th. With the location to Smathers Beach and being a Starwood resort, we chose the Sheraton. The only real complaint I have about the hotel is the fact that most rooms don't have balconies. Being a Starwood resort owner and a gold member, I requested an ocean front room with a balcony. When we got there at 5:30pm they said they had no more ocean front rooms with a balcony. I was tired from traveling, so rather than argue I just choose another room. Check-in went smoothly and within 15 mins of our arrival we were in our room. Not an ocean front or balcony room, but close enough. It was room 361, which is the third floor right side room closest to the front of the hotel. We had a decent view of the ocean from the hallway balcony. The room was large and open. There is a separate bedroom with sliding doors to close it off. We never used the doors, since it was just the two of us, but I can imagine it would be nice if there was someone sleeping on the pullout couch. There is a small wet bar with a coffee maker, microwave, frig, sink and storage. The only problem with the wet bar is there are no plates or silverware. We made a call to room service and they provided what we needed. Room service was very quick and delivered decent food. We ordered breakfast twice and dinner twice, and all was good and at our room within 25 mins at the most. The bath room is large with plenty of storage. A few things we did during our stay that I would recommend to others: We took the "Fast Cat" to the Dry Tortugas. This is a most do! It is about a two and a half hour boat ride to Fort Jefferson. There is excellent snorkeling, nice beaches and a HUGE fort to explorer. Mallory Square at sunset is always a must. The performers are very entertaining, and the sunset is almost always perfect. We also did a back country kayak tour. For this we had to travel to mile marker 17 on sugarloaf key. Capt Andrea took us, and it was amazing. I highly recommend this to everyone, as this was the best part of my trip. We also went flats fishing. Once again we did this from the sugarloaf marina with Capt Justin and Sting Rea Charters. We had a great time and caught plenty of fish. Another must do is taking a trip up to Bahia Honda state park. The beaches are picture perfect and you can find many unique shells. In order to do this you will need a rental car. If you get a rental car from Miami or Ft Lauderdale and drive down, you will see a lot of things you'll want to check out during you stay. If any of you are interested in jewelry I highly recommend David Brian Jewelers on Duval St. I made a couple purchases from him while in town. The catch for me was if you make a purchase he will take you on a sunset cruise and a fishing trip. He has a 50 foot boat and is not only a jeweler, but a Capt. too. I didn't get to take a fishing trip while in town, because of the weather and schedule, so he said next time Iâ€™m in town he'll take us out. Most of the activities mentioned above can be found on the Key West website. Our favorite restaurants in Key West are: Laid back: Rum Barrel Nice: A&B Lobster House and Commodores Our favorite restaurant from our entire trip is the Square Grouper. This isn't on Key West, and is about a 25 min drive from down town. It is on Cudjoe Key at mile marker 22.5 Back to the hotel... All in all we had a very nice stay. I don't have any real complaints about anything. The hotel is nice, and simply that. It is not over the top fancy by any means, but offers a nice location out of the hustle bustle of town. If you are looking for a five star resort, look elsewhere. If you are looking for a nice laid back place to stay than this is it. Check-out was a breeze and took more time to walk to the front desk then it did to check out.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kkowala
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel after reading the reviews on this site. We spent three nights in this hotel with our two younger children. The room was very large and had everything we needed to include the fridgerator, microwave and coffee maker. The sofa bed was comfortable for the kids and they loved the ability to have their own room. The bed was really comfortable and the AC was quiet and efficient. The shower and bath area was huge. The room was very clean and quiet!!! Our kids loved the pool as it was warm and the waterfall was fun. Connected to the pool area was a bar and restaurant. We enjoyed the breakfast (although I wish it was complimentary) buffet one morning. The workout room was very nice for a hotel. It had higher end equipment that was well maintained. They had a shuttle service (with friendly drivers) that transported to the town--although you had to plan ahead and make reservations. The only down side to his hotel was no shuttle to the airport. Although it was indicated the previous night that they could find a driver--there was no one available that morning.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on what you are looking for”
Reviews.Author: Takemeaway79
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Sheraton on a quick trip from Ft. Lauderdale. (I use the word "quick" loosely as it takes more time to get there than the miles indicate, so be prepared for the drive). Our first impression was good as the room was spacious and the bathroom area was nicely done. There is good storage in the bathroom area to make a several night stay comfortable. The coffee bar with its own sink and fridge below was a welcome sight. The furniture was a little tired but adequate for our needs. However, the carpet was rather disgusting! Changing that out would make a big difference in this room. I wore black socks or sandals so my feet never touched it. The beach across the street is nice and quiet. Duval St. can be reached by hotel shuttle but you must plan ahead and reserve a spot. Since we did not know when we would arrive, the shuttle was already fully booked and we needed to rely on our rental car and paid $10 to park in covered parking on the end of Duval. Check out time is 11:00 and your room key will stop working at 11:01.

Reviews.Title: “The worst Starwood Hotel I have ever seen.”
Reviews.Author: marasis111
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Sheraton Suites, Key West 12/26-12/29. We were disappointed continuously throughout our stay. Immediately upon walking into the room we noticed how dated and worn the room appeared. Certainly, the quality of the room is far below standards expected of a Starwood Hotel. Upon further inspection, we were exceptionally appalled to find a white substance very evident on the blue bedspread and then upon using the restroom noticed a brown substance spread over the walls. We called the front desk to complain at which time the general manager was not at all helpful and informed us more or less to deal with it because they were sold out. They did however offer us one other room...a room that was currently being painted, and consequently had paint chips all over the floor and some sort of fan running to try to clear out the very evident smell - obviously, not acceptable. Our only option was to have them try to clean the walls and change the bedspread - as such, we went for a walk and upon our return 2 HOURS LATER, nothing had been addressed yet. This was just the beginning. Throughout our stay, we found the cleaning service to be subpar - not replacing towels, or water, and the customer service to be more or less indifferent. The real kicker was when we went to use a "clean" towel only to notice the dried blood on the towel. We couldn't stand being in this room and it definitely put a damper on what was supposed to be a romantic vacation as we didn't want to touch each other due to the concern of the germs that we may have picked up in the room. Oh, one other small note - in a country that is focused on "being green" I also find it very disappointing to return to a room in which the cleaning service has left both TVs on and multiple lights on throughout the day. A very unnecessary waste. It was very evident that nobody was checking the performance of ANY of the employees and there had been very little, if any, training. I spend over 60 nights a year in a hotel, and have never been this disgusted...even in the middle of a Honduras jungle the rooms are cleaner and the staff more accommodating...

Reviews.Title: “Typical Key West”
Reviews.Author: CindyInMichigan
Reviews.Content: We enjoy riding the bikes into town so being outside the thick of things doesn't bother us. The rooms are very large but the furniture is a bit tired. That was probably my only disappointment. The bath and wet bar area are nice. They stock the room with Starbucks so that in itself is a plus. If you like jogging, the path across the street goes on forever and it's nice with the breeze off the ocean. The pool area starts filling up around 1:00p so it's best to get your spot early if you're picky. If you're not picky, there's plenty of room. I also suggest paying the insanely higher rate for the ocean view balcony if you like having your own space at least once a day. It's nice to have coffee out there in the morning even if it is on the main road. This is of course coming from a couple without kids. I don't really know how much peace you can get with a full family in your room. If I can find a fair price.....I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “good location, great rates”
Reviews.Author: SanMogal
Reviews.Content: key west is great in november. It was warm and balmy still. The rooms are nice and clean. It's also very spacious. The suites rooms are great for family. It can fit 2 in the main room and two more in the front. The rooms are pretty standard, however very nice. It's all close to the water, so you have pretty much a great view all around, and walking distance to the beach. The hotel offers a free shuttle so yo ucan skirt around the island. We had b'fast the the beach restaurant before heading over to the jump on "Floridays". It was a 4 hour trip recommended by the concierge at the hotle. I did not snorkel, so I paid only half price. It was so peaceful on the water.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: DanNorway
Reviews.Content: My family (girlfriend and son by the age age 3 Â½) and I were on a 3-week vacation in Florida this summer. We deiced to go to Key West for some days at the end of our vacation. We hadnâ€™t book any hotel, so we stopped at the â€œfirstâ€� we drove by, witch was â€œSheraton Suites Key Westâ€�. They had rooms for rent, and we got a nice room with separate living room at the end of the complex. The room was nice and clean, BUT lacked a balcony witch we missed during our stay. The hotel is located close to a small beach witch we had a view over. We spent the morning ours at the beach witch was quite and not crowded. We enjoyed our hours at the beach, BUT we didnâ€™t like the muddy ground under the water. They had a small but nice swing pool at the hotel, BUT we didnâ€™t use it because it was very crowded and noisy al daylong! The hotel is located â€œoutsideâ€� the center of Key West, so we had to use the car every time we went down town. They have a shuttle buss from the hotel, but we preferred to use our own car. All in all we hade a nice stay at this hotel at a reasonable price, BUT I think we will book another hotel next time, closer to the center and with a bigger swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Key West”
Reviews.Author: t2311ps
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nites here at the Sheraton and the rooms were very nice clean and spacious. We fond breakfast to be expensive at $15 for the buffet if you have a car you can go to Denny's which is 5 min drive. Only problem we had was that one day our room was not serviced properly clean towels provided but bed left unmade and coffee maker not cleaned out. We brought this to the attention of the front desk that afternoon and they promised to fix it but it never happened. The manager did apologize the next day and compensated us with free breakfast. Hotel provides an hourly shuttle bus to town which has to be booked in advance (including return) which could be a problem if the hotel is busy.

Reviews.Title: “Great get away”
Reviews.Author: MechancisburgBigJim
Reviews.Content: . We had been to Key West before but stayed at a holiday inn. This hotel was lot nicer than that one. We stayed for (3) nights and found the hotel very nice. I too, was a lttle leary after reading some reviews.... The rooms were very clean and a nice seating area. We came with another couple and it was very easy to go and visit .We had 256 and 257. The ocean view was fantastic. Kingsize bed was very comfortable and a very nice shower. The staff was very accommodating Especially the shuttle drivers and the people working in the gift shop Unfortuantely, we had a cold spell in Key West. We were actually wearing sweat shirts to watch the sun go down, The wind was probably 15 - 20 mph. White caps on the water. It was pretty nasty. The last day was pretty nice. The shuttle is a great way to go down and back at night. We would use our rental car to drive down during the day. Get back. relax alittle, catch the 5:30 and come back at 10:50, or, take a cab.. But that was a plan. We just seemed to be ready to come back by 10:50. Ticket or no ticket the shuttle never left anyone behind... Seriously, no complaints about the hotel at all. One final thought on visiting Key West. Fly into Miami and drive down thru the Florida "Keys", It takes about 3 hours. It is an absolutely beautiful drive... It is a 'must do'. GOOD LUCK and ENJOY YOUR STAY! o

Reviews.Title: “Grubby”
Reviews.Author: ZippyLondon
Reviews.Content: All the staff (pretty much everyone we had dealings with) were very good, smiley and professional; from check in to the concierge/tours girl (Petie) to the servers. Very good. The property looked OK on the Sheraton website (well, they are not going to make it look bad I suppose) but to say it is grubby is probably giving them the benefit of the doubt. Our first room (#324) came with blood/other stained carpets which had clearly outstayed their welcome, grey (not by manufacture) thread-bare net curtains, badly stained walls, dirty sheets and a rather odd (but not in a nice way) smell which I coulndn't quite put my finger on. The second room was somewhat better (#102) but still not worthy of $200 per night (IMHO). The carpet was better although still a little suspect and the walls did have the odd splattering of nastiness but yes, it was better. The bathrooms (in both rooms) are of a good/clean standard and come with large showers and the usual (no-foam) shampoos and soaps. The pool is OK, if a little small, and has sufficient loungers to acommodate the guests.
