The common areas of the hotel are very grubby; the windows could do with a good clean and the bannisters need a serious paint job. The courtesy bus provides a good service but it is important to book both way transit in advance as key times get booked up quite quickly. It takes about 10 mins to get into town by this method and the driver will hand you a heap of coupons ("tips welcome" as in most places!) All in all I'd avoid this place if I possibly could; I certainly would not stay at a Sheraton again as I think it's proved to be one grubby experience from start to finish. But, as for all places; horses for courses.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: 1floridatraveler
Reviews.Content: I had spent a considerable amount of time trying to find the right place to stay for this vacation and thought I had found an ideal place. While I admit the staff was very cordial and pleasant, the room we had was no where near the 200.00 spent each night. After being moved to a second room, I still was very disappointed with the cleanliness and upkeep of the facility. Carpet stains, mold and furniture that wouldn't be found in a Goodwill store seemed to be acceptable in a Sheraton. IF I had wanted an Econolodge room (my apologies to Econolodge), I certainly could have done it for much less than 200.00 per night. Seems the name Sheraton no longer means high standards in the lodging business.

Reviews.Title: “Cast a dark shadow on a sunny vacation.”
Reviews.Author: tinar99
Reviews.Content: Thought we called a couple weeks in advance about an early check in (1 hr) the room was not ready so we had to wait. Finally a room was ready and they gave us card keys, only to find when we opened the door the previous guests had not checked out yet!! They offered us an upgraded room but we would have to wait for it. Since we were already waiting we accepted. We were hot and tired from traveling all day and two hrs after we get to the hotel we still had no room. Finally I asked again and things got heated with one of the ladies behind the desk. She said it was our own fault we had to wait so long because we accepted an upgraded room. So, they screw up our check in, offer compensation, we accept, then they punish us for accepting. Later in the week I spoke to other guests and apparently it isn't uncommon to have to wait for a room there, regardless of reservations. The suite had maintenance issues. It was infested with little bugs crawling on the sink, table and walls. You couldn't leave food out because the bugs would come. There were even bugs in the coffee maker. The carpet and curtains were badly stained. The spare blanket had not been laundered after the previous guests, and had been shoved into a plastic bag in the closet. Some of the staff was pleasant and others were downright confrontational. All of the bartenders at the pool were nice and the concierge ladies were pleasant and very helpful. The pool and grounds were nice. Key West is too much fun to have to deal with hotel issues.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Suite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tippi2U
Reviews.Content: Great hotel suite, quiet, updated and modern. Fabulous hotel staff. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a horrible beach”
Reviews.Author: Toni3452
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at Sheraton Suites after a difficult task to choose the appropriate hotel in Key West. As usual, Trip advisor helps a lot to finally decide, based on all the recent reviews. Pros: a) Building: Very nice hotel, Caribbean style, well structured with huge rooms, b) Location: If you want to stay away of Duval Street, al least at sleeping time, this is your hotel. Despite being close to the airport, we didn't hear anything and c) the pool: Quite big, excellent water temperature, good atmosphere and a pool bar that really works. Cons: a) Smathers Beach: One of the reasons why we chose this hotel was its proximity to the "... unique real beach in Key West.." Unfortunately, I can say it's one of the worst beaches I've ever stayed. Bad smell, seaweeds stuffed and the tiny areas of sand were like shifting sands. In one word: Horrible. We stayed the whole day in the pool, b) Front Desk: Thanks to other reviews, I've noticed I'm not the only one to percieve a certain rudeness in many of the Front Desk officers, including its Head. In my personal experience, I had a minor incident with her, due to the fact I was awaiting my laundry bag in my room (available at 18,00 h.). At 21,00 h. I went down and realized that it was still there in reception. When I asked her if she had checked that all the laundry was there, she answered me that it was my duty to check that ??? Well, I think we can all have bad days, can't we ? and c) Breakfast is OK. Small buffet but good quality. The problem comes with the famous "vouchers" for 2 people. What is the real sense for this ? One of our friends' family had a problem with them, as one of the members of the family had breakfast before the other 3 and "forgot" to inform the waitress about this fact. Later on, they had problems in the check-out as the hotel tried to charge an extra breakfast. The simpler, the easier. In any case, this is a real good hotel, not too expensive, in a reasonable distance to Duval Street, but with a horrible beach in front.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: weets
Reviews.Content: Stayed here July 2008. This is a great hotel. It is well laid out and spacious and the rooms are huge - seperate bedroom with 2 doubles, shower and seperate sink area. Ther are two large TV's and a small area with microwave, coffee maker and fridge. Ther main area has alarge sofa as well. Ac works well! We found the room comfortable and clean. The staff were friendly and accommodating. Breakfast is usual buffet - not a huge choice but good quality. Pool area and hotel grounds are nice - well kept, clean pool with plenty of chairs etc and the grounds are immaculate - hotel is of wood construction, the landings mainly face onto the gardens - a nice view when opening your door in a morning. The hotel is across from Smather's brach but way out of town - depends what you want. The hotel runs a free bus into town through the day but you must book at the hotels gift shop. Burt, the driver we had was a gem - took us past lots of things on the way back and expalined as much as he knew. Overall, for Â£100 a night we thought this was a great value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “So So Sheraton Suites”
Reviews.Author: justalittlecrazykc
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel in the past couple of years. The rooms were MUCH improved over our last stay - including a completely redesigned bathroom. Better looking, less functional. (On our last stay the rooms had jetted tubs but these have now been replaced by showers.) For any KW first timers, this hotel is across from a beach (save yourself and drive a few miles off the island to Bahia Honda for a great beach) and across town from most places you'll probably want to visit. They offer a shuttle - but on this visit, they required you to register for the shuttle IN PERSON at their gift shop. It's little service things like that that make this hotel just so-so in my mind. Otherwise, it's a decent choice in Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Most in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Lee5608
Reviews.Content: The family and I were in Key West for four days and stayed at the Sheraton Suites Key West and were pleasantly surprised at the hotel and its amenities. The rooms are a good size, the bathroom is enormous (a little lite on the towels) but a great room overall. The front desk was attentive and pleasant, the bar by the pool had reasonable prices for Happy Hour drinks the pool was small, but was certainly large enough for the two dozen people that used it when we were in it and they have a mini spa with a masseuse located by the pool. For a small fee you can get just about any service a full-size spa offers. I thought this hotel was an exceptional value for the price, located in a quiet area just across from a beach, away from the maddening crowd of Duval Street, but not so far to be away from it. To top things off, we left a photo CD in our room when we left and the staff went out of their way to find it and send it to us in New Jersey. There may be nicer hotels, fancier, but your going to pay big bucks. This hotel is worth the price and leaves you some for other activities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: theconradz
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Suites provided us with a great stay during our recent week in Key West. The hotel is located on Smathers Beach, which is outside of downtown and near the airport, so you need transportation to get around (more on that later.) The hotel is Caribbean style with a pool, bar, restaurant, gift shop, workout room, laundry room, free parking and nice grounds. The rooms are very spacious with a bedroom, living area (pull-out sofa bed), kitchenette, and large bathroom area. Plenty of storage for clothes. Beds are very comfortable. Free Starbucks coffee and Free Internet was also a plus. Beach towel service was nice too. We selected the Sheraton over the Westin (loyal Starwood property customers) because of the larger rooms for the money. We have two tweens and the extra space was wonderful. The kitchenette allowed us to keep enough staples, so we weren't nickled and dimed by snacks and drinks. When we checked out, I was pleased with the final bill as the only extra charges were the in-room movies we watched and the one dinner we had. Great value for the money at this hotel! Service at the hotel was good - not outstanding but good. Being a Starwood Gold Member, they upgraded us to an Ocean View room, which was a nice perk. The staff were helpful with all requests. Housekeeping did a good job. Over seven nights, we only had to call for replacement items a few times and they took care of the requests very fast. The Concierge was wonderful. The ladies there were able to book our excursions, make good recommendations, and give us good coupons for attractions and restaurants. Transportation... The hotel has a shuttle that runs hourly to downtown - must sign up for a space early. The shuttle will also take you other places, if it is available. When we arrived at the airport, we called and the shuttle came and picked us up fast, so that was nice. Eventhough we heard a car can be more trouble than it is worth in Key West, we decided to rent a convertable (Tropical Rentals on Duval) and I am glad we did. We could get downtown, to the excursions, reataurants, and to the grocery store very easily - and parking was always available. We also took a day trip to Marathon and made several stops along the way - Bahia Honda State Park, a waterside restaurant in Marathon, and Boondocks Bar and Mini-Golf (my kids will always find a mini-golf place and this one was certainly in the bookdocks at milemarker 27! Great food and cool tiki-style open-air building.) Sheraton was a great value for the money and I would certainly stay there again if we are in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Service Dirty Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: sunsetandsprits
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the worst hotel I ever stayed at. The service was just as awful. The people at the front desk were so rude, that should have been my first sign that something was not right. The property is very dated and needs a major overhaul. I traveled with 3 other couples and all of our rooms were dirty. There were huge stains on the carpet, stains on the coverlet on the bed (I can only image what kind of stain it was), stains on the furniture and you have to call on a daily basis to get the things you need from housekeeping such as toilet paper! I canâ€™t believe they are a Sheridan property and they should be put on some kind of probation.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: boei58
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Hilton in Key Largo for 2 nights, which was like staying at the Hotel from "The Shinning", the Sheraton Suites was a much welcomed change. Shelly at the pool bar was great and offered alot of tips for 1st time Key Wester's. Suite was roomy and bathroom was recently upgraded. The pool is nice and if you pay attention it has a resident iguana which strolls out around noon spends the afternoon in one of the bushes and strolls back around 4:00. He liked being fed the flowers from the bush. Restauarunt is adequate. Parking is free, and they do have a shuttle which will take you downtown, the only thing is you need to make reservations ahead of time for both trips down and back. If you are leaning towards this location because of the beach across the street, beware the beaches is Key West aren't that great, and this one has a bit of a foul smell which we sometimes could smell at night while sitting on our balcony. Overall it was a clean place worthy of the cost and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay...as always”
Reviews.Author: outofthebiz
Reviews.Content: I try to get down to Key West a few times a year and as far as I'm concerned the Sheraton is the best place to stay. The staff always takes great care of my group. I prefer being away from Duval but yet only a shuttle ride away. The rooms are in great shape and the showers are awesome. I highly recommend the Sheraton for families looking to be off Duval and near the beach (don't go to the Keys for the beaches though!!! stick to the mainland...east coast for surfing, west coast for shells and relaxing). It's nice and convenient to the airport as well.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: true_sassyness
Reviews.Content: This was a clean and an excellent place to stay. It is right across the street from the beach and just minutes from Duval Street where all the action is located. Although, the beach directly across the street is not the best in Key West. The hotel is still a great spot.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: titanfan1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here June 13-14. The hotel is nicely decorated with the brightly painted buildings, the pool waterfall, and all the tropical plants. The grounds were kept very clean. They have a shuttle bus that leaves every hour to take you to town. The last pickup is 10:50PM so if you want stay late on Duvall St. you'll have to take a cab. The beds were comfortable and the rooms clean. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, but more attention to detail needed”
Reviews.Author: TheYellowDart
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying here. This time, we stayed here for eight nights. You canâ€™t beat the size of the rooms, location (directly across from the nicest beach on the island), and the reasonable (for Key West, with a discount) rates. The Sheraton is located far from downtown, so this may be a positive or negative depending on the kind of vacation you are looking for. We give this hotel a moderate rating for the following reasons: 1. Housekeeping was sporadic at best. We would frequently see room service trays and other service items left in our hallway for more than 24 hours. It may sound like a nit pick, but the provided bath products were of a low quality. 2. There is one tiny â€œclosetâ€� inside the sink area to hang up your clothes. Given the size of the room, thatâ€™s a pretty small space. We ended up living out of our suitcases. 3. The free shuttle bus to downtown now requires tickets to be reserved in advance. Reservations for the desirable times are often unavailable as there are usually only 16 seats available for the shuttle. 4. The business center consists of two terminals and printers located at the end of the bar in the hotel restaurant. The internet is free, but often there was always a wait to use them. Those using them seemed oblivious to those waiting to quickly check their email. The printers were also free, but had â€œOut of Orderâ€� signs posted on them from our second night forward and were still broken when we departed 6 days later (so much for printing out our boarding passes). 5. If you are fishing in Key West and are looking forward to the restaurant preparing your catch (a very common thing in Key West), do not even think of asking the over-priced and always-empty hotel restaurant. 6. The rooms have two televisions (one flat screen and one tube) but both of them are locked and unable to accept any external input from a camcorder or DVD player. Leave your Playstation or Xbox at home. 7. The hotel is also located next to some kind of preserve area. Depending on the direction of the wind (or the lack of it) there is sometimes a strong methane odor in and around the outside of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent Ernest Miller H. place”
Reviews.Author: fabio-70
Reviews.Content: A huge room, with delicate shade of blue and white, welcomed me with an air conditioned freshness really gorgeus after a hot and long travel from Chicago. Clean. Two (!) tv, one was a brand new 32'' LCD, a large couch with dormeuse, kitchen with mwo, refrig. and all you need. Perfect bathroom. Back in the hot sun, you can go straight to the hotel little but useful pool, with a secondary idromassage round pool on the backyard of a small fall. Great, and if you want a drink, the bar is here, with sometimes singers filling the silence. The beach is there, just crossing the street. Even if you don't like oo much this wonderful sea, there are shuttles to/from the KW airport a to/from downtown (only from 8 to 11pm: if you plan to stay longer better rent a bike, the Sheraton concierge is open daily from 9, few dollars and the traffic on the island... doesn't exist). People at front desk was special, and the girls were pretty too! What else? Unluckly, Hemingway... has not stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!! Our New Spot In Key West.”
Reviews.Author: Judy958
Reviews.Content: I've been to Key West dozens of times, and usually stay at the Best Western Hibiscus right off Duval. Now I can say there isn't anywhere else I'd call home besides Sheraton Suites. First great feature...Location. Directly across from Smathers Beach, all you need to do is walk across the parking lot and there you are! Great spot! The building itself is charming, with yellow siding, white trim, and blue shutters. Building definitely reflects Key West's personality. Great feature is that the halls are only one room deep...We had an end unit, which meant we only shared one wall with another suite. Great for Privacy. Interior hallways are nice too, with elevator options through the lobby or directly from the parking lot. Hotel offers a great shuttle service, running throughout day and night, which is super convenient. Lobby and grounds were clean and very well kept. Nice landscaping, great dog walking area, shady, grassy, great. Entire place felt very small, in the good way. Pool area was clean and not at all crowded. Plenty of chairs and towel service, as well as $2/min massage available poolside. Pool bar and full service restaurant with Happy Hour. Pool had a beautiful waterfall and was lit up gorgeous at night. Secluded, although small, spa area. Too many bugs in water to enjoy though. Dottie in Concierge was very helpful, although kinda crazy. We booked a snorkel trip with Floridays and had a Great time, despite rocky waters. Room was a suite with two doubles. Many fantastic features. Granite and cherry wood throughout kitchenette and baths. Separate living room area with sectional pull out couch, plantation shutters, living room television. Private sleep area behind sliding wooden doors, with poolside view. We had four adults and a dog staying, so it was great to have privacy between the areas. Another nice feature was the bathroom setup. Private bathroom with toilet and shower, opens into roomy area with sink and California closets. You could totally close this off from either the bedroom or the living area, which was great. Also, it meant the girls could get ready while the guys showered,with plenty of privacy for everyone. A few complaints...We stayed in a pet friendly room, and there were obviously two old urine stains on carpet that they Definitely hadn't been even attempted to clean. A little more attention to detail would have been nice...a few scuff marks on walls, just a couple items that could have been addressed to make the place Spectacular. But all in all, we could NOT have been more pleased. The whole place was bright, cheerful, true to Key West, reasonably priced, great location, clean, Super helpful and friendly staff, housekeeping pleasant...No real complaints at all. I will stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful oceanfront hotel”
Reviews.Author: psmith27
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights and had a very nice time. The room was very large, quite adequate for myself, husband and teen son. The kingsize bed in the bedroom was very comfortable. The sofa was a pullout with an extension to the side that you could sit or lie on (or use as an extra bed for a small one) when the sofa was opened up which was quite nice. The A/C worked well. Bathroom was very large with fully tiled shower big enough for two. Only two things that need repair in the bath...the porcelain handle on the toilet was cracked when we arrived and by the time we left it had broken off. Also the floor outside the shower was always wet as the grout under the frame was gone. We will let the hotel know about this. Large balcony overlooked the ocean, had 2 comfortable chairs and a small cocktail table. The coffee maker was the worst I have ever seen in a hotel. It was a one-cup model that you put premeasured pouches in. Altho it was Starbucks coffee that was provided free of charge, the coffee was too weak and tasted terrible. Maid service was fine but they only came in 2 times in the 5 days we were there. We left the room for 3 hours and came back and still nobody had come. We asked them for some towels and put the trash out in the hallway for pickup. The pool was very nice with a 6 foot deep end. Not very safe for small children as it had no baby pool, the hot tub was great. Plenty of towels poolside. Very nice bar area overlooking the pool with afternoon live entertainment daily. Laundry room was a hike but close to the pool so we went there while the clothes were washing. $2.00 for wash, $2.00 for 45 min. dry time. We ate at the breakfast buffet twice, some said it was pricey but for $15/pp you can eat your big breakfast and still be full and skip lunch so to us it was a good deal. The grounds were kept beautifully. Free hourly shuttle service to town, free shuttle to airport. Overall, a very nice hotel even tho the exterior could use a few cosmetic upgrades.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: djwd4z
Reviews.Content: Visited Key West on April 9 and 10th, 2008. Great Location with the Smatheres Beach right across the street. Hotel was ready for us with early check in. Very nice room. Looked very new. 3 of us fit comfortably. The grounds were landscaped beautifuly and everyone there was very nice and polite. Will definetly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Reasonable Rates!”
Reviews.Author: YoursVeryTruly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Sheraton Suites for four nights in April and we had a very good experience. We got a lovely, spotless 3rd floor room with a balcony for $206.00 per night using our AAA discount. This two room suite had a mini-kitchen with decent sized table, two TVs, and huge marble bath with lots of drawers and cabinets. It could easily accommodate a family of four or five. The room was cheerfully decorated in shades of yellow and blue, with plenty of sunlight from white shuttered window and big sliding glass door.The property is well-maintained, and enhanced by lush tropical landscaping. It is true that the pool is somewhat smaller than average, but it is lovely, perfect temperature,with a waterfall and was never crowded or noisy during our stay. There is a cute outdoor bar serving just OK food and, (if Shelley is bartending,) outstanding banana daiquiris! She was the nicest of several very helpful staff we encountered,including an efficient concierge and a sympathetic front desk clerk who kindly extended our check-out until 2pm when I was not feeling well. My one concern when I booked this hotel was whether it's location in a quiet area several miles from Duval St. and Mallory Square would be a problem since we did not rent a car, but it really was not. We took the shuttle in (we only had to stand one time). We generally took taxis back to the hotel or when we went to the wonderful Louie's Backyard. This small added cost was well worth it considering the hundreds of dollars per night we were saving compared to downtown hotels such as the Ocean Key or the Westin, both of which I checked out while we were there; they were nice, but, in my opinion, not worth the extra money.

Reviews.Title: “Not great with kids”
Reviews.Author: kms37
Reviews.Content: My husband, three kids and I went to Key West for one week. We had never been before and wanted to go somewhere "tropical" without leaving the country. We had an "ok" time. Let me start by saying we are not hard to please...but found that the area was very overpriced and a bit run down. We stayed at the Sheraton Suites. The room was nice and big, updated inside however on the outside the hotel was lacking. Seemed a bit rundown. The pool area was a lot smaller than it seemed in the hotel photos online. The hot tub was broke for about three out of our five day trip. Best thing was the conceriege. She was great! Was very knowledgeable about all the excursions. Across from the hotel was a public beach....beware it is 30.00 for two chaises and a umbrella. Sandy area is small and no waves, however beach was quiet and relaxing, we enjoyed it. We did the Ultimate Adventure boating, which included snorkling, jet skiing, water trampoling, parasailing. It costs around 600.00 for a family of five and included breakfast and lunch. At reservations they were not very organized and we were sent to 2 different locations before we could check in for our trip. They couldn't find our reservation, so they had to re enter it which took a while. Even though I had a receipt which included a deposit. Duval street is probably great if you are there to party but with three kids in tow we didn't get much out of it. We ate at The Grande @ Key West which was very upscale but the staff seemed very snobby. Cheesburgers in Paradise was horrible, don't bother wasting your money, There was also a seafood buffett that we ate at on Duval not great. We did eat at one Italian restaurant of off Duval which was great! Best meal while we were their. All in all, I don't think Key West is geared towards families more for singles, couples. Would we go back? No, it was an "ok" vacation. Spent 6k between the airfair/hotel/food/beach/excursion. If you have a large family my advice would be to stick to the all inclusives.

Reviews.Title: “Great For Family Getaway”
Reviews.Author: NCBeachBumRaleigh_NC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had been to KYW twice before with another couple and rented a condo both times. This time we took our two teenage daughters and only needed one room and chose a hotel. The area where we had stayed before, we liked, so we picked the Shearton for that reason. What a great choice! The room was clean, spacious, and quiet. The room is more than I would normally pay, but in line with other KYW rates, plus it was a Suite. I loved the internet access in the restaurant area with printer attached to print out directions, boarding passes, etc. The health club was adequate and clean. The food/drinks at pool were good, but pricey...Pina Colada $9.25/12oz glass. We had a car so we did not use Shuttle service, but like the access to one with the downtown parking problem plus pricey parking rates. My wife loved the Starbucks in the room. Bedroom TV was a LCD flat screen and additional regular TV in sitting area was a nice-plus with teeenagers. L-Shape couch folds out to bed as well. Highly recommend property...

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: NycNyctraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really terrific. We had a wonderful room (370) which was clean and well kept EXCEPT the bed. It is very much in need of replacement. The staff was terrific. The restaurant was not good for dinner. The pool is clean but small. Looking for places to eat dinner try Louie's Back Yar, Cafe Sole and La-Te-Da. La Trattoria Veneia was terrible. Flaming Crossing has the best ice cream we have tasted ever!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Midwesternmember
Reviews.Content: I have nothing bad to say about this hotel. Grounds were nice, rooms were big, pool was nice, lounge was nice, complimentary cookies and juice, free shuttle to Duval St., staff was friendly and gave us an upgraded room. Restaurant and drinks were a little pricey. For a price, they do allow small pets. Beach across the street was busy but nice. Would stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Vacation”
Reviews.Author: RealLadyBug
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the Sheraton. We picked this spot because it is on the quieter side of Key West. There is a beach right across the street. The street is a 4 lane road, and at times can get pretty busy. The rooms here are very nice and clean. The rooms are pretty big, and they really are suites with doors that close between the bedroom and the living room/kitchen area. There is a fridge in the kitchen area. There is a coffee maker in the kitchen area. The coffee maker brews one cup at a time, and you get three packets of coffee each day â€“ 2 regular and 1 decaf. There are not a lot of breakfast options. The first day we bought coffee from the coffee bar â€“ we wanted some sort of breakfast pastry too, but there didnâ€™t seem to be any available â€“ we didnâ€™t see any, and the person who poured our coffee for us was also waiting on tables in the restaurant, so he was pretty busy. The two cups of coffee were $7 â€“ so I suggest making the coffee in your room, since there is no extra charge. The bathroom is marble with a pretty big shower. There is a safe in the bathroom. The bathroom products are of good quality, and our housekeeper left two bottles of everything for us to ensure that we would not run out. There is a door tag that you can fill out to select the time the housekeeping staff cleans your room. Unfortunately we didnâ€™t see this until the day we were checking out. The pool area is small for the size of the hotel. Iâ€™m guessing that people generally go to the beach, but while we were there the wind was very strong and causing a sand storm, so I think that is why the pool was so crowded. We took the free shuttle into town each day. It is about a 10 minute ride. While we were there the shuttle was picking up at the hotel at 30 minutes past each hour from 9:30 in the morning until 10:30 at night. The shuttle would pick up in town at 50 minutes past each hour from 9:50 in the morning until 10:50 at night. There was only one time where there were too many passengers for the bus that we encountered. I think the bus driver ended up making an extra run â€“ but I am not sure, since I was able to get on the bus before it was full.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Stay at the Shearton Keys”
Reviews.Author: DCSacramento
Reviews.Content: After reading the mixed reviews of this hotel I was somewhat hesitant to book a free room using my Starwood points. However what a night surprise. I arrived early at noon, thinking that it would be less than 50/50 to have a room ready. To my surprise they not only accomodated me but gave me a nice room on the second floor with a good view of a courtyard. Had I arrived later they said as a preferred member I would have received a partial or full ocean view. The room was huge with nice furtniture and linens. With regard to the lady who thought the place had fleas I would be stunned if it did. The room was spotless The bathroom was so large , with two separate entrances that we took several pictures of it. All of the front reservations staff were very nice. Unfortunately we could not get the attention of the concierge who was always on the phone while a line formed. The free shuttle to downtown with a polite driver was also a plus. Sleeping was a dream and the room was very quiet. The full kitchen was also a nice plus and the extra Starbucks coffee. The bar area is nice but the food is overpriced based on what you get. Overall a very relaxing and nice play to stay.

Reviews.Title: “romantic anniversary”
Reviews.Author: deesbees
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 50th wedding anniversary at the Sheraton staying for five glorious days. The staff were excellent, friendly, and accomadat ing. They surprised us with balloons and a dessert tray our first night. Who says romance dies with age? Wrong. They upgraded ouir suite to poolside. It was spacious with a balcony. Staff tuned down the bed at night and kept the room tidy replacing bath linens. The shut tle ran on time to go to town and the drivers were friendly giving a his tory of K.W. We only ate breakfast there but the staff were available poolside to take orders during the day. We will definitely return. A very memorable visit.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: maryjga
Reviews.Content: Nice base for Key West exploration. Our family of 5 was comfortable - when booking your room, be sure to ask about a balcony. Our 2nd floor room overlooked the pool but was unfortunately just over the bar - we had roof below our window and no balcony. The beach is a quick walk across the street. We watched the 4th of July fireworks from the beach - awesome! One negative - the bar has a happy hour and more than once, patrons became drunk enough to make me leave the area with our younger daughters.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaMinnesota
Reviews.Content: We went to Key West for our anniversary, the trip started out pretty rocky, due to bad weather, plane delays, etc. Once we checked in at the Sheraton all the bad faded, the staff was wonderful and very helpful, the rooms are huge and I loved their shampoo, conditioner and lotion. They have a free shuttle to Duval Street which was great and a restaurant on the premises, which is a little expensive. There is a very nice pool area and it's right across the street from the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: beachbumSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this Sheraton Hotel was the worse we have ever experienced. The rooms were overpriced, The staff was inexperienced both at the front desk and in the dining room and the hotel equipment was antiquated. If you wanted to use your AAA discount, the hotel staff did not register you at the hotel desk, but required you to go to their coffee bar and register online. This process took a great deal of time and was not reliable. The rooms were adequate and clean, but missing all linens needed for the sofa sleeper and they did not provide enough towels for guests. The restaurant food and service was horrible, especially at dinner and the room service menu did not properly reflect what was available from the dining room. We requested and were granted a one hour late check out time on the day of our departure, but we were locked out of our room (our key was invalidated by the hotel) before the regular check out time. When we tried to have a staff member let us in to obtain our luggage and leave the premises it took over 20 minutes. The hotel offered courtesy orange juice at the front desk, but never had cups for juice. The hotel stated they had a Starbucks Coffee Bar, but never had it staffed while we stayed there. I waited over 15 minutes and no one ever acknowledged me for any coffee service. I ordered coffee when I was seated for breakfast at the restaurant before receiving a menu and I was charged $8.00 for coffee. The only good thing we encountered while staying at this hotel was the pool area restaurant staff. This person was professional, efficient and personable. A real shining star. There is a beautiful beach directly across the street from this facility, but there are other hotels to choose from at this location.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: FloridaFan53
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed two nights at this wonderful hotel. Everything was excellent. A large suite, with leather covered sofa, two TVs (on CRT and one LCD flat screen), small "kitchenette" corner with microwave, large refrigerator and coffee machine. Separat bathroom and toilet/shower. Not to mention the friendly and comfortable shuttle service from the hotel to down town key west (directly to Mallory square). Finally the beach just across the A1A was large and clean. We can truely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Has FLEAS!!!”
Reviews.Author: smileybug
Reviews.Content: Normally, Starwood hotels are known for their quality. Upon arrival, we were really happy with our room. It LOOKED clean, there was a microwave and fridge, and free wifi. However, after the 1st night, we were bitten by SO MANY FLEAS that my fiancee counted a total of 60 bites from head to toe on himself and 45 on myself. It was the worst experience ever. He complained to the front desk after the first night and no action was taken. The second night in the same room was EVEN WORSE. The fleas had a party on our bodies because in the morning, he had 30 more bites and I had 12 more bites. I complained again and we were moved to a "starwood preferred guest room" (which when we inspected the room was no different, except this time it was CLEAN and we received 2 free bottles of water daily). The management there is TERRIBLE. We were on our way to an excursion that was booked with the help of the hotel concierge and told that if we did not return by 5 p.m. to move our luggage we would have to stay in that room AGAIN. Why couldn't they move our luggage? When I complained at the front desk after the 2nd night about the fleas, there were no apologizes, but rather the front desk person said "eww". Where were the "i'm sorry the room wasn't clean"?! I am furious with Sheraton Suites Key West as they did not provide a hygenic room, imposed strict timelines and conditions for us to move rooms at no fault of ours, and did not compensate us in any way for this terrible terrible room and treatment. I will never stay at this place again and will be writing a letter to corporate and depending on their response, may possibly never stay at a starwood property again. The benefits of the hotel is: 1.) free wifi 2.) provides a shuttle to downtown where all the attractions and restaurants are. However, i noticed that marriott down the street also provides the same service. So perhaps you should consider them. They are probably cheaper, and if the room has fleas, maybe they'll do something about it. 3.) pretty nice pool. The disadvantages? Just read above. It was terrible; I'm not kidding. No one should pay approximately $350 a night in a flea infested room and not be compensated.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: romneysmith
Reviews.Content: We were only here for one night but we definetly would return. The rooms for very spacious and it was convient to have a frig and microwave in the room. I'm not sure if all rooms were set up the same as ours with a queen bed and sofa with attached chaise,but it was roomy enough to sleep 5 of us comfortablly. The staff was very nice and eager to please, when we called for extra blankets they were quick in accomodating us. The shuttle to downtown was a real plus so we didn't have to worry about parking downtown or drinking and driving. The beach across the street was beautiful as well as the pool. We would highly recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for relaxation”
Reviews.Author: sykesy116
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Suites in Key West from December 5-8, 2007. The hotel grounds and suite were very clean and nice. Our suite was large and the turn-down service, LCD TV, and two-person marble shower was a great addition. The room could have used some maintenance on both the shutters and bathroom hooks, however. Hotel staff was friendly and efficient and the hotel has all the amenities you need - pool and hot tub with lounge chairs and towel service, bar with live entertainment on weekends, full-service restaurant (beware: breakfast can be more expensive than dinner there) and gift shop. The concierge was helpful, although a bit too bubbly and pushy with the packages for our taste. The hotel is located across the street from a nice beach (Smathers), but is several miles from any other attractions. The Sheraton does provide a free shuttle service to Mallory Square, but is only runs once an hour and was too full to get on several times during our stay. We'd recommend the hotel run this service each half hour instead of each hour. An airport shuttle service would also be helpful, as it was $15 (including tip) each way for a very short taxi ride. Another disappointment in the shuttle service is that it only runs from 10-10 so any early morning tours or nightlife require a cab. With all of that said, we would recommend a stay at the Sheraton Suites, especially if you are there to relax and don't care to be close to the nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad but No So Good Either”
Reviews.Author: Dp60
Reviews.Content: Sheraton key west, is a very quite property, and maybe because in key west does not appear to be belonging sheraton hotel's chain. the property imself is well appointed, room/suites are very comfortable and full equipped of all you needs, bed are excellent like all other from the chain, also the staff of the the reception are high standard and well trained, however if i will return to key west maybe I will stay somewherelse, the hotel i located faaraway from the main key west attractions, they supply a transfer bus to/from city centre but if you missed the bus for 1 minute you need to wait an hour before the next one, also the last transfer available in the night is at 10.30 pm, this is the time that lives starts in key west, restaurant is average with very limited choices of dishes, also the pool is very small and located inside of a courtyard and very soon you will be covered of palm's shadows and you need to mouve continously if you want to stay under the sun. Services and facilities are not as well as many other sheratons worldwide, look to be more like 3 stars hotel moderate than what ususally sheraton are like 4 or 5 stars, if you're not interested of night life is good choice, otherwise for the same room rate you can have it good quality of room near the centre, without to be obliged to catch a taxi every time you need to go to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: lmalf
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice! It has been amazing each time! The service is so nice and its so clean! The rooms are amazing and huge! The little gift shop is so cute and has great things to take home to the family. It has a great location right next to the beach and i loved having the bus that takes you into town! I would def. stay there again. Also, it has a gorgeous pool! Love it!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific place!”
Reviews.Author: Qestia
Reviews.Content: In my opinion, the Sheraton is the best place to stay in Key West, especially if you have a kid. First of all, it's directly across from a fantastic beach (Smather's beach). Secondly, there's a terrific pool and hot tub. Plus, all the rooms are suites (but reasonably priced) so you can easily dine in your room. And watch a movie in the living area after you put your child to sleep in the sleeping area. Finally, you can sign up for all sorts of activities--like renting a bike, cheaply and easily in the hotel lobby (bike rental cost $10 for four hours and was right outside the front door). We liked being away from the party scene on Duval street, but it was only about a five minute drive from the hotel. ( And the hotel offers a free shuttle). The rooms were spacious and clean, and the staff was friendly. Thank, Sheraton!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: monalicia
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a quiet place close to the beach, this is the hotel for you. It's literally across the street from the beach, close to the airport & on the other side of the island from downtown. The distance was not a problem for us -- we'd rather be by the beach. Shuttles run from 10 to 10 & taxis are about $12 one way downtown. You can also walk downtown (we did one day -- wear comfortable shoes), or rent bikes or scooters. The rooms were clean & comfortable and the staff was very pleasant. We would definitely stay here again. Use the hotel concierge to book tours, and if you go to Dry Tortugas, take the Yankee Freedom. It costs a bit more than the Fast Cat, but they both take up to 100 people and the YF is much bigger! You will appreciate being able to walk around outside, especially if the waves get to be too much. Take Dramamine -- even if you think you won't get sick.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and confortable Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: GreatDaneDanmark
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Suites for a couple of days while on a vacation in Florida. Check in was very swift and efficient , the staff was friendly ( think they were either russian or polish) and our room was huge and spotless clean , with very confortable beds and a nice view. There was plenty of place to park our car when we arrived , and the hotel's pool & Spa was nice ... not too big , but then again, it was not so crowded while we were there ( see pictures & video ) We had twice a buffet breakfast , a bit expensive , but it was damn good. We liked the bar facing the pool , it was really cool and relaxing to have a couple of drinks there while listening to live music late in the afternoon . The coffee machine in our room was defect , but it was quickly replaced with a new one. The hotel is a bit far away from central Key West , but the complementary shuttle bus solved the problem , and the driver gave us loads of useful tips on our way to town. The wireless did not work in our room, but it worked in the area around the reception. Smathers Beach is just across the road from the hotel , but we prefered to go to Forth Zachary's Beach , which was better. All in all, we enjoyed our stay, and would have no problem in staying again at The Sheraton Suites .

Reviews.Title: “The UK Touring Family”
Reviews.Author: MDBV
Reviews.Content: My family and i stayed here for four nights at the start of june, we were only supposed to stop for a couple of days as we were sightseeing, touring Florida from Orlando which was our base. The sheraton looked really surreal from the car window as it conjured up thoughts of what we had imagined the Keys would be in our heads,swaying palms clear blue skies white endless sands excellent hotels courtious helpful and friendly staff. Yes it was all the above and more than we ever thought the hotel would be. Wandering through the grounds following the meandering pathway it lead to an oasis which we helped ourselves to along with a couple cocktails from the over looking bar terrace before returning to our room . The room was large enough for our family of four with the stunning views that we had asked for ,an ocean view. Clean and spotless and the room sevice second to none. Yes we had a great time and we cannot wait to return from our little spot of our green and pleasant land which we call our home in Ferrybridge, Yorkshire, England.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great service”
Reviews.Author: STARPLAT
Reviews.Content: I took my girlfriend here for a long weekend and to propose. The hotel was great, obviously, it wasn't a St Regis or even a Westin, but it was very nice, very functional and enjoyable. The food and services were VERY expensive... I thought they took care of us well even though we were staying on points for free.

Reviews.Title: “don't trust the weather man...”
Reviews.Author: TravelDIVA3
Reviews.Content: I have to say the room was good, the location is remote but this is how Key West is...I always was concerned not finding a parking spot... Staff was very nice. parking: got to get lucky pool: was tiny for a resort... return: no....sorry dissapointing.... good for day trip....don't waste your time for more than day plus....

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsMcGonagall
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sheraton as our travel agent upgraded us from Casa Marina, which was apparently under reconstruction. It was quite a pleasant stay, the room was very nice (but lacked a bit of cabinets for hanging clothes) and we liked the comforts to have a suite. Our room was quiet and clean, the kids got a kick out of having 2 tvs. They also loved the pool which has a little cascade that adds fun. Premises are tidy and well kept. We did not use the shuttle bus as we had the car, but it looked convenient. It takes 6 minutes to go downtown but from noon to midnight parking is not easy. I also figured that a hotel downtown must be pretty noisy at night, and we are no night people so this place was best for us. Having many side entrances is good when you load and download the car. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Sheraton Suites”
Reviews.Author: FloridaLove2Travel2
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel we were upgraded to an ocean view room. The view from the balcony of the beach was very nice. We were very pleased with the room. The coffee maker was only 4 cup which was a little inconvenient and there was no complimentary coffee that I was aware of at the hotel. Large enough for a family of five and the king size bed was very comfortable. Loved the flat screen TV's! The pool area and jacuzzi were excellent. We did not eat at the restaurant or bar...seemed a bit pricey but there are so many things to do and the hourly shuttle wisked us off to Duval Street everyday. The staff were friendly and helpful. Will definately stay at Sheraton Suites again.

Reviews.Title: “A Good TIme!”
Reviews.Author: elizagrace
Reviews.Content: The first half of our stay was terrific, the last 2 nights just ok. The hotel is very nice. Great pool area/bar/restaurant. Dottie the consierge was very attentive and helpful. Rooms - Our first room was a garden view in the back of the hotel, and it was really nice and clean. It did get crowded on the weekend, and we got not housekeeping one night even after requesting it twice. As a courtesy to us, (because it was my birthday), the front desk asked if we wanted to upgrade to an oceanfront room for our last 2 nights. It had the same layout as the other room, the view was great, but it the kitchen area was crawling with ants. Restaurant - Overpriced, especially for breakfast. The buffett is definitely not worth it as the food wasn't great. Lunch was better and the portions were huge. It was also nice that there was live entertainment on the weekend. Eat at Camille's - the best dinner I've had in awhile, and they're great with kids. Take the Floridays sailboat out to the reef to snorkel. I recommend bringing your own gear if you can. Jay and Sabrina were great! Do a sunset glassbottom boat tour. You'll learn and see a lot!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it!”
Reviews.Author: laurierocs
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our experience at the Sheraton. We arrived and got chocolate chip cookies and lemonade. Checked into our room which looked just like the one in the picture on their website. Our room was 333, we had a balcony and it was next to the elevator. We never once heard anyone in the hall, near the elevator or in the room next to ours. Very quiet. Our view was a distance of the pool, but didn't have to pay extra for it. Right below the balcony were the air conditioner units, so sitting on the balcony was hot and noisy. The food was great! We had the breakfast buffet twice, had lunch there several times. The pool was awesome, tiki bar expensive...same as any hotel. The entertainment at the tiki bar was very good on Sunday. The shuttle was very convenient, I wish they would add at least 2 more stops however. There only stop in Old town was in front of the Westin. The only I could complain about is the shower is all marble, I think they should have some kind of rubber mat...because it did get slippary! We were totally satisfied with Sheraton Inn and Suites!

Reviews.Title: “Great alternative to overpriced hotels on most of Key West”
Reviews.Author: Spaceman58
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent experience at this Sheraton Suites in Key West. Its quite a distance from all the action, but they do have an hourly shuttle van which is extremely convenient. Just 10 or 15 minutes into town. Use it and save on the outrageous parking fees. Our room was very clean and comfortable. Of course it had a living room, sleeper sofa, and a kitchen. There was a good-size flat screen TV, too. There is only a sliding, louvered door between the living room and the bedroom, so if you have a family, its not as private as other suite hotels can be. The rooms are a little on the small side, but how much time are you going to spend in your room when in Key West? The bed was exceptionally comfortable. They also had free WiFi, which was convenient. Elevators were out of service while we were there, so lugging our bags up the stairs was no fun. Also, skip the on-premise restaurant. Not good enough to justify the expensive items on the menu. This hotel is located right on the water, but the beach is not good. No surf and kinda dirty, but you can rent kayaks and other water equipment right there or get a parasail ride. We really enjoyed our stay. Most importantly, it was a good value compared to many other hotels on the island. When we return to Key West, this hotel will be high on our list of consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jjegj5k
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Sheraton Key Suites on our recent trip to Key West. We were very satisfied. The room was very clean and comfortable. There was plenty of space for our family of five. The location, across the street from Smather's Beach, was great. The pool at the hotel was very nice also. The hotel offered a shuttle to downtown Key West, but we never took it. We were able to drive ourselves and find plenty of street parking. We would definitely stay at the Sheraton Key Suites again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: meganm32
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Sheraton Suites, rooms was spacious, pool was great and the staff and service were excellent. The only drawback is not being in walking distance of town and having to take the shuttle. the first time I stayed in key west i stayed in old town and loved being able to walk everywhere and really get a feel for key west. but it's not too bad and i would def stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel...”
Reviews.Author: agnewton
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Sheraton with his mother and a few friends in April of 2006. We went for a long weekend and just fell in love with Key West. What a great place. The hotel is not bad, but it really depends on what you are looking for. We were there on points, so it was free, which makes a difference. Most of the hotels on the island during April are pretty pricey so be prepared to pay $300+ no matter the quality. I would probably recommend a guest house or B&B over this hotel, however it is RIGHT ACROSS FROM THE BEACH which made up for any short comings. As most people know, Key West isn't known for its beaches. Its know for good bars, good beer, fishing, good people watching etc. I LOVE KEY WEST, so I am biased, but next time we go back I would recommend The Mermaid and The Alligator, Marquesa, or Little Palm Island (if you are looking for a splurge and to go all out). The other hotels closer to Duval are nice as well (Hyatt, Ocean Key Resort, Southernmost Resort...all good options). For what it was, it wasn't that bad, considering the time of year and the beach across the street. If you go, rent a scooter (if you can). SO much fun! Go to the scooter stands owned by Brett. I dont remember the name but he picks you up from your hotel and is super nice (and easy on the eyes :-) Also, the shrimp from Conch Republic (not the Key West Pink shrimp but the others that taste like LOBSTER) are to die for. DONT MISS LOUIES BACKYARD. Even if its just for cocktails at sunset, you MUST go!!! And of course, Sloppy Joes, Hogs Breath, etc etc are musts as well. Feel free to email me about Key West. I love it, and if you are looking for a younger pespective (late 20's) I am more than willing to share...

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!! Would go back again...”
Reviews.Author: Blkrrb
Reviews.Content: What a great stay!! I have NEVER taken the time to write a review of a hotel but I feel when you find a â€œgreat findâ€�, you should share!! I am very particular about hotel rooms and our room was very nice, clean, with a beautiful bathroom, and it was extremely spacious. The beds were comfortable and my teenagersâ€™ didnâ€™t even complain about the sofa bed so it must have been comfy too! The pool was nice with ample shade umbrellas and the pool area was kept clean. The courtesy shuttle to downtown was very convenient. We did not dine in the restaurant but it looked very nice. The staff was not very friendly or helpful but we would definitely stay here again despite the staff.... in fact, we enjoyed our stay so much we are planning a trip back down just to stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: daniegracen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton and loved it. We had a wonderful experience with all of the staff. Our room was beautiful. The bed was soooooooo comfortable, The bathroom really clean and nice. The concierge helped us book trips of snorkeling, jet skiing, and more! I used the spa she recommended and had an amazing facial the morning after a long night of drinking! The hotel is located kind of far from all the action on Duval, but we used the shuttle everyday to go downtown and it is a cheap taxi ride back to the hotel at night. We loved to go down to the tiki bar by the pool and drink a few pina coladas and the service was always great. We would go back to this hotel in a heartbeat! We loved Key West!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: cocoboe
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in april 2007,first impressions are not always true in this case.The rooms were large and comfortable, and well equiped.The pool area wes beautiful with a lovely bar where you could drink a cold beer and watch your kids play in the pool,overall our experience of the hotel was lovely and worth the long drive down from Miami.woud recommend for families

Reviews.Title: “Loved Balcony Overlooking Pool”
Reviews.Author: Sallie_Fairfax
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came here to be tourists and relax. My husband had booked a room with a balcony overlooking the pool which was worth every penny. It was wonderful to look at the palm trees, look down at the pool and hear the waterfall. I'm not a great swimmer but couldn't resist going into the pool every day of our visit. The bathroom was huge and very convenient for 2 people. We made use of the inroom coffee and the refrigerator. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet and had it for the 4 mornings of our stay. It was great eating outside. The lunch/dinner menu was not very varied or exciting. We used the shuttle twice and found it very convenient and the drivers very knowledgeable. It is a very quiet, relaxing and lovely place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Comfortable Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: joeb1249
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Suites is a comfortable hotel with friendly staff. Although it is away from the busy tourist attractions, the hotel offers free hourly shuttle service to town. The suites are large and the bathroom has a six foot walk-in shower. There is a flat screen TV in the bedroom and a regular TV in the living room. The pool is large enough and seemed to be well maintained. All of the hotel staff were friendly, but our favorite person was Dottie the weekend concierge who helped us choose a snorkeling excursion and a kayak trip. She seemed to genuinely care that her guests pick just the right excursions. Before the trip, I had seen reviews that complained about late service by cleaning staff, but our room was promptly cleaned every morning before we left for the day's activities. The only down side was the limited menu in the hotel's only restaurant. Again, the staff were friendly and efficient, but how could a resort hotel have only four entrees on the menu? The breakfast buffet was a little pricey, but had good food, and it was more economical than ordering a la carte. Overall, it was a comfortable stay, and we would not hesitate to book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: salsrug
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a destination wedding. We had a great time. The roomrate was reasonable for the time of year and the room was spacious and clean. The front desk staff was very helpful and the pool area was nice. Even though it sits near the beach, my husband said the beach wasn't that great because of the broken coral. The bar food was very good but the drinks are a little expensive (but aren't all drinks in Key West!) It had a free shuttle that went downtown and ran until 10:00 pm and is very close to the Key West airport. Definitely would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “first impressions aren't everything”
Reviews.Author: hodum
Reviews.Content: Our stay to Key West was for the week of May 6th. Upon arrival we called for a shuttle that ended up taking 30 minutes to come get us from the airport, which is merely maybe a mile away. Once we got to the hotel, we were not amused by the major leak in the hotel lobby. Cleanup crew was on the scene and mopping away with a ladder dead center. After reading previous reviews, our stomach dropped. We arrived too early for a room to be ready, but were promised the first available. They held our bags for us and off we went to talk to the very bubbly, friendly concierge. Apparently she has been there some time and is extremely knowledgeable. While there she got a call from the front desk that a room was available by the pool, first floor. We were hesitant about first floor and pool and potential racket, but miss concierge assured us that we would like our room so we took it. Walking around the hotel to our room we found the outside looked weathered, but what do you expect in a sunny, salty air? We approached the room, opened the door with hesitation and from here on, out goes the first impression... Inside was a large suite met with marble-like floor. A beautifully updated bathroom (large at that). Around the corner a kings size bed with flat screen tv. Turn the corner again and a large comfy sofa and another flat screen? not that i planned on spending time in front of it, but nice touch. many people were at the pool, even kids and we couldn't hear a thing. In fact we would never know that there was a pool there had we not looked out the window. miss concierge was right, plus the 'first floor' is one level up to start with. As far as the rest of the stay, yes the hourly shuttle was nice and the drivers all key west historians you would think and very friendly. We never met a staff member we didn't like. Food was overpriced and a little bland in the hotel, but convenient and I probably expected that. We made the mistake of trying to walk everywhere the first couple of days, but good for exercise. think it is 2.5-3 miles to mallory square. But i think we almost saw the whole island. look forward to another visit someday and would definitely stay at the shreraton.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, but worn out and in need of updating.”
Reviews.Author: Springerhog
Reviews.Content: Donâ€™t say I didnâ€™t warn you, but Key West is a tourist trap. Everything is outrageously overpriced. But then again, itâ€™s Key West and the location, magnificent sunsets and lively atmosphere is what youâ€™re paying for. My wife and I stayed in Key West for two days (May 10th and 11th) during our motorcycle ride through Florida. If youâ€™re a motorcyclist, youâ€™ve got to make the journey down to Key West on a motorcycleâ€¦ itâ€™s absolutely incredible and the only way to travel down to Americaâ€™s most southern paradise. The seven-mile bridge along highway one was a blast to ride. As for the hotel, it wasâ€¦ nice. Overall, the room and bed were comfortable, but the entire property looked worn and in need of some updating. According to the shuttle driver for the hotel, the property was closed down for several months undergoing repairs after the last hurricane, which is very common for this particular area. I guess the property, along with all the other hotels frequently get damaged during hurricane season, which might explain the â€œweatheredâ€� look of the hotel. Although our room was nice, it wasnâ€™t perfect. The sofa in the living room was dirty and stained, but comfortable. The shower, toilet and bathroom areas were very clean and modern. The pool area was small, but well maintained. The staff was very friendly and professional, which was very much appreciated. The free hourly shuttle to town was a nice touch, but we ended up riding our Harley Davidson most of the time, which was actually more appropriate given Key Westâ€™s â€œhang looseâ€� atmosphere. Donâ€™t forget to visit the world renowned â€œSloppy Joeâ€™s Barâ€� and purchase a cheesy T-shirt as a souvenir. Oh, and donâ€™t forget to get your photograph with the famous mile marker. Lastly, if you get a chance to visit Key West and you donâ€™t take the time to enjoy watching a sunset or two, then youâ€™ve completely overlooked the primary reason to visit Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Quite pleased with my stay”
Reviews.Author: ual95
Reviews.Content: I was quite pleased with this hotel. Not near Duval and the noise and crowds. A beach right across the road. Nice size room. Free parking. This may be my new hotel of choice when I visit Key West! I had a "garden" view room, which in Conch Republic language must mean "roof with a/c units". The only negative was noise. The hallways, at least my hallway, was very "echoey". It was pretty loud when irresponsible parents let thier kids run up and down the hall, or the dopes that just HAVE to yak on a cell phone constantly would walk down the hall. Other than that the other noises of general hotel operation were not that bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Resort in Key West!!!!”
Reviews.Author: familyreviewz1
Reviews.Content: This is a great Family resort in Key West. It is perfect for larger families as the Suites are very spacious and offer a small morning kitchen and microwave . The suites also offer large plantation shutter doors that seperate the newly renovated siting and eating area from the "bedroom" . It makes it for a great fit for families with smaller children who nap or go to bed before older siblings. The pool area, while not elaborate is great again for families it is well enclosed . The gift shop and restaurant are reasonable. It is across the street from the beach, but as anyone knows key west is not known for its beaches. Our kids enjoyed the pool area . They loved the layout of the hotel, most rooms are breezeway entries with numerous courtyards with Hamocks and Garden swings, very kid friendly. It is close to duval street, but far enough way so that the kids are not in the middle of the hoopla there. The hotel also offers a shuttle to and from Mallroy square which has the Westin Hotel part of the same Starwood resorts. This is a great service as Mallrooy Square is much more kid friendly then Duval street, especially if you have children that can read. Highly reccomend the sunset celebration.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet & nice but a bit boring”
Reviews.Author: Curb_jumpers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided at the last minute to take a four-day weekend in Key West. I checked for lodging and found the only "nice" place available was the Sheraton Suites. In previous visits to Key West we stayed around Old Town, so I was a bit leery about staying so far away. However, after reading the reviews on this site we decided to go for it. BTW, locals in Key West told us that there were about 900 rooms short this season because of renovations and conversions. So, if youâ€™re a last minute planner like us, you may be out of luck getting a choice room. As others have noted on this site, the Sheraton Suites is on the other side of the island but they do have a free shuttle which takes you to the other Westin property near Mallory Square. The shuttle was crowded and there was standing room only in all the trips we took. The drivers were all locals and passed on good information to all of us â€“ they also dropped you off elsewhere if it was on the way. Still, this does lock you in to a time schedule, which is not what Key West is all about for us. Overall, I did enjoy the Sheraton Suites stay. The staff was VERY friendly and helpful. Unlike a previous review I read here, I especially found the restaurant manager, Pablo, to be quite concerned for the comfort of his guests. He was in the restaurant at all hours, and we had some good chats with him. There is also a nice pool, quiet bar, and lovely landscaping. Our room was very clean and large â€“ we got the corner suite with the balcony â€œoverlookingâ€� the ocean. However, if you look at the pictures I took you will see that a busy highway was between the balcony and the ocean (specifically, Smathers Beach). There was lots of car noise during rush hours but at night it was pretty quiet. It is also an easy walk across the street and the man-made beach was white and pretty. There are, however, no waves since the offshore reef keeps them at sea. Finally, the mattress on our king bed was just as advertised â€“ WONDERFUL! If youâ€™ve read this far you have seen me use the word â€œquietâ€� several times. I believe this would make the Sheraton Suites ideal for someone who is seeking a more restful stay, or families with children. However, we missed the nightlight and boisterous atmosphere around Duvall Streetâ€¦that is why we enjoy Key West so much. So, next time we will plan ahead a bit better and stay in a nice noisy place near Old Town.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, beach not great.. but best in Key West”
Reviews.Author: concordia7
Reviews.Content: Great BIG suites.. all rooms are 2 room suites.. so makes the time spent there convenient. Our room was very neat, clean, spacious and confortable. We enjoyed our stay here.. nothing to complain about.. a very high quality hotel. Pool was just the right size, not too busy, not too many kids. About a 10-15 min drive from Duval Street.. actually, we are glad we stayed away from that dirty old part of town.. nice to visit.. but was very happy to head back out to the Sheraton. Right across the street from the beach. (nice beach.. but not best waters) I would say this place is worth the $$ whe I compared with other places to stay in Key West.. Booked it for $299 directly with the hotel. Was listed on Orbitz at $199.. I had booked on starwood.com.. so they matched that price and also reduced it by 10% as per theur best rate gurantee. So for $180.. i don't think i could have done anything close to that quality.. 4 out of 5 stars.. Consierge was great !! always there.. always helping out with activities. Although.. having free bikes rather than 10$ would make this much better.. considering the location is PERFECT for bike rides.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, just not a beach vacation”
Reviews.Author: LisaRizz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraron Suites in Key West Florida for 6 days and 5 nights, April 2007. We had read the info on Key West before we booked our trip, so we had an idea of what it would be like. The Sheraton has recently been refurbished. The room was clean and updated, very nice suite. The hotel is across the road from Smather's beach. This is a man made beach, they bring the sand in each year from the Bahamas we were told. Bring water shoes for sure, the coral makes it rough on your feet. The water is shallow and there is a lot of coral. You can rent chairs and umbrellas there, $10 a piece for the day. The pool at the Sheraton is fine. The beach was closed a day or so while we were there because the bacteria count was high. They say that this is common since the water is shallow and without a lot of rain, the water can move and clear, so therefore the bacteria count gets high. We did rent bikes one of the days and rode down to the state park, Fort Zachary. Follow the bike route, don't walk it. Fun bike ride. The beach there is better, deeper, but again, a lot of coral. We had a lot of fun walking around the town. We did do the Conch train tour through the town. 90 minutes long, $25 a piece. Gave good info about the history and sights of Key West, Old Town. After we did the tour, we were able to go walk back to the sights we wanted to visit. We did see the Butterfly Conservatory, great place to visit if you like butterflies. $10 each to get in. We also visited the Lighthouse and Hemingway house. Both were across the street from one another. Both were $10 to get in, can get $1 off coupons at visitor's center. Do the tour at Hemingways house, free with admission, just tip the tour guide. YOu will find that tips are requested at any of the places that offer tours. We did go on the Sebago sunset cruise for $35 each. If you are a drinker and don't care that you are really just floating out on the water, not really a fun boat ride, then it is ok. We are not drinkers, so the $70 was a waste. I can see the same sunset from Mallory's Square. We did go to Mallory's square each night to see the sunset and watch the street performers. They request tips at the end as well, but many of the shows are really fun to watch and worth the tip money. It is a must see. Although we would have liked to have done the Haunted House tour and Truman's White house tour, we ran out of time. The shuttle is free from the Sheraton each day each way, but it only is on the hour. It leaves the hotel on the hour and drops you off in front of the Westin. Then at 20 after the hour it leaves the Westin and returns to the Sheraton. Only runs until 10:20 at night, after that you are a $16 taxi ride home. Now, we stayed at the Sheraton because we wanted to be at the beach, but as it turns out, since the beaches are not good, I would rather have stayed at the Westin so that I can be in the middle of everything without having to worry about the timing of the shuttle. The restaurants were fine... not too expensive. We really liked La Trattoria, Leto's, and Kelly's. In Key West, you will find chickens running everywhere....this is from the olden days when they used to have cock fighting..now those chickens just keep on reproducing......you will here at times roosters crowing at 6:30 am!! Many people love Key West, but we found that many don't . Not for kids at all... just a relaxing place to hang out, relax, learn some interesting history, eat in outdoor cafes... not a beach thing, just a relaxing kind of thing... there are a lot of bars around if you like that scene.... snorkeling is also suppose to be great, wished we had time to fit that in.....will go back, again without the kids, not right away, but in a few years and will most likely stay at the Westin instead to be in town..... one more thing.... we took a flight from Newark to Miami and then the smaller hopper to Key West... if you don't take the hopper, it is about a 4 hour drive from Miami...many people that we spoke to who took the drive instead of the hopper ...well they wished they had flown it instead... very long drive on a one lane road.... good luck!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, mediocre service”
Reviews.Author: kariMilwaukee
Reviews.Content: We spent spring break at the Sheraton Suites in Key West. The hotel is beautiful- the grounds are well maintained and the pool area is better than the ones we saw at the Hyatt and Westin downtown. The rooms were great- large and comfortable. The downsides all involved the staff. The maid service was almost not noticable. We had to clean our own glasses and pick up AFTER they had left. Avoid the restaurant. The food was sub-par and the manager didn't seem to care about our concerns. The pool towel services ended at 8pm and if you didn't have a towel, the front desk honestly just said "too bad". What a shame- the rest of the hotel is so beautiful. The best part was the free shuttle downtown. We took it every day. It was right on time and very, very convenient. The shuttle drivers were super. Loved Key West!!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a great place”
Reviews.Author: AvidTraveler07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Suites Key West Hotel during spring break and loved everything about the place. The rooms were spotless, the pool was clean, the food and drinks were good. The staff were very helpful, especially Shelly who works at the poolside bar, she's great. It's a little bit out of the way but was made close by the shuttle, which by the way, can get a bit crowded, but a taxi ride is fairly inexpensive. All in all, I highly recommend this place....it truly made our stay in the Keys a pleasure. As a matter of fact, the next time I'm in Key West, I'll be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful lush grounds”
Reviews.Author: tfminn
Reviews.Content: stayed here for spring break '07. We were surpised to find when we arrived that hardly any of the rooms have balconies. We chose a room overlooking the pool and had to pay an additional $50 a night, but it was well worth it. Not sure I would stay here, without a balcony. The only other balconies overlook the ocean, but there is a busy road between the hotel and the beach. From our room we could enjoy listening to the soloist who played easy listening music during happy hour. The pool and grounds were very nice and well kept. Very lush and tropical. The only downer were the roosters that woke us up at 5:00 a.m. every morning. The first night we called the front desk to see if someone could shoo them away from the courtyard near our room, but it was to no avail. We later found out that the roosters are everywhere in key west and are considered just "part of the experience". We found the food and service there to be subpar. The breakfast buffet was not very enticing. Everything was cold and the french toast was hard, as if it had been sitting there for hours. Our waiter pushed us into getting the $15 buffet, indicating that to order off the menu would take at least 1/2 hour. Not worth it. The beach is across the street, but there are no beach chairs provided by the hotel, they cost $10 a day. The sand is soft and it is a nice beach, although the road runs adjacent to it and is somewhat noisy. We drove our rental car into town instead of taking the shuttle, but parking is hard to come by and everything is metered. 10 cents gets you a single minute on the meter. We found key west to be not exactly the place for children. Ours are 4 and 7 and there really wasn't much for them to do other than hang out at the pool. It is really geared more towards shopping and night life. Mallory square for sunset was wonderful, lots of shows to watch and a lot going on.
