Overall this is a nice hotel, the beds were very comfortable and came with wonderful plush down pillows. The rooms were big and the bathrooms were all redone with granite and new woodwork. A nice quiet place (except for the roosters!). ;)

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly and CLEAN!”
Reviews.Author: 4wolfpups
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during Spring Break - Mar 9-13. We had two suites that connected and had six people total, 2 adults and 4 kids( 18,16, 13 and 10). I did ask for an upgrade upon check-in b/c I am a Starwood member, but they could not accomodate that. Rooms were at the back end of the complex, so no view, but they were nice inside and CLEAN! We weren't in them except to sleep anyway. I was worried about the number of college spring breakers there, but never had a problem. They were all well behaved and polite. The beach across the street is great and the pool area is nice, small but we never had a problem getting a lounge chair. We ate lunch and breakfast at the hotel one time each and the food was fine. There are so many wonderful restaraunts in Key West that we ate in town for the most part. I found the staff to be very friendly. While it is not the most luxurious hotel I have ever stayed in, it was perfect for our getaway and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Every Penny...”
Reviews.Author: JanineWilliam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights and it can only be described as the perfect hotel to stay at in Key West...! The hotel provides complimentary shuttle service to downtown Key West approximately every hour during the day and drops you off right at Mallory Square... The property itself is an absolute PARADISE!!! Very plush with many types of flowers, trees and bushes native to only the Keys.. You may even spot a small chameleon run across the sidewalk in front of you as you stoll through the beautifully landscaped courtyard. The hotel is across the street from Smathers Beach and offers a beautiful white sandy beach, available for lounging in the sun (Complimentary lounge chairs) or just going for a stroll. They have other watersports they offer(for a fee)-we took advantage of parasailing..celebrated daughters 18th birthday (born in Key West!) on this day and the captain went the extra mile to make sure it was a day she will never forget!! The rooms are spectacular!! Ours had direct oceanview... rooms are spacious and VERY clean... The shower is the largest one I have ever seen!! All marble counters and shower in bathroom... They welcome small pets and even give a welcome gift for your pet at check in! I would definitely stay here each time I visit Key West...this hotel is so much nicer (and the staff is fantastic!) than some of the more expensive hotels in Key West itself!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: schmay65
Reviews.Content: My husband & I arrived about 11pm on March 3rd. The staff at the front desk were wonderful. When I explained to them we were on our honeymoon they upgraded our room to a king suite oceanview room. The room was fabulous. It was spacious, clean and well lit. I was a bit concerned when I saw our room was next to the elevator, but I never heard it. The shuttle to downtown was great as I knew parking would be a challenge. The entire staff was welcoming during our stay. The grounds were well maintained and very clean. I would recommend this hotel without a doubt. When we travel to Key West again, we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding week in key west”
Reviews.Author: Mrstevewarsaw
Reviews.Content: Spent new years week at the sheraton suites and overall my fiance and I had a wonderful week. Booked the hotel through the starwood website and this seemed to be one of the last places available as we were kind of last-minute with our reservations. The only complaint about the hotel was the doubling of price for Dec. 30 and 31st. I guess if you "want to play you got to pay" for new years' weekend in Key West. The last 5 nights of our stay was 189$ per night which we thought was very fair given the time of year. I had not read any reviews of this place prior to our stay and was suprised to hear peoples' complaints. Other than a few guys doing some painting and some construction supplies in the parking lot, the hotel seemed to have most of the renovatons complete. Our room was very spacious and clean. Everything seemed brand new, especially the bathroom. Housekeeping was perfect all week with turndown service, towels and chocolates each night. As we always seemed to get a late start to the day(lots of KW rumrunners) the room was cleaned daily between 12-2pm. The shuttle service was never late all week! I know for sure they had 2 busses on new years eve and the riders we were with did not mind standing for the short 10 minute ride. Some have complained about the hotel being 2-3 miles from downtown but one thing we did was bring our bicycles with us on or trip. The bike ride never seemed to be strenuous or long(not many hills in KW) and you get to see everything on KW when you are on a bike! Found a roller hockey rink a half mile away from the hotel and got to watch a couple games for free- a nice treat. Did not eat at the hotel so cannot comment there. I did think that the poolside bar closed a bit early, but there are so many bars open till 3am it did not matter(be careful on your bike here!) One thing I must comment on that is not horel related is the restaurant service level you can expect in KW. At best I feel it is a 50/50 chance at EVERY place you go to! After reading 100's of reviews I think I am not alone on this issue. The price of your dinner will NOT reflect the service given at any time. Saw great attitudes and food at O.B.'s for $17 and saw totally average service at commodores for $180! If you consider yourself a discerning traveller beware of the laid-back attitude of KW, sometimes it is the best thing and other times it is not. Overall we enjoyed our stay and want to return and explore some of the other things the keys has to offer, as we definateley had our fill of booze and bars on this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: ACYcouple
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Suites Jan. 15-20. At first we were concerned with the location being so far from Duval St. and the mixed reviews on the rooms, but it was great! We got to party as much as we wanted then come back and sleep in peace and quiet. One day my husband finally woke me up around noon! I know there are some reviews that trash the rooms, but ours was beautiful and comfortable. Being across the street from a beautiful beach was also great. Besides, the shuttle service is very helpful, it's only the really late nights you need a cab. At the front desk, Hazem is wonderful! He is the person to see for anything, even information about traveling in Europe! We enjoyed ourselves so much that my husband and his brother are going fishing in Key West soon and they will be staying at the Sheraton also.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but not worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: NYHolley
Reviews.Content: There does not seem to be any more problems with construction and we had a relatively quiet stay. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The room was very nice, clean - great bathroom. The "kitchen" area was strictly for coffee and did not have so much as a spoon but a quick trip to the supermarket solved that. You can get an ocean view but the road is between the ocean and hotel so it can be a bit noisy. We had a pool view which was great and mostly quiet except for the bar music during happy hour. All in all it was a great place to stay - but is was not worth the $469.00 per night that is charged over a holiday week. The rates are quite a bit lower at other times.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JP2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our wedding and it was worth every penny!! They upgraded us to a room with a ocean view when we said it was our wedding. So nice and helpful! Great cusotmer service and I would not want to stay anywhere else if we went back. Close to shops but not in a busy area.

HotelInfo.Name: Sheraton Suites Key West
HotelInfo.Address: 2001 South Roosevelt Boulevard, Key West, FL 33040
